title: Very Convenient & Cheaper alternative to city taxis in busy traffic to & from Suvarnabhumi International Airpor.
review: The Airport Rail Link is great if you know where you are going and "provided" your not carrying any more than 2 suitcases (andor Children) either to & from the airport can be quite frustrating exiting downup stairs (Note some lifts are available @ most locations for wheel chair and even some locations have escalators @ various stops)  Chances are you may have to get a taxi to your hotelshops as it maybe a 10mins or longer walk and avoid avoided during peak times like morning (Before 1000am as most shops open from 1000am to 1000pm) & late afternoon after 530pm as city people use it to go home via this rail link

title: the rail to Bangkok
review: The fastest way to get into Bangkok It is clean easy to understand and allows you to interact with the locals Took us almost to the door of the hotel

title: Good way to get to airport
review: Dont pay a fortune foe a taxi this is a good clean and safe way to travel Signage is good and unlike many BKK taxi drivers the driver knows where he is going

title: Very convenient and cheap
review: These trains are very moderately priced and convenient as an added bonus many of the stations coenside with the BTS system making getting to many places a breeze and is a far cheaper option than a taxi

title: Easy
review: Took the train from the airport Was fast and easy Really convenient for getting to and fro  The stops were announced as well as displayed

title: Fast and efficient for less than 2 people
review: If you are single or have few bags this is the way to go  The train stops at Phaya thai station  the end of the line  then 2 stops to SIAM where MBK SIAM PARAGON and most shopping is and if going to Sala Daeng or Silom this is also the station to change at  120 baht does it all  If more than 2 get a taxi unless it is peak hour 4pm onwards then the train is faster  Do not take alot of luggage as there are too many people and no room

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to use just as quick as a taxi and connects to the buses and BTS I stay in the north of BBK and can ge there in one hour of only $300

title: Great alternative to Bangkok traffic jams
review: I definitely recommend this train You don't even half to leave the airport just walk downstairs It's very cheap too compared to taxis and airconditioned and quick Have used it twice now and will again Can't wait till there is one to Don Muang as well

title: Great Value. Easy to use.
review: We are cheap travelers so instead of paying a taxi to get to the city center (approx 700B) we took the ARL (approx 90B for two of us)  The ARL connects easily with the BTS and MRT along the line so you can basically get anywhere from it  We took it from airport and back Saved us about 1400B approx i think It gets a little crowded during peak hours but we were able to do it with all of our luggage with little problem

title: Very Modern and Efficient.
review: The Airport Rail Link is very similar to the BTS Skytrain and travels between the international airport and the BTS The Rail Link is clean efficient quiet and safe

title: Great transportation.
review: Fast efficient and inexpensive I would definitely use this again It was clean and very easy to navigate as well

title: Great
review: Got this from the airport into the city was really good and quick journey Very cheap However Bangkok is much bigger than people think Do check how far your accommodation is from here their maps are a little disproportionate and it was much further than we thought to walk  Backpackers trying to get there for cheaper and being unorganised about it

title: Cheap and efficient
review: If you need to get to the centre of Bangkok use the airport express which interlinks to the MTR at Phaya Thai uou can then get to most places quite easily  Cost is 90 baht for two people (bargain)

title: Do it
review: It's was easy  Neither my son nor I spoke the language and this was our first visit  Just follow the signs  A few coins and your on Clean and fast  We went  down town got off found a hotel   Same thing back to the airport  Very modern comfortable and [plenty  of room  We traveled light found seats and used it to visit different parts of the city   Jump off explore the next  part of town Will do it again  So much cheaper than cabs

title: Easiest way to travel from the airport
review: The best way to travel from Subarnabhumi International Airport to Bangkok Central After a early morning flight tiring flight this link offers easy access to central bangkok

title: Easy and cheap
review: 45 bht (~12€) from airport to Paya Thai Ticket machine is easy to use and it's easy to find there Great way to travel and saves money

title: Not much of an attraction but good transport!
review: An easy convenient and cheap way to get into the city Certainly much better than taking the taxi or a bus Gets you till Phayathai station from where you can take the BTS and go anywhere in Bangkok

title: No fuss travel city to airport
review: Ideal for a quick hassle free trip to the airport straight into the terminal no hassle Its what you need at 6am  As with most public transport its not expensive

title: Time saver
review: Wish we had used this the first time we arrived saves so much time as you are not sitting in traffic

title: Excellent Service and transfer to airport
review: Excellent way to stay in town and go out to the airport Cheap  Safe  Fast  AC  You can transfer to it a various stations  Just go online first and you will be totally comfortable using it

title: Great for singles and couples.
review: Cheap and fast a great addition to public transport ) Airport Rail Link are comprised of 2 lines nonstop Express services and City Train services Both lines operate from 0600 am – midnight

title: Great mode of transportation!
review: The airport rail link was very accessible The train station is connected to the airport which makes it very convenient to travellers The fare is very affordable as compared to using a taxi to get to the airport Highly recommended

title: ArtBox market
review: if u travel by this rail dont miss one this spot "Artbox bangkok" stop at makkasan station  there is market lot of them sale local produk you can eat n shooping here too and dont forget to bring umbrella because now raining season here in bangkok  visit fb for more info "Artboxbangkok"

title: Fantastic service.  Cheap and frequent.
review: Title says it all  We used it to get to China Town (Praya Thai stop where it terminates then a taxi for 100 baht)  Cost of train was 45 baht each each way  We have also used this train in the past to get to and from our hotel in Suhkumvit via Makasan

title: Quick and Easy Train to/from Airport
review: Easy access to the train from both airport and city terminals  Good connectivity with the mass transit system (BTS) in Bangkok  Can be crowded on the commuter service as the ticket is cheap

title: good way to travel to airport
review: This ttrain takes very short time Very clean Fast way to get to the airport Ticket also very cheap

title: Save Your Money Take The Link
review: I wish more cities had such a outstanding rail and subway system such as Bangkok Save the 300 800 THB and take the train its the only way to get to Shwanabum

title: Good way into Bangkok
review: A good alternative to reach Bangkok city center during rush hours We opt to go by train back to the airport one change in between which is quite a long walk but 35 min and we reached the airport ok

title: bai
review: This is a great service  mucheasier than bus or taxi  very cheap as well  only takes about 40 minutes to get to the city

title: Very easy and safe
review: This is a great way to get to the airport the cost is minimal and offers a direct service there Depending where you get in the train you might have to change once but other than that it is fast clean safe and very easily navigated Trust me you don't want to be stuck in the traffic in Bangkok

title: Easy
review: Quick and easy air con  only 30 minutes from Ratchaparop station to airport  Trains run regularly

title: Fast and convenient
review: Easy and fast way to get to the airport without getting stuck in trafic convenient if you do not have too much luggage

title: Very convenient when travelling light
review: A very convenient inexpencive and fast option to get to Sky Train in the center of Bangkok But then you might still need to take a taxi to get to your final destination unless you are familiar with the bus routes

title: Easy access to prayha Thai station one stop from the hotel
review: Express train now cancelled but the all stops train is still great  only 45 baht one way  Get off at prayha Thai station and take one stop to ratchewhi station and hotel is only 30 m from step of station

title: Best Way To Get from Airport to City Centre
review: Don't get a taxi from the airport Not as quick or not as cheap 45 baht (€125) to get to Phaya Thai and about €2 then in a metered taxi from there to Grand Palace or Kho San Road Extremely clean method of transport too

title: Efficient and Cheap Service
review: Bangkok Airport Rail link is a very cheap and convenient mode of transportation between Bangkok City and Suvarnabhumi International Airport provided one is travelling light Though no problem in carriage of luggage till Airport Platform but on reaching Phaya Thai Station in Bangkok trains have to be changed and shifting of heavy luggage is a problem which is further compounded in case you have to exit the station or any other station of Bangkok Metro as rarely you would find electric escalators for exiting from the platform  metro station in case of heavy luggage don’t rely on Airport Rail Link and go for metered Taxi but having said that Bangkok Airport Rail link is an efficient yet cheap mode of transportation between the airport and Bangkok City and I prefer Blue Colour MRT as it costs 45 THB and travelling time till the terminal station Phaya Thai is around 35 – 40 minutes while Red Colour MRT costs a lot more and time difference is hardly 15 minutes

title: Use this on Friday evening
review: In case your flight is scheduled on Friday evening make sure you travel by Airport city link to avoid heavy traffic Very good service Changeover at Phayathai BTS to connect to Airport city link

title: Perfect & Quick
review: When arriving at Suvarnabhumi International Airport this is by far the quickest and safest way to get to the centre of Bangkok It is clean safe and hassle free Just follow the signs from the arrival hall and you will easily reach the basement floor from where the Phaya Thai train link departs  arrives It cost only THB45 per person and the duration is approximately 30 minutes Of course also easy and quick if you have to travel from the city to the airport Very tourist friendly and  highly recommended

title: The Best & Cheapest Way To Get Into Bangkok
review: The is definately the way to go if needing to go into Bangkok from the airport or vice versa  It is very reasonable and pretty quick depending on the time of day They even have an express train that leaves at different times during the day If you are traveling on a budget and not in a big hurry this is the way to get into the city or back to Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: High Speed, clean and safe.
review: Once you have cleared customs take a escalator or lift to the 1st floor you will see a Kiosk You need to use the Right Hand Side of the Kiosk  Ask for a Ticket to Praya Thai this will take to you the Sky Train interlink for onward travel to a station near your hotel  There are two trains the Express and the Local Train as I call it The Express train will transport you from Bangkok Airport to Bangkok City at High Speed in a very clear and air conditioned manner The Local Train will do the same but there are 7 stops  There are usually plenty of seats I have travelled on both trains 4 times and have found no need to queue for a taxi anymore unless you are going to Pattaya  If you are going to Pattaya then do not use this Airport link as it takes you in the opposite direction and no where near Pattaya you need a taxi maybe things will change in the future  The Airport Link is welcome addition to a truly inspiring and transformational city

title: Do it
review: This is the best way to get to your hotel Cost 45 baht per person and takes 30 minutes Links to the bts which will take you near to most central hotels

title: Fast, convenient, comparatively cheap.
review: It's probably the best and most easy way to get from the airport to the city centre Even if you have never been to Bangkok before you will be able to use it as everything is wellexplained and wellsignposted There is a direct connection to the Skytrain which is just as convenient as the ARL

title: Great way to travel
review: Got tired of paying for taxi to Sukumvhit every time I go to Bangkok This time I took the train to Makassan station Awesome hassle free trip for 35 bhat Than caught MRT to Sukumvhit for 16 bhat Than walked 3 minutes to my hotel on Soi 21Total travel time around 30 minutes This is the way to go Also don't have to sit in traffic for an hour

title: What's not to like?
review: Air con 20 min journey ideal location for sukhumvit travellers  Best bit  35thb a ticket Complete avoidance of the bangkok taxi drivers most of which are only out to try and scam the foreigners

title: Quiet and cheap
review: Works well cheap and clean really good aircon to keep you Kool Easy to buy tickets at the airport and when we used it at nite was not packed so got a seat easily

title: Cheap, clean, fast, safe
review: My title says it all cheap clean safe safe Takes about 30 minutes to downtown Bangkok Express is even faster Great view of the city Best ride ever No need to searchbargain with taxi drivers refusing to turn on their meters targeting tourists  Do not use taxis without a meter I was scammed So take care

title: most convenient
review: Its the most convenient way for a transfer mode to suwarnabhumi airportSave you a lot of time and money tooIts feed back is shut down after midnight and not operated from all areasBut service is good and in every 510min you will find them so no need to hurry for missing one

title: A breeze to ride on the airport rail
review: It was a breeze to ride on the airport city rail  We boarded the airport rail from Suvarnabhumi airport to Makkasan  We alighted here and walked for about 10mins towards Petchaburi MRT via a skyway  We got off at the next station Sukhumvit  The total fare was 60 Baht and total time taken from airport to our hotel was under 1hr  It was a smooth ride without any traffic jam

title: The fast way to travel to town
review: This service takes you from the airport directly to town the trains are airconditioned have TV and comfortable seating the service is very economical it only costs 35 Baht to take you to Makkasan where you can connect to the MRT underground of 50 Baht to take you Phaya Thai where you can connect with the Sky train the Airport Link has ample space in each carriage for your luggage it is truly great value for the money when you consider it only takes less than 30 minutes to get you to the centre of Bangkok

title: The best connection to city center
review: Fast clean cheap not overcrowded connection to Phaya Thai where you can take a taxi hop on a bus or BTS For those who prefer public transport the most recommended choice

title: A Model For All Large Cities To Follow
review: One of the world's most efficient userfriendly costeffective and pleasant modes of transport This is the best way to get tofrom the airport The PA system announces each stop clearly and the electronic board also indicates each stop in both Thai and English While the rail link does not go all the way into the center of Bangkok there are plenty of places the link reaches and combined with the metro (MRT) it is fairly easy to reach one of the rail link's stations

title: cheap and easy
review: its an easy and cheap way from the bangkok airport to the city Easy to find in the airport but no public bus or skytrain in the city station taxis drivers dont want switch on the meter and the fix price is much to high

title: Bangkok rail link
review: Great way to get downtown from the airport  and inexpensive However if you have a few suitcases it can be a bit awkward

title: Good & Price worthy
review: Very good to travel and avoid heavvy traffic of BangkokEasy access to airport in a very good time span in affordable price

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Used Express line and City line both  Absurdly as it is useful because it come directly inside the airport 25 min from checkins and 5 min from binary of BTS of PayaThai  Price is not expensive for Express line very cheap for City Line

title: It's not that daunting!
review: Taxis are usually easy and not that expensive to go most places in Bangkok but if you like public transportation like I do the Airport Rail Link is a good inexpensive way to get to places that are near to the BTS andor MRT  Just know which station you need to get to and follow the signs leading down to the bottom level and the Rail Link  You can only buy tickets here for stops along the Rail Link then if you transfer to the BTS at Phaya Thai or the MRT at Makkasan then purchase those tickets there  There is an express train from the airport to Makkasan but I could never see the value in that  Enjoy getting immersed into the fantastic Thai life if not too tired and it's not too late and you don't have too much luggage They do stop running late at night be sure to check

title: fastest way to airport
review: It is very convenient if you have small luggage as you probably have to take the stairs only about 30 mins by rapid train much cheaper than a taxi which can cost you upto 400 baht including toll way pass

title: quick
review: its amazing how one used to take hours to get to the city and now it is only 30 mins  smooth and quick  easy to use with directions provided

title: Safe, Fast, Cheap and Comfortable
review: When a transport is modern in very good conditions and also safe  fast  very cheap(unless you only do one or two stops because the price it's the always the same) and comfortable you must give 5stars

title: Fast, reliable and easy to navigate.
review: We had a hotel close to a Skytrain (BTS) station The BTS trains and other public transportations link at Phaya That station (which is the final stop) and crossing over to these are easy It is much quicker than a taxi (Bangkok traffic is horrendous) and much cheaper You also get to see a some of the city from the windows Frequent departures in both directions

title: Cheap, easy, fast and efficient
review: Arriving in Bangkok for the first time we found this an easy way to get into the city and then change onto the BTS skytrain to get to our hotel N worries about being ripped off by taxis or about getting stuck in the famous Bangkok traffic

title: Would use again!
review: Used the City Line one way and the Express back Both good and if you have the time the city line is a lot cheaper

title: A very fast way to come from a-b during rush hour
review: I really enjoy it to take the Skytrain If you know the city and the map of the Skytrain then It's a very fast way to come around in the city The ticket vending machines cannot rip you of like a taxi driver It's a little bit expensive and I think that's the reason that the temperature inside the Skytrain is freezing

title: good transportation
review: excellent service a bit crowded but fast and reliable the train is clean and the time schedule is good

title: if you fly with Thai: check in here
review: Amazing in the years since it started most tourists do njot realize the advatage of the railway link Most important At Makkasan is a check in I checked in there for my late evening flight in the afternoon I was the ONLY person So had not to wait and got quit of my luggage and had myboarding card So i could the rest of the day relax and had no long ques in the evening but went from my taxi straight to  the immigration (Have heard Railway link is under reconstruction now But perhaps the check in still works Just check if you can use it

title: Pyathai
review: Very nice airport link form the international airport to pyathai station from here you can take the skytrain to all directions where you want to be Very good for the backpackers and the people how come often in Bangkok

title: Max 2 persons otherwise take a taxi
review: Expensive when you're with a family better take a taxi Traveling to the airport and beat rush hour better take the train to avoid traffic jam

title: Very efficient service.
review: We can not speak highly enough of this system   Very well sign posted throughout the airport   Easy ticket facilities to use   Very frequent service   Clean tidy and not too busy even at rush hour   A security check was made every time it arrived at the airport which made you feel safe  Only 45 baht each from airport to the last stop Amazing value

title: Excellent frequency, great connectivity, fast and cheap, too!
review: A real relief and a surefire way to avoid BKK traffic jams while getting into the heart of the city  I travel to BKK often on business and this has saved me not only money but also tons of time especially during the recent periods of unrest when entire roads were blocked off

title: The best way to get into town
review: This is probably the best way to get into town if where every you are going to has a BTS station  The only other alternative is to get on over priced taxis at airports or possibly get stuck in the traffic jam

title: BEST WAY TO TRANSFER FROM AIRPORT TO BANGKOK
review: This was the first time we have used the BTS to get from Suvarnabhumi Aiport into Bangkok City and will never catch a Taxi again Just try and make sure you choose a hotel which is close to the City Line on the BTS We stayed at the Baiyoke Sky (fabulous hotel) We caught the BTS Sky train which leaves from inside the Airport very regularly and took us approximately 25 minutes to get to the Ratchaprarop Station which is the second last station on the line and it cost us Thb40 eachcompared to anything up to Thb700 in a Taxi which takes over an hour or more in traffic

title: Airport to Chatrium Riverside
review: This is the cheapest and fastest way to get to the hotel  the train takes you from the airport to a station about 1 km from the hotel as you get off the train walk towards the river for about 3 minutes and the hotel boat will take you directly to the hotel dock

title: finally
review: After many years finally i had the chance to try it Great service BTS standard in 20 minutes u are downtown (for 35 bath) avoiding the taxi scums and the traffic jam Love it

title: Easy ride to the airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is a very useful way of getting to the airport Even with suitcases it is quite easy to manage Just be sure to follow all the signs to make sure you get to the station from Phaya Thai Lifts will also help you

title: first and cheap
review: I always use Airport Link and BTS train to go to hotel when I travel to Bangkok and arrive before 1100 at night It's first and cheap you should use these when you stay hotel near BTS station and when you come to Thai by personal vacation

title: An excellent way to travel to Bangkok from city.
review: this is an excellent mode of travel from Bangkok airport to city the fare upto Phon Thai station is 45 bath for normal train and higher fare(donot remember now) for direct train however i would recommend to go with normal train it makes only 57min difference From Phon Thai station one can get connections to other MRT stations easily I found this link much easier to use than taxis  if you want to go to center of bangkok say Sukhumvit then with taxis you may end up in traffic jams this is not with the rail link this link is less costly too

title: Save Money and use the train
review: We only discovered in 2013 how convenient the train is to get to our hotel We stayed in the Baitoke Sky hotel and we took the trai it cost us 40 baht one way where a taxy would cost about 700 to 1000 baht It was only a 10min walk to the hotel  Just see how far you are from the station and hop on its worth it

title: Great service
review: I took it fairly late at  night  Finding the express line was a Lyle difficult as the signage was confusing  But once on it it simple fast and efficient

title: Convenient
review: This is a very useful way for us to visit many famous attractions in Banhkok in the fastest way Not only cheap but also very fast

title: Convenient, good price
review: Pros The most convenient way of getting to the town from the Suvarnabhumi airport if you are staying somewhere on Sukhumvit or Silom Road No need to go outside of airport building just few floors down Easy to buy tickets using machines There are always some officers offering help at info desk Train is very modern clean and air conditioned Lots of space for baggage   Cons you cannot buy one ticket from airport to Asok station for example You have to buy one ticket to Phaya Thai station and then you have to buy another ticket to Asok This can be improved    If you are staying on Khao San Road (near Grand Palace) then this option is not suitable for you

title: Convenient that any other option/if have small luggage
review: It is in the basement of Suvarnabhumi airport BKK Just go downstairs through escalator or lift in the basement you will find the station just pick the ticket and you are in train for journey Choose the Blue line it is cheap only 35bath from APT to city payathai here you can change with BTS Skytrain to the major city Other option is red line that is expensive and connect APT to Makassan direct and here you may choose taxi for onwards or MRT line which is far beyond and you may not carry your big luggage still then

title: Forget the 200baht taxi ride use this!
review: I wish it was 247 but it stops running around 1am but if you need to get into or out of Bkk then this is the fastest way without worrying about the traffic in Bang Kapi It ends at Phraya Thai and that stop is in between Victory monument and Siam Paragon

title: The best way to town
review: This is a fantastic rail link that was just opened There are two trains with the express going straight to a Skytrain hookup The other train stops at every station for locals and only goes as far as Makasson Station From there follow the crowd to the subway

title: Very easy transport to the city
review: Very easy comfortable quick and also cheap transportation option from airport to the city center Only one note  it would be more better if they will build one more stop more close to the historical city center  somewhere around democracy monument

title: Convenient and clean
review: The trains stations and platforms were clean Buying a ticket was convenient and easy enough The airport rail link probably requires a lot more room for luggagesbackpacks though

title: Easy transportation to the city
review: I found the ARL really help me The best transportation if you arrive in Survanabhumi and want to continue to the city Suitable for backpaker and anyone who travel lite It's connected withe several BTS and MRT station so you can easily transfer to BTS or MRT and explore Bangkok city Operation hour 600  2400 Location basement floor

title: Quick and easy
review: I found that the Airport rail link was an easy way to get from the airport to my hotel and back The cost was reasonable and the service efficient It was a little difficult to connect with the subway at one of the main stations as you had to leave the station and walk a block and a half to the subway and the signage was poor but you just follow the others and have faith and lo and behold there it is the subway If you have a lot of luggage it would be challenging but otherwise it was very easy Cabs are pricy and the traffic is absurd so this is a great option

title: Easy airport connection to the MRT of BTS
review: There are 3 different unique train lines that leave from the airport make sure you are getting on the right one  1) Makkasan Express  Nonstop that connects to the MRT 2) Phaya Thai City Line  Stops at multiple places on the way to the Phaya Thai BTS 3) Phaya Thai Express  Nonstop that connects to the BTS  I took the Phaya Thai City Line at 45 Bhat from the Airport to the Phaya Thai BTS it was relatively comfortable but felt like a normal innercity train (plastic seats no place for luggage etc)  I then took the Phaya Thai Express to the Airport at 90 Bhat (150 Bhat for a Roundtrip Ticket) this train had luggage storage was nonstop very smooth very fast and had comfortable seats  This felt like a longdistance train  I highly recommend using the airport link as it is fast and will likely save you money  However the airport link is not a good idea under the following circumstances a) if you are a group bigger than 2 a taxi is likely better value b) If your hotel is not near to the BTS and you have luggage Bangkok is hot c) you have large luggage there are a lot of stairs small gates for the BTS walking  If you just have a carryonbag your hotel is right next to a BTS stop and you are 2 people or less the Phaya Thai Express (nonstop) is a great way to get tofrom the airport and the city  Also remember that the Express runs every 30 minutes (on the half hour and hour when leaving Phaya Thai)

title: Good and cheap travel options
review: If you need to get to or from the BKK main airport the Airport Rail Link is a good option You will take the BTS to Phaya Thai and then buy a token for the airport rail link  just 45 baht Can't beat the price The ride is about 1hour and you may end up standing but people do exit so you may get lucky and have a seat free up

title: Very comfortable and cheap
review: This is the best way to get into the downtown Without traffic jam comfortable and cheap I like this transportation method

title: Simply the best to get to the downtown
review: No matter we can not use credit card to buy the ticket or it is not integrated into other Bangkok public transport it is best way to get into the downtown Very convenient and efficient Easy to get on and change to other lines

title: Loved the  Rail Link Connection
review: I used the Ariport Link  to Suvarnabhumi and was delighted with the connection   Less than  29 minutes  and you are at Suvarnabhumi  when connecting from Phyathai   Smooth and effortless was the journey despite having a grand baggage and a backpack which otherwise by Cab would first be haranguing with the driver on the approximate fare and then into the traffic stressing out if you would get to the Airport on time Should it be a metered taxi you will be sure that the route taken will first cost you time and then  taken for a  round about ride with ever true  traffic situation  and so an altered path which will definitely not be faster but for sure expensive   Wherever you are in Bangkok and think of getting to the Suvarnabhumi Airport on time and at a reasonable cost I would certainly suggest getting to the nearest BTS and connect to Phyathai  where you can easily interchange with the Airport rail link The best part is yet to come It's just THB 49 for the Airport link fee travelling in comfort   and with the assurance that you will reach in the stipulated time   WoW This is definitely my most recommended route getting back to Suvarnabhumi in total comfort and avoiding the hefty price that would otherwise be levied by the various taxi services

title: great way to get from airport to city
review: too the train from the airport to the city directly from the terminal an back station also has a passage to Novotel at Bangkok airport cost is THB3500

title: Cheap option
review: If you are familiar with Bangkok and do not have too much luggage this is a great cheap way to get to and from the airport Super efficient way to get around

title: Easy to use, fast, and cheap - but you need to pay cash
review: This is a great airport train line fast comfortable inexpensive with ticket machines which are REALLY easy to use (and speak English)  Disadvantages relatively limited number of stations and ticket machines only accept cash (notes or coins) although they do give change

title: Amazing and beautifully decorated nice service you can visit any time  to get train.
review: Amazing and beautifully decorated nice service you can visit any time  to get train  Would like to give 5 star ratimg

title: Easy way to get from airport to Bangkok
review: We used the Rail link to get from the airport to Bangkok and found it super easy to use and cheaper than a taxi  Would definitely recommend people try it if you want an easy way to experience more of the local people and to save some moneyand not deal with traffic

title: Yes Yes Yes
review: Once I used it I did not stop  Getting anywhere around Bangkok this is the best was to travel once you arrive at the Airport  If you have too many bags don't do it as its better to take a taxi  As I normally just have a backpack I get on the airport link to either Phil Thai as it links with the skytrain or get off at Markasaan which links to the underground

title: Cheap and comfy
review: Cheap and comfy to get tofrom airport  Lots of place to keep a stroller seat and transparent windows to enjoy the city view while riding

title: Perfect solution
review: This is perfect solution to get transferred from or to the airport it cost you only 44bath until the town

title: Aug 2022 14 day visit
review: I was able to navigate the Rail Link system with ease having never been to Bangkok before System is clean and easy to utilize A great costeffective and timeefficient alternative to taxis

title: Best way to beat the monsoon weather.
review: I always use the airport link whenever possible On my most recent trip I left immigration just as heavy monsoon rains hit Bangkok City The roads outside were at an absolute standstill with huge traffic jams everywhere The rail link just chugs onn through to the city and thb 40 beats a stranded thb 400 taxi any day

title: The only way to travel into BKK!
review: Taxino way The Airport Rail link is so so much better and you won't get ripped off by some unscrupulous taxi driver claiming his meter doesn't work etc etc We were only in Bangkok for a few hours so timings were very important Trains run about every 15 minutes are clean and security checked prior to passengers being allowed on The journey to the terminus took about 35 minutes from the airport and cost I think  45 baht each way Ticket machines can be used in both Thai or English and are simple to use but there can be quite long queues The journey will be quiet as most people have their heads buried in mobile phones It was relating to this that my only complaint arose and it's certainly not the fault of the train company There are priority seats meant for the elderly disabled etc Unfortunately  people( and I have to say mainly young people) take no notice of the priority seat signs and even when an elderly lady fainted one person refused to give up their seatshame on you

title: Inter Connection Express Line
review: Air Port Link Connects from Phaya Thai to the Suvanarbhumi airport with Skytrain and MRT Express LineAll trains are cleanon timefaster and cheaper than grab taxisIt is the best route to get from Bangkok Mega city to the BKK Airport You do not need to worry about traffic unexpected taxi drivers high way fee or fixed metersTrains are often very full and not just at rush hoursVery comfortable and reasonable cost to reach your time

title: Easy Network to Use
review: This German built rail network is fast and reliable and links to all the main Sky Train stations You have to use a machine (which you can select English) to obtain a plastic token for 45 Thb(£110)This allows you to travel to the main hub for your Sky Train onward journey Follow the BTS signs for the station you require  a bit like the London Underground It is the fastest way to travel in busy Bangkok but try to avoid the rush hours if you have luggage as the trains tend to be very busy

title: Get this not the taxis!
review: This is the only way you should travel into Bangkok   Well maintained air conditioned runs in time   Taxi drivers will almost always try to over charge and if they do use the meter will sometimes try to suggest you gave them the wrong currency (Vietnamese in my case)   The foreign exchange desks by the station in the basement of the airport also offer fantastic rates

title: So easy to use
review: Providing I'm not in a hurry or arriving in the am hours the Airport Rail Link is fantastic Some times you just don't feel like haggling with some thieving taxi driver that thinks everyone is a sucker The trains are new regular and quick

title: Great transport mode
review: Best way to beat chaotic traffic of Bangkok It's convenient clean inexpensive & ontime I took it one time when I transited for 8 hours in Suvarnabumi Managed to get to the city had great dinner & back to the airport for next flight

title: good experience
review: We tried Aiport Rail Link to our hotel very cheap and comfortable i saw a lot of tourist use this one useful and clean

title: Practical and fast
review: If you want to impress your partner with an $85 limo ride from the airport (as I tried last year) and sit in traffic for 6090 mins and watch the other smaller taxis do the same then fill your boots This year we took the rail with our luggage and got into town in 20 minutes  Now I must admit that the 2 km ride from the downtown Makissan Station to our hotel took some time because it was Friday night (10PM) and taxis were hard to find The rail link ticket was only 35 baht and was easy access from airport arrivals  Need direction ask anyone Rolling the luggage was no problem on the conveyor escalators Will use again without question  Returning to the airport was a breeze several days later and took us 30 mins including taxi to the Makissan Sta

title: The easiest and cheapest way to get to Downtown Bangkok and back to the airport.
review: Easiest Way to Go to Airport & Downtown Bangkok The easiest and cheapest way to get to Downtown Bangkok and Airport For just about 50 baht you can go to the end station that connect to the sky train You can get to the Airport Compare that to 500 Baht via Taxi and Traffic

title: Fast & efficient
review: By far the best transit system I have ever used it is clean and like most services in Thailand really not expensive

title: Easiest Way to Go to Airport & Downtown Bangkok
review: The easiest and cheapest way to get to Downtown Bangkok and Airport For just 35 baht to Makassan you can get to the Airport Compare that to 500 Baht via Taxi and Traffic

title: Wonderful connection
review: Wonderful connection saves time money and the traffic chaos of Bangkok So if in a hurry and want to reach airport faster hop on to the Airport Rail Link

title: Cheap and Convenient
review: The cheapest way to travel to and from the airport in Bangkok is by the rail link If your hotel is close to the BTS or the metro then this is the best option Very fast and on time and very convenient as well

title: Fastest connection
review: My friend arrived different flight from me he arrived an hour earlier took a cab to his hotel in sukhumvit I arrived an hour later flight  I reached the hotel slightly earlier than my friend who took the cab ARL will always be my first choice to go into Bangkok city compared to any other forms of transport You may have to stand but at least the duration is much shorter than by cars

title: Fast and reliable
review: It takes only 30mins from the Airport to Phaya Thai station where you can conveniently change to the BTS train The walk to the BTS station is sheltered and takes about 5 mins

title: Perfect without luggage
review: It is the most comfortable way to reach the airport Good connections with the SkyTrain Clean and air conditionned

title: MTB Rail
review: The trains are fast you don't have to wait for too long And the stations are easy to access Just don't catch a train during peak hours it is a nightmare

title: Easy access to city
review: it is convenience to take Airport rail to city fast and cheap fare First time visit Bangkok was 20 years ago and now see Thailand has been changed a lot

title: Too simple not to take advantage of
review: On a stopover heading to Phuket I headed down to the trains for a quick trip into the city You can take this through to Phaya Thai where you can easily transfer to the BTS line and get about anywhere you want to go Hint get accom near an MRT or BTS station and ignore the roads altogether  One of the best things at the airport rail platform is the money chargers on this train level Ignore the money changers just outside the customs gates its a MUCH better rate from 4 or 5 outlets near where you buy your train tickets just keep walking past down the centre and you will easily spot these money changers all working off about 1% less than the rate you can find on xecom (thats my experience for $AUD)  Very competative

title: City line rail was fast and cheap!
review: Beat the traffic take the train There is a city line which only costs 45 baht while the express costs few times more

title: Why take Taxi when you have this!
review: It was our first time taking this as the previous trips to Bangkok were all taxis It's so easy and convenient to locate the airport railway link from Suvarnabhumi Airport There's often crowds as everyone's having the same mindset in saving cost Go right to the end as usually seats are more and spacious standing area too To Phaya Thai for example once alight and switch to BTS train and gets to the stations where most hotels are located So easy

title: easy ride to and from  the international airport
review: The Airport rail link takes you right into Bangkok city to a junction with the BTS line at Phaya Thai station This allows travellers to travel transfer to the most popular areas in Bangkok city  I always stay at the Sukosol Hotel  which is a 2 minute walk from the Phaya Thai  BTS station  and then I can access both lines during my stay and then returning to the International airport  for my return home this makes the overall journey very easy

title: A great way to beat the traffic!
review: Bangkok is famous for its traffic snarls  The Airport Rail Link is the best mode for organised travellers to avoid stressful taxibus rides

title: Cheap and efficient way to get into the city
review: If you arrive or depart from the Suvannabhumi Airport this is the most efficient means of transport to and from Instead of paying hundreds of baht for Grab or a normal taxi you can head into the city using this train no wasted time in traffic

title: Speedy convenient and comfortable
review: The most convenient way to get to central Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi  Get off at Phaya Thai or Makkasan to connect to the MRT or BTS  Ideally find a nearby hotel to the station  At an unbeatable 45 baht per trip

title: Best, cheapest and quickest way to central Bangkok
review: Definately best way to get to and from Airport now No traffic stress    Flight with Thai landed about 520am from Melb Straight through immigration and down ARL in basement Train left Airport at 605am to Phaya Thai BTS down to Nana and walked into my hotel at 650am Best time ever and better than nearly 2 hrs by car  Try it

title: Best way to and from Airport
review: What it says clean fast and on time  Best to avoid the traffic on the road if it's near where you're going to

title: Excellent
review: If you are clear about where you are going this is by far the best way to get into the city from the airport You hotel will always advise you in this regard

title: BKK Airport rail link.
review: Very Cheap way to get onto BKK fast reliable and frequent best option for budget conscious travellers A guide pamphlet is available that explains where to change to Sky train Available at the ticket machine in the Airport

title: transportation
review: the best way to travel from airport to city center  getting there in just 30 minutes and few stops in a nicely AC train and at around 1 Euro or 2 max depending on your travel destination

title: A cheap way to get into the city.
review: The traffic in Bangkok is very very busy This is an easy and quick way to travel right into the heart of the city It is clean and efficient and great value for money

title: Best way to get to town from airport
review: This is the first time for us to use the airport rail It took us less than 30 mins and 45 Baht each to get from the airport to Phaya Thai the last stop where our hotel is located Excellent

title: Fast, easy, clean
review: This is a great way to travel into the city but make sure you have smaller note and coin denominations for the ticketing machines (you actually get a token)  They don't accept cards  There is one customer service window open to give change but it can get very busy  There are cafes kiosks close by if you want to buy water etc and break a larger note in the process

title: Ease of travel
review: The Airport Rail link is really cheap and good It takes approximately 30 minutes to Phaya Thai station where you can connect to BTS or if you want to connect to MRT  it is linked via Makkasan station Highly recommend

title: Great
review: Super quicksuper easy  Other countries could learn from them The people using public transportation are behaving very well And they have an AC that is working

title: Clean and cheap
review: It is very nice and clean plus very fast way to travel from the busy city to airport with lass money to spend

title: Fastest and (Probably) Cheapest (in most cases)
review: Best option going in a straight line over pass the traffics in and out Bangkok city center with connection to subway or sky train and Suvarnabhumi Airport if you have just one or two luggages

title: Bangkok Airport Linl
review: Fast and reliable way toget to and from Bangkok city centre You don't have to deal with potential taxi problems just head to the Basementlevel of the of the terminal and take and easy ride right into Thailand's capital

title: Best options of travel to and from Airport
review: Best options of travel between Airport and your accommodation if accommodation is located near to any of the metro station Also recommended only for Singles or Couples If more than that then go for Grab as cost of Train Tickets are reasonably high

title: Very fast and reliable
review: Fast and reliable train from airport to city Safe and cheap Best way to get to and from the airport 30 mins beats all the traffic a car transfer usually takes an hour

title: The best way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport if you're travelling light
review: I live in Bangkok and whenever I'm going to Suvarnabhumi Airport with one checked bag or less I take the airport rail link you can connect to it from the MRT (subway) at Petchaburi station on the Blue Line It's a bit of a walk up a slight incline on an elevated walkway to the Makkasan airport rail link station You can also connect from Phaya Thai BTS (elevated train) station on the Sukhumvit line It's inexpensive and eliminates the uncertainty of surface street travel time which can vary widely The only minor annoyance is that they are all separate systems  airport rail link MRT & BTS  so you need separate tickets tokens or passes All three systems are airconditioned

title: Easy
review: Well signposted and easy to purchase tickets as I had researched on map where we needed to get off and change trains Only cost 35bht each fast and efficient

title: Offers fast and reliable transport to/from airport.
review: The train offers fast and reliable transport tofrom the Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok for a very cheap price The only negative thing I have is that during the afternoon rush hour the train can be very crowded as many people are not just using the train to get to the airport but also use it to get home from workschool

title: Convenient Travel
review: The airport link helped me a lot in travelling from the airport going to our hotel This is also connected to the BTS trains so you really have all the means to tour Bangkok conveniently

title: Perfect transport
review: Very convenient if you don’t have to much luggage I have used it three times in seven months And you don’t have to speak Thai 😊

title: Great
review: Easy to use Takes off every 15 minutes Cheap Great way to get to the airport and back Better then the taxi no traffic jams

title: Easy way in and out of city
review: Can’t beat that this  fast and efficient with links to BTS Not sure why anyone would risk 160 kph taxi drivers instead of this cheap and convenient express train ride

title: Excellent and value for money service
review: I have been a frequent traveller to Bangkok and this is the VFM in my opinion especially if you are solo traveller or in a group or 23 people The train takes you inside the main city centre and there are plenty of options once you get down at Phaya Thai station (which is the last point)

title: best way to travel
review: i use this a few  days agoits fast and efficentno need to get caught up in the trafficfor 44bhat its good value and easy to use

title: Easy as pie!
review: I loved using the airport rail link It was pleasant after a long flight  quick easy and cheap Certain stops have connecting stations but there are boards and notices all around which are easy to understand and navigate

title: Brilliant
review: We took this on our way to the airport and it was the simplest task in our entire trip Once on it you sit for a little while and it takes you directly to the new airport in Bangkok Super convenient

title: Very Helpful
review: Having this kind of transportation from the airport is very helpful This place is very convenient to every places you want to go wherever in the city

title: Great Transportation System
review: A great way to travel from Suvarnabhumi Airport to the city center Convenience easy and comfortable The price is also affordable

title: Efficient & Inexpensive
review: Quick way to get to or from the Airport  Easy to use and convenient  Much cheaper option than the other methods of transportation

title: Most convenience transport
review: The easiest way from Airport to town Hassle freecleanspacious Fast without traffic jamp like taxi efficient & value for money

title: No traffic...No fuss
review: $200 AUD  Fast rail into the city If you are on a budget then the airport train is the go  Wheel your luggage on and off but "mind the gap"   No traffic issues and only 10 percent of the price of a taxi into the city  I use all the time when going to BKK

title: Great link
review: Fast cheap easy to use  Great way into the airport from the centre of the city  Only use for BKK though not DMK

title: Reliable and easy
review: Caught this every time I’ve visited Bangkok couldn’t be more easier and reliable to use simple get on at the airport look for  The closest station to your hotel then get a taxi plenty waiting outside don’t pay more than 100 thi bart into Mo chit from macason don’t be put off it’s easy just be prepared for the  247  Crazy Bangkok traffic

title: Easiest and fastest way to get into Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi airport
review: If you are flying alone or with a partner into Bangkok through Suvarnabhumi International Airport and have carryon only or a small luggage this is the way to get into Bangkok Get off at Makassan station to connect to the MRT line or Phaya Thai station to connect to the BTS line The journey time to Phaya Thai station is about 26 minutes and the cost is 45 Thai Baht

title: Fast and Convenient
review: Tried the city line from the airport to Siam square it was fast cheap and convenient it drops you just where most of the hotels are (less then 10 min walking from most of the hotels)

title: Great
review: Fast way to travel to the airport very efficient and better than a taxi I liked the system a lot and recommend it

title: Beat Bangkok Traffic.
review: Beat Bangkok Traffic Nuff said However not suitable if carrying too many suitcases And if you're reaching Bangkok early morning be prepared for a jam packed train as the working and school going crowd will join on the way

title: Cheap, Efficient, and Fast
review: The airport rail link is connected with the MRT subway which is also connected with the BTS skytrain You can travel from the airport all the way into the city and it will take about an hour There are many information posters and signs as well as security and staff who are happy to assist you in case you don’t know where to go   When you arrive at Suvarnabhumi Airport forget about hiring a taxi (traffic congestion is so bad you’ll end up having to sit in a car for more than an hour) head straight to the base floor buy the tickets at the vending machines (only available with coins) or at the ticket counter The trains are clean and pretty comfortable You can transfer to the MRT at Asok or you can continue on to Phaya Thai where you can transfer to the BTS skytrain If you somehow get lost google maps’ got your back Everything is labeled and just follow the directions   Depending on traffic the time to get to the city center by either taxi or the trains is about the same from my experience However if you prefer to sit comfortably in a taxi and wait in traffic go ahead The trains are cheaper though Taxi drivers are notorious for charging ridiculous amounts from tourists and some refuse to use the meter

title: The fastest way to approach Bangkoks city center.
review: Avoid the usual horrible Bangkok traffic jam with taxis or buses and choose the cheapest (BHT 45) and fastest means of reaching your downtown location

title: Best way into Bangkok from airport
review: While this is definitely the fastest and cheapest way into Bangkok from the airport make sure you use the train map to know when to get off rather than listening to the voice over My husband and I miss heard what was said and got off 4 stops too early Staff were all exceptionally helpful and very quickly set us back on course These trains are clean frequent on time and very well organised I highly recommended it

title: Clean, fast, and reliable
review: Fantastic way to beat the traffic jams in Bangkok and get to the the airport efficiently and ontime

title: Easy access to the airport
review: Very clean fast and easy to get to the airport from the heart of the city It has a direct connection to the BTS station in Phaya Thai costs around 45 BHT and takes you the airport in 25 minutes Despite the google maps it takes you right to the airport itself and you do not need to walk extra when you get off

title: Enjoyable
review: It was an interesting ride the staff was wonderful and the scenery was beautiful It is way better than other means of transport because it saves alot of time due to traffic

title: Efficient transport
review: The airport rail link connects extremely well with the sky rail system It is very simple to navigate It is cheap and easy to use

title: SO Easy
review: This is quick and convenient I don’t see why anybody gets into town any other way And it’s cheap too

title: Good service and fast to the city
review: The staffs were so enthusiastic That was the first time we used airport link so we did not know how to do it The staffs helped us we even did not have to do everything (just go to the door they swiped the ticket for us)

title: Cheap and fastest
review: Bangkok is known for traffic Taking the Airport Rail Link system would definitely save you time from Airport to City Center and skip the traffic

title: The best way to travel from the Airport
review: I love that Bangkok has this awesome airport rail link  After coming through customs you walk or rather escalator ride down to the Airport rail link (all signage has english wording and clear directions) as it is located in the basement  There you buy a ticket either via the ticket vending machine or a person at the ticket counter The machine is so easy to use and it is in english If you get stuck there are customer service reps right there to help It's 42 THB (NZD 180) one way and you need to keep the token It's ticket into the area and then your ticket out at the other end  The trains come every 15mins or so You don't have to wait long  The ride itself is really smooth and you see a lot of the country as you head into bangkok city centre Along the way you can get off and connect either with their BTS (sky train) or MRT (subway) lines  There are about 8 stops in total and by far the best cheapest and aircondition way to get to and from the Airport Unfortunately this rail link is only for the new airport and doesn't go to Don Mueang airport (the older airport)  Definitely value for money

title: Excellent way to get into the city from airport
review: When we arrived in Thailand we got a taxi from the airport but used the Airport Rail link for leaving from downtown Bangkok Links up seamlessly with the BTS Skytrain in the city   Tickets can be bought from ticket machines or the manned ticket desk in the station Alights in the airport terminal   Quick safe efficient and very inexpensive Probably faster than taxi in rush hour too

title: Outstanding way to go around Bangkok!
review: It is fascinating to discover places in this Eastern part of the world A fine and easy way to navigate Bangkok

title: Really Great
review: So easy to get to the city centre and so inexpensive A real credit to Bangkok I guess there aren't too many places in the world where you can get from the airport to the city for $2

title: heap, efficient and fast
review: Airport link is a great option not to be stuck in traffic which can be super unpredictable in Bangkok It's also a lot cheaper and It takes around 35 mins from the airport to the city Although it can a little inconvenient for people who bought too many goods but they have elevators

title: Very convenient much better than taxi
review: Nice helpful Staff at ticketing and guides you cost 45bhat and its right inside the airport basement so very convenient only the last bit from ticketing to platform no trolleys Taxi to city has toll of 75 to 125 bhat plus the actual fare plus 150bhat airport charger so even with 4 people it's better to take this to the city and then book a taxi from there and save half you money

title: Fastest route to the airport from the city
review: It is really worth using if you have not too heavy luggage running late or just go to pick up someone but you don't drive It can be very crowded as well and has limited operating hours as any public transportation

title: Most efficient way to travel from Suvarnabhoomi to town
review: Have been using Airport Rsil Link to commute between Suvarnabhoomi Airport and Bangkok city Best way to beat the traffic

title: Airport
review: 35 THB to get from central Bangkok to the airport Super fast (15 mins) and easy compared to 3040 mins and 300450 THB by cab or uber

title: Fast and cheap transportation to downtown
review: Even if taxi are very cheap too if compared to western countries this train should be preferred because it links both to the bts and metro of Bangkok  so you won't have to deal with the dramatic traffic jams  Follow the indication to the training link at the airport  buy the ticket ( it's actually a sorte of plastic coin ) and enjoy your 30 minutes travel to the city

title: Very convenient & affordable
review: Train is clean and reaches the city centre within 30 minutes Cost 45 bht from Airport to Phaya Thai Station Follow the signs after baggage collections and go down by escalator to the basement level

title: 1st time I have used this service
review: I have never been game to use this before I don't know why  I think old habits die young But on this occasion I thought I'd take the punt and was surprised how convenient and easy it was Cheaper than the cheap taxi's as well Will do so again

title: No cheaper way
review: Cost from airport into city 35 BHT Each So cheap and straightforward Taxi then to hotel 72 BHT GIVE IT A GO

title: Cheapest mode of transport in Bangkok!
review: My one and only mode of transportation in Bangkok Cheap and hassle free Opens till midnight which is more than enough for you to go around the city You can also not worry about the traffic jams on the roads which is a bummer if you are rushing to the airport FYI BTS line and their airport line are 2 different entities which you need to buy separate train tickets One day passes are on the BTS lines

title: Works perfect
review: The Raul link is Quick and easy We used it many times and Would Never take a cap or anything else On the train there is no trafik jams It tales about 30 minutes to get to central Bangkok

title: Simple way to travel
review: Day 1 may seem daunting dont feel afraid The simplest way to travel quick no traffic snarl ups a change of 1 rail possibly  But easy to negotiate  Helpful staff if you are unsure or have incorrect money denominations

title: Comfortable ride
review: It's the best to take airport rail link to City centre Airport link connects to the Bangkok Transport system (BTS) if you disembark at Phayathai station Airport rail link cost 45 Bhats per person

title: 12 hrs Stopover
review: Had a 12 hours stopover and decided to go into the city via the train absolutely delighted on how convenient it was and how helpful the guards and staff at the train stations were Highly recommends to use this service if you are travelling solo as it really cheap and hassle free Tickets can be purchased using a vending machine 45 baht

title: Clean and convenient
review: We take the airport link whenever we visit Bangkok because it is quick easy clean and very convenient And it's definitely cheaper than a taxi  Also there is no problem loading your luggage into the train with you

title: Excellent
review: Excellent and cheap way to get to Bangkok from the airport Transport links in the city are excellent clean and reliable Trains every 15 mins from airport

title: Best way to get around
review: Bangkok is just totally crazy with traffic jams so the train is always a better option Prices are about 45 bath and the train is really clean and fast If you have to catch a flight and your hotel is not next to the airport the train is the only reasonable way to get there

title: Fast and economic way to travel
review: A hassle free way to travel economically Get to the city within 30 minutes Won't get stuck in traffic No need to haggle with taxi drivers

title: Well designed and planned
review: The airport link is an easy and quick way between airport and city center I strongly recommend if you have small bagsIt might be difficult to carry big luggage especially if your hotel is far away from MRT and BTS

title: Easy, fast and cheap.
review: Great way to get from the airport into Bangkok Think it cost us around £1 each maybe even less  The train goes direct to Bangkok so need to swap trains with all your luggage

title: Best way to travel
review: Don't bother with taxis and sitting in traffic jams just get the train to were ever your staying its cheep  fast and reliable I think I paid just under 100 baht from the airport to my hotel in asok  the whole journey tuck about 40 min door to door with no haggling over taxi fares

title: Fastest and cheapest way to the city
review: It only costs you 40 baht to go from airport to pratunum area or baiyoke sky hotel compared to 200400 baht by taxi The whole journey just took 30 mins or so compared to taking taxi which usually will be delayed longer in a jam If u don't have too much luggage when departing from the city this is also the most reliable transport mode to the airport without worry of meeting with traffic jams Cheap and good )

title: Very impressed
review: The first bit of public transport after getting off the plane in Bangkok it was extremely impressive actually not pushing and shoving like in the underground The security control when people go on and off the train with places to queue Also they sweep the train for hazards and security issues at the end of the line before anyone is allowed on The whole experience when converted back to sterling costs pence

title: Easy to use
review: We used this service to go into Bangkok when we arrived and again when we were leaving Very easy to use and quite cheap Highly recommend it With the crazy traffic in Bangkok it really is the best way to get to and from the airport

title: Great
review: The train is ideal if you want to waste money or have money to throw again then take a taxi This transport is good it's air con clean and much cheaper than a taxi for the same time

title: Great way to go from the airport to the city and better if you travel light
review: My first time taking the airport rail link really fast really cheap compared to other transportation options It tends to get really crowded though so its a better option if you travel light The last station has a link to the BTS

title: Beat the traffic!
review: Surely a must if you want efficient clean and safe travel from the Suvarnabhumi airport to the center of the city  Surely airport link is the best antidote to Bkk traffic AND saves your wallet  from having a big holeairport link is not even ten percent of cab fare from the airport to city center

title: Best to avoid traffic
review: Best way to go to the airport or viceversa and save at least 1 hours sitting in the traffic of this chaos city Highly recommended

title: Easy ride
review: Easy to take the BTS to the Airport Rail Link I took it from  Phlon  chit just 4 stops and 28 Baht  easy direction signs in English cost to airport 45 Baht  have machines to get token

title: fast airport - city connection
review: Best thing with that is it's fast so you avoid the city traffic It does not bring you right into the city centre though you'll need to connect to another line But it's easy and straightforward to make a transfer It's absolutely the optimum way to get to the city from airport It's not the cheapest though there are some public buses but they'll take ages to get to the city And of course a taxi may be more comfortable it'll also cost you much more and also you may get stuck in traffic

title: The best way to get in the middle of the town
review: An efficient fast easy cheap way to get in town Even a lonely woman feels safe With children also cool  Eating and drinking is not permitted on the train

title: Best way ti avoid traffic
review: It's one of the option to avoid being stuck in Bangkok traffic jam despite having to walk slightly once you get inside the train the air conditioner make it up

title: Highly recommended for trevelers with less luggage
review: in 3040 minutes it takes to main Bangkok  with taxis it's not the case always Specially if it's peak time (office hours  long weekend's)  ARL is the savior

title: very fast connection from Airport to City of Bangkok
review: its very quick and will take less than 30 minutes if you are planning to gocome from the Airport which usually can take 2 hours  only problem you face is during the rush hour

title: Fastest way in to town
review: Great way of getting into town  This was the first time my wife and I used this service as it has only been open around 10 months  The link connects to the BTS line at Phaya Thai station so opens up all the BTS and MRT line stations making the trip from airport to central Bangkok ((SiamChitLom) in around 3035mins  Public transportation at its best  Cheap clean and quick

title: Convenient!
review: The easiest and fastest way to get to the city The trains are clean Proper signage are displayed for our convenience I would recommend you to take the train rather than be stuck on traffic

title: Let Me Emphasize The PLUS!!
review: Taxi drivers are getting more devious in Bangkok and it is frustrating My advice  if they try to tell you a price tell THEM you want the METER ON If they say it's not working tell them drop you off or take you back NOW Lots of cheating  So with that in mind from the Sukumvit Area It is worth it to pay 100 Thai Baht (meter will say 5070) for a trip to Makkasan Station for the Rail Link to the airport and then for another roughly 30 Thai Bahts for 1 way and 20 minutes you will be at the airport  It is a little harder on the reverse trip because catching a taxi at the station to go to your hotel can be sketchy But it can be done Considerations  if you have 2 big suitcases it's tough to walk consider a taxi all the way from the airport But if you have 1 large and 1 small you can do it  Taxi from the airport is now running about 400 Thai Bahts ($1214) because most taxi's are taking the toll highway adding 75 Thai Bahts to the price and some others adding a 50 Baht "Airport surcharge" This is apparently a new wrinkle  To make it easy lately I tell the driver I will pay you 400 Thai Baht to my Hotel You go whichever way you want Deal Good (there is a way that avoids the second 50 Baht toll which is faster and also a way that uses no toll)  The Link runs from 06002400 so time it properly and the trains run about every 1015 minutes  It is seldom crowded as a dedicated line unlike BTS and Metro etc  It is my transportation of choice whenever possible just to avoid all the headaches with tricky people By the way This is NOT the "Sky Train"  That's something else

title: The sky train
review: Found the sky train quick and easy to use Takes you right around the the city It is also very cheap and the ticketing system easy to use

title: Efficient and reliable
review: This is a great service with clear announcements about stations and helpful staff who will do their best to help you Very grateful for it and infinitely cheaper than taxis and possibly quicker as the roads can be awfully busy

title: suvabhumi airport connection
review: it is very convenient for those arrive or depart at suvabhumi airport The airport link link the place to various places in bangkok city the price is reasonable as well

title: Quicker and cheaper then getting a cab
review: Simple quick and effective way of getting into town  the Bangkok traffic being so awful Quicker and cheaper then getting a cab

title: Convenient Travel
review: Skip the jam and hop on the Airport Rail Link It takes only 3045 minutes from the Airport into City Centre An affordable and reliant means of transport for those travelling on a budget

title: The way to go
review: So simple and easy  So cheap $ 4 one way Contalectscto mrt and bts  Book a hotel near mrt or bts station  And of course travel light keep your suitcase small and max 20kg or le less and you will find it easy and simple to and from the airport  No hassle of taxi drivers and expensive over priced transfers

title: Convenient
review: It is faster & could avoid the huge traffic congestion on the roads Economical & comfortable too The day we traveled there was a big crowd but some how we made it without much hassel

title: Use rail link instead of taxi
review: It you are not carrying a lot of luggage I find it best to use the airport link to beat traffic and tolls Even if you take it to a station close to your destination it will save time and money

title: Fantastic
review: Very efficient fastest and economical way to get from and to airportdowntown All stations has escalators even with heavy luggage it's easy to handle The train goes straight under the airport

title: Taken this transportation several times
review: You can save money by taking this rail from the airport because the price is very inexpensive  And you need to make change before buying your token I have never seen anyone denied their luggage on the BTS  And also it's quite fast about 20 minutes to Bangkok

title: Very good transportation
review: It is good and fast transportation you can find it in google map with prices it is going to many places

title: Easy to get in city center of Bangkok
review: Train is air conditioned clean and so on and a lot cheaper than a Taxi ) Last train at midnight is not so bad you've got plenty of time to see whatever to see in Bangkok either by day or by night

title: Cheap and easy
review: Great way to get into the city Easy to use and cheap Cheaper than taking a taxi all the way from Suvarnabhumi Also you can avoid some of the traffic jams that frequently occur

title: Most stress-free mode of transport in BKK!
review: If you have 13 persons on the trip airport rail link to city is the most efficient and stressfree airport transfer   Just skipping the traffic jams and avoiding being at the mercy of the taxi drivers is more than its worth

title: very good service as long as you don't have large baggage
review: Fast quick and inexpensive if you are going to Sukhumvit or Siam area  Only good if you have luggage that you can easily carry

title: Fast way to BKK
review: Really fast way from the heart of Bangkok to airport And always on time Also it have money exchage with best rate on exit in suvarnabumi

title: The fastest way to get into Bangkok
review: This is the fastest and cheapest way to go from airport to the city You can avoid the huge traffic of BKK and it cost 45 THB (13 €) to go to Payathai station (last stop) in 30' where you have the connection with the sky train

title: Cheap and convenient
review: If you know where you are going and can find the directions  and you are not afraid of crowded areas use it as it has ac and also very cheap but quick

title: A bit of a mission
review: We stayed at Siam so used the skytrain  to get to Phaya Thai to catch the airport trainwas disappointed there were no escalators or lifts to get down to the trainluckily a nice young man helped me with my luggage otherwise we would have been in dire straights carrying it down 2 flights of stepswe have used it before when they had the express train and it was much nicer but would still use it as better than being in Bangkok traffic45 Baht is good value

title: Good airport rail link
review: Easy to navigate from service to service  reasonably priced clean  regular service throughout the day   Does what it says on the tin really

title: Great way to get to main station in bangkok ,
review: A little tip when waiting to board stand at the sides of the doors as you must let people off first I got an official blowing his whistle at me and said some thing in Thai  Lol

title: better optoin to reach the city
review: cheap and best to travel via airport rail link to the city Need to change the platform to catch another train

title: Cheap and Best
review: Airport link very convenient way of travelling from airport(i used it from suvarnbhumi airport) to travel to city and viceversa Remember it is closed between 0000hrs to 0600hrs

title: Fastest Way into Bangkok from Airport
review: If you don't have a lot of luggage in tow then this is the way to get into town from the airport and vice versa Air conditioned and connects to the BTR and Metro lines in town

title: Excellent Airport drop and very cheap
review: Many people dont no than this Airport is in Bangkok and take taxi this Airport li k is a very cheap solution for o e or 2 peoples but for more ots better to take a taxi

title: Good, Cheap link to Bangkok
review: We used this to get to Bangkok my husband and I were trying to find Khao San Road Getting on the train was easy enough and staff at the sirport are very helpful When we got off the train it was difficult to find anyone who could help us as obviously our Thai was limited and the staff we found had limited English We were told to go to a bus stop to wait for a number 23 (I think) to Khao San we waited a while and several Tuk Tuks stopped to try and get us to take a ride we declined However both very tired and jet lag kicking in the next Tuk Tuk that arrived we bartered with and took a ride to Khao San The train is a great service and a hell of a lot cheaper than a taxi however if you are unsure of where you are going  u7nable to navigate  know your next means of transport it may prove a bit tricky

title: Was very comfortable and starts early morning.
review: Took the airport link for our hotel at 6am Paid around 40 bhat for one person most economical than taking expensive taxi from airport to hotel

title: Fastest and cheapest from the airport.
review: A very good mode of transportation from the airport with link to BTS somewhere along the line You can always check at the information counter your destination

title: Great way to get to the city
review: Be aware of people in blue shirts standing not far from the cashier The will say to you that your train station is closed and will offer you to take a 'taxi' which costs 900 BHT The train cost 35 BHT and stops at all stations that are in the map

title: Beat traffic!
review: I love the airport link Anytime I fly inout of BKK this is the best way to get to the airport Traffic in Bangkok can be brutal and this is cheaper and faster Love it

title: Easy to use
review: We used this only once when flying in from Bangkok but had no problems at all Very easy to use also for foreigners

title: Going to to correct airport???
review: The rail line is very clean and efficient to BKK Traveled on a Saturday so not very busy So excited we got to Suvarnabhurri Airport (BKK) way before our departing flight to Krabi Thailand We were at the wrong airport We needed to be at Don Muang (DMK) 30 miles away That isn't part of airport rail link Can be 30 mins to 2 hours away   Traveled link again to head out Internationally Much better experience

title: Efficient and cheap
review: A modern cheap and efficient rail link it does exactly what it says and is easy to use We took it to phaya Thai to save money on taxis

title: Excellent quick fast link
review: If you are traveling light then this is the way to enter Bangkok and avoid some of its legendary traffic jams From the airport to the city takes about 30 minutes and I got down at Makassan station from where my destination Sukhumvit was just 5 minutes by taxi Excellent choice

title: Easy and cheap
review: Cheap way to get from the airport to the center of Bangkok Prices are ridiculously cheap compared to the Taxi

title: Superb!
review: Super fast way from the airport Thanks to interlinking with MRT and BTS you can get very fast to virtually any place in Bangkok

title: Quick Way to Reach the City!
review: A convenient and quick way to get to the city from the airport and vice versa You can connect to the BTS or MRT line depending on which part of the city you want to head to

title: Best way into our out of Bangkok
review: This train is the best way to travel from the airport into Bangkok  With a taxi it can take easily an hour because of the heavy traffic the train + 12 hour  On time clean airconditioned  perfect

title: A must
review: Super fast and efficient  Spotlessly clean  From the airport to the city links  Sky train etc  underground networks

title: Efficient, safe, clean
review: The most efficient cheap and probably also quickest way to get in town Each time the train arrives at the airport its cleaned it has AC and always seats available when you enter at the airport

title: Very convenient
review: The rail link ends at Phaya Thai station and from the station it is very convenient to go by BTS to many places in Bangkok

title: Connects to BTS
review: We used this mode of transport to get access to the BTS Sky train It was really easy quick and efficient The train took us straight to one of the BTS Sky train stations from which we could easily get to our hotel

title: Safe, easy, quick mode of transport
