review: Safe easy quick mode of transport for locals and tourists Well connected to BTS Sky train It not only connect airport but other part of the city too so you can tooandfro city without getting into  city traffic and very very good place to meet local public  it terminates at Phaya Thai and you can take another metro train from there for rest of the city Fully AC Great mode of transport inandout bangkok

title: Excellent connection to MRT and BTS
review: There is extra space for luggage if you are coming or going to the airport  Very Fast and convenient  Be sure to check connection point to the MRT and BTS  and your destination We took the MRT from the train station at Hualamphong connected to BTS and then took the Airport rail link to our hotel  We have used the airport rail link all the way to Suwannaphum airport  in the past and it was a super easy way to get through town

title: The best way to get to and from the airport!
review: It didn't take me too long to discover the convenience of the airport rail link I'll never ever take a cab to or from the airport if the train is running It's a great way to take in the scenery too  Extremely affordable and predictable plus you can connect with the other rail lines in the city I once got into Bangkok at midnight and just slept on the benches until the train openedthis saved me a 400 baht car ride into the city and a hotel room

title: DO NOT USE ANY OTHER FORM OF TRANSPORT FROM THE AIPORT
review: This is the 5th trip we used the Airport Rail Link Clean fast and efficient No time spent in traffic Be aware this service only starts operating from 06h00 to 23h00 Woiuld never use a taxi to and from hotel to Downtown Bangkok

title: fast and Efficient
review: This is an easy hasslefree way of getting from the main international airport into town The train is cheap and takes around 25 minutes One can use the Makkasan Interchange (its quite a long walk but now under cover) to the Petchaburi MRT Underground station which is just one stop from SukhumvitAsoke and also continues south to Silom and Hua Lampong railway station The airport link line terminates at Phya Thai with another short walk to the Sky Train on the line from Bearing to Mo Chit making access to the main shopping areas of Siam Square easy There is plenty of room for storing lubbage in the compartments and the trains run every 15 minutes or so Tickets can be purchased in the machines at the turnstiles or from the kiosk and the same applies to the Sky Train and Underground

title: Best way to enter to the city
review: Best way to enter to the city Comfortable no issues even if you have luggage fastest mode of travel

title: Excellent
review: Very convenient and excellent service Easy to locate spotlessly clean and so efficient Gets you to the city in double quick time and air conditioned comfort

title: Very easy to use!
review: I arrived at the Bangkok airport at 2100 hrs and walked directly to the Airport Rail Link train  Purchasing the ticket and stepping on the train was very easy  Great price and ease of use going tofrom the Bangkok airport

title: Super simple
review: Very convenient connection from bats and very simple and inexpensive to use Very clean and convenient drop off

title: Best way to get to airport
review: It was a great transportation to link in between city center to airport Suvanaphumi Int'l Airport It was great price and quick

title: Bangkok has Three Excellent Urban Train Services
review: I'm a huge fan of the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok proper   (cheap very reliable and avoids horrendous traffic) and there's another airport link being constructed at the moment (Sep 2016) to service BKK's other major airport at Don Mueang The Airport Train provides great access to and from the basement of Suvarnabhumi Airport  a great world class service that gets you as close to the airport as a taxi does and there's an interchange station with the BTS Skytrain or MRT Underground Train stations  The Airport Rail Link is in very good company with both the BTS Skytrain and MRT Underground Train  all three provide public transport to a world class standard   	 If you're staying within close proximity to one the BTS Skytrain or MRT Underground Train stations they should be your primary transport whilst in Bangkok  if you're not staying within close proximity I suggest you should consider relocating   If the Skytrain doesn't get you to one of the mustsee attractions around Bangkok the MRT likely will  and viceversa  Skytrain offers the views of BKK whilst perched above the ground in airconditioned comfort but MRT stations provides a reprieve from the heat whilst waiting for air conditioned trains to come along

title: very useful!!!
review: it has great connections with skytrain that helps u to reach ur destination for a cheap price without making u obliged to use taxi which is waaaay more expensive

title: Take this if you don't want to get stuck in traffic
review: Rail link is awesome thinking of transportation between airport and city The price is just 45 TBH till the end Phaya Thai station The connectivity with other trains in the city is so seamless that you will get to your point faster than taxi

title: Quick!!
review: When I arrived at Bangkok I used to be downed to think about how to go to my accommodation in Bangkok by bus or cab But finally I could say byebye to the feeling in this summer The railway is very nice as easy to go to midtown in Bangkok from airport Also it's clean

title: Great and time saving way to go to airport.
review: One of the best ways to go to heart of the city  to and from air port is Air port link of BKK  It takes you right in the air port building or right in the heart of city   Saves you huge amount of time to travel through the city traffic and is virtually less than 10% of the cost of taxi   I use this option maximum time as I go to BKK almost every alternate month and every time travel ONLY through Air Link   I usually need to get down or travel through Makasan station on Airport link and some times getting taxi here to go to your hotel can  be an issue about 10 min of wait is usually required to get a taxi or Uber to arrive   During peak Hours the trains are crowded and so if you are travelling in family or a large group with lot of luggage allow yourself some extra time as you may have to wait for 23 trains to pass which may mean a wait time at station of around 1520 min   Over all a great way to travel from city to air port   I always use it

title: quick and convenient
review: What to say it is a public transportation No sightseeing but you get a nice impression on the way to downtown better than by taxi and quicker

title: Excellent value and efficient
review: We trsvelled in form the airport and found the train to be really good value efficient and easy to use The security staff were very helpful

title: Fast efficient
review: This is the only fast efficient way of transfering to and from the airport with interchanges at MRT and SkyTrain stations you can travel any where

title: Good
review: Good transportation Not only for going to the airport but also to other places If you have one roller bag and no children then this is good for you

title: Reliable and reasonable
review: The airport link train system is reliable and very cheap between the  airport and downtown of BKK

title: fast , easy and conviencet way to and fro from airport to city
review: Use this train  to go closest  area in  city where you planned to visit  Then take taxi if necessary   This train link has good connection to underground  and sky train station w at cheaper than taxi

title: super efficient
review: fully air conditioned smooth service thoroughly enjoyable Took a little time to work out routes given language barrier but simple thereafter

title: Effective travel
review: This a very good and effective way to travel around Bangkok Easy to use safe and very clean And the trains are air conditioned

title: Super WOW!
review: It so clean fast and convenient I don't have to worry It made my visit memorable of trying something new to me and different from LRT and MRT in the Philippines

title: Amazing!
review: I highly recommend using the link as a cheap and quick way to get into the city from the airport You're bypassing all of the traffic and it links you into the BTS

title: Safe,punctual,economical and hassle-free
review: Very clean safe on time Easy to access from airport to connect with BTS Skytrain cityline recommended number 1 conveyance from airport

title: Holiday in Bangkok
review: The best way to travel from the airport into the main station of Bangkok All the members of staff are very friendly

title: Convenient mode of transport from the Suvarnabumi International Airport into Bangkok city
review: We have used the Airport Rail Link several times now and found it to be a convenient comfortable and cheaper mode of transport in getting to Bangkok Take the ARL to Ramakhamhaeng station and transfer to the MRT to where you wish to travel to in Bangkok or in the event the MRT does not take you there you can transfer at a MRTBTS interchange station and transfer To take a taxi from the airport to Bangkok will cost around 500 baht but via the ARL and the MRTBTS will cost you about 100+ baht

title: Airport link
review: Airport link it actually the best and fastest way into Bangkok no matter where you stay in Bangkok if your plane arrives in the morning or else with a taxicab you will get stuck in the morning traffic and 1 other thing to it is cheaper and it is easy to cross to bts (Sky train) or mrt (metro) don't be afraid to try thai people are helpful just ask and you won't get lost

title: Airport Rail Link -Fastest and Cheapest way to Suvarnabhumi airport
review: The best cheapest quickest way to reach Suvarnabhumi auroort Bangkok is by Airport Rail Link you may have to change from Sky Train To Airport Link at station depending on where you plan to book hotel always try to find your hotell near skytrain stations or airport link The airport link statuon is inside airport When you buy ticket just ask for station map or take photo with mobile of maps on the wallBook your hotell and write find skytrain station near hotellYou change from skytrainairport link  Airport Link  Airport station to Ramkhamhaeng station(Nasa Vegas Hotel) to Phetchaburi station (15 baht) pay more Phetchaburi  Sukhumvit station (16 baht) and stop Sukhumvit You can choose hotel anywhere close to these lines They speak next station name on english in train You can also follow line posters inside train wall Have a nice stay in Bangkok

title: Cheap way to get to/from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Best way to get tofrom Suvarnabhumi Airport It is reliable and the time for the journey is always the same something you can't say about taxi It costs less than 50 baht which is nothing compared with taxi From some stations you can connect with MRT (metro) and then BTS (SkyTrain aka "Ice train")

title: Recomend
review: Airport Rail Link really recommend if want go to airport or arrival in Thailand because the Airport Rail Link not far from airport

title: Great way to get to the airport
review: If you have a minimal amount of luggage there is no better way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport cheaply and quickly You can connect to the Airport Rail Link from any BTS line just follow the maps posted everywhere in the stations The BTS has announcements at every stop in both Thai and English Get off when Airport Rail Link is announced and proceed to the train It is really cheap and easy and you avoid all the traffic in Bangkok My only reservation would be trying to get a lot of luggage on I am 63 and only do this with a carryon A younger person can probably manage more

title: Cheap and efficient
review: I'm a fan of public transport systems and this one works well I got the MRT from Hua Lamphong station to Phetchaburi station for 30 Baht Plenty of signs within the underground concourse of Petchaburi direct you to the walkway and sky walk across to Makasan station on the airport line  No problems with wheeling luggage apart from a very short set of steps The fare from Makasan to the airport was 35 Baht The tickets on the two systems are not interchangeable but it's easy to buy them on the platforms from the vending machines The sky train gives you a good view of the outer city on the way to the airport so an added bonus

title: Convenient, cheap and fast
review: Anyone looking to get into the city quickly from the airport should take the Airport Rail Link  You can be downtown in 30 minutes using this  It gets very crowded after the 2nd stop so get a seat early  This is far superior to getting cheated by a Bangkok taxi driver and having to smell what he had for lunch all the way to your hotel

title: Great
review: I used the train to get to the river ferry's and the people were so helpful the trains were fast clean and safe

title: Best way to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport to downtown BKK!
review: Cheaper safer and faster than taking a taxi I always use the train No waiting in the taxi cue in the heat no getting stuck in the never ending traffic jams and no haggling prices The train is simply unbeatable

title: Aiport Rail Link
review: Very clean and easy to navigate there were signs everywhere to direct you where you need to be  We did not have any problem finding our gate

title: Usefull & Fast
review: To be bottled in Bangkok traffic is a life experience you may spend one hour in the same exact place So a fast and sure way to reach your international flight is a must  The rail is underground so it is easy to reach without exit from airport

title: very easy way to get from airport to city centre
review: every time I fly to BKK I use the airport link getting off at Makasan you are a short motorbike taxi to all the centre attractions & Sukhumvit hotels The Airport link is fast not expensive easy to use clean & usually not to packed with people

title: Best way in and out!
review: Very easy to find and use and only 45 baht  There used to be an express service but that seems to be cancelled  If you have a lot of luggage it may be a bit more difficult as the train gets jammed packed as you get closer to downtown  It took half the time to get to the same hotel and much cheaper

title: Convenient
review: convenient to reach airport from city within no time  highly recommended to avoid Bangkok City traffic during peak hours

title: EXCELLENT WAY TO TRAVEL INTO THE CITY FROM THE AIRPORT
review: This trip from the airport to the city was great  very comfortable and quite cheap   although quite crowded  The full trip takes around 40 minutes and connects via walkway to the local Skytrain network once at the end of the airport line  Taxis and tuk tuk drivers are everywhere if you need to get to a hotel once out of the rail link area

title: You scare to miss your airflight take the airport link
review: If you are close to the airport link rail don t hésitante one second is  the most fast and safe way to go suvarnabhumi airport Terminal to terminal 30 min 100% garantie The fee is 45 thb from payathai to airport  Fast  safe  cheap and you arrived in the ground of airport directly  you just need to take escalator or elevator to acess departure or arrival zone Enjoy your trip

title: shopping and eating
review: From suvatbhumi airport to centara watergate pavillion hotel we use the airport rail link  The train is clean comfortable and fast

title: The only way to go when in Bangkok, Thailand
review: We spent everyday moving around this great town on the Sky Train and found it to be clean air conditioned fast and inexpensive  We found directions in English posted every where to all the areas that we wanted to go

title: Good Service
review: I have used this service many times its fast easy and cheap If you choose a taxi into Bkk you are looking at between 400 to 500 baht as a posed to 34 baht  but saying that if you dont travel lightly then a cab would be the better option

title: Easy and efficient
review: Ver modern an excellent condition Easy to navigate Much cheaper than a taxi and takes you right to the heat of Bangkok Connected to two other public transit lines

title: Quick and inexpensive
review: As long as your accommodation is close to a station this is great transport and a lot less stressful that riding with a cowboy taxi driver  There are taxis near the Bangkok terminus but it can be a hassle dragging luggage down to street level

title: Excellent Public Transport.
review: Decided to try the Airport Railink to take me on the first leg of my journey to Sala Daeng Stop on Silom roadthe ride was smooth and comfortable in air conditioned carriagesthe announcements were concise and clearat the end of the line i transferred myself and luggage to another linethis was made easy as there were moving stairs and elevatorsafter 2 stops i transferred once more (also made easy) to a train to get me to my final stop (Sala Daeng) there are no facilities here to get to street levelit was a heck of a struggle to get down the many stairs to the EXIT Inexpensivebut hard work for the arms at Sala Daeng Alun

title: Easy way to reach Airport
review: Its probably the best way to reach Airport if one has to travel in busy traffic hours The only problem I see is that it is not connected to all major parts of the city From Sukhumvit 22 to reach airport train  one has to use  BTS first & walk 5 mins then take MRT subway walk again for 5 mins to reach the Makasan station bit difficult for anyone with loads of baggage

title: Fast way to get to/from an airport
review: This is the best way to get to from the airport The first train is around 6am weekdays With AC and lots of space for luggage

title: On the move
review: I travel in and out of BANGKOK very often For the last several months I have started using the Airport Rail Link I find it unbelievably convenient when I fly into Suvarnabhumi  The normal cost for a taxi to mid town is 400 baht but this train is only 39 baht You will need to catch another train taxi or motorbike from your stop but that should only be another 50 baht and less time in traffic I believe it takes about 40 minutes from one end to the other but that would be the least amount of time in a taxi This is a very good option

title: Easy access to downtown without BKK traffic!!!
review: I am a frequent visitor to Bangkok but this was the first time I took the Airlink into downtown If you dont have alot of luggage I recommend this 45 Baht and forget grid lock traffic Clean and fairly fast

title: Beats taxis and traffic jams
review: Cheap and fast and served well Got it from Phrom pong station which is very near where my mini bus to victory monument stops in fact they dropped me at the steps as the traffic was jammed

title: Easy to use!
review: 45 baht per person  Very convenient and worth the cost So easy to use this form of public transportation

title: Take the train, dont get into bangkok's traffic
review: During the day it could save you a lot of time and some money take the train near your area and a taxi from there

title: Very convenient and reliable
review: Their railway system and airport link is very modern and convenient Theres no way youll miss your flight

title: Very efficient and on time!!
review: Great service easy to understand and use i hadn't planned my journey from the airport to my hotel in bangkok but this was so easy

title: Fast and reliable
review: Provided your hotel is near a metro station this is great way to get to the city from the airport It is fast and clean  Tip if you are arriving to Bangkok I found the best exchange rates at the Airport Rail Link station (much better than those upstairs and slightly better that those in the city)

title: Short Cut to the City
review: Cabins are clean and the waiting time is short One of the best way to get from the airport to the city BTS and MRT connectivity along the route as well

title: Convenience
review: This is the best way to travel to hotels on Sukhumvit from the airport Take the train to Phaya Thai and transfer to Sukhumvit Skytrain Ticket machine take coins and bills up to B100 Otherwise use the ticket booths to receive an electronic token to go through the turnstiles About 24 mins to Phaya Thai from the airport

title: Fast and efficient
review: I would always use this when travelling at rush hour if you only have one bag  If your carrying more your going to get in others way but it takes at least 30 minutes off your journey at rush hour and is very cheap

title: Fast and easy
review: The staff were very helpful and we got to our hotel very easily The rail link was easy to find and easy to use

title: Great transit from airport to downtown
review: The rail link is fast frequent clean and safe  Great way to relax after arriving at the airport  Easy to get tickets and lots of room for luggage

title: Dont waste your money on a Taxi
review: Unless you are carrying a ton of Baggage you can take this cheap Airport Rail link directly into the heart of Bangkok and vice versa

title: Very fast
review: We took the ARL to Pratunam area It is very affordable and the train is very clean and spacious There is definitely space and seats when u come from airport there are lifts at the station stops but the road to the hotel might not be very smooth as there's pothole etc so please note if u have bulky luggage other than that all is good

title: The ARL is the best way to travel from the BKK airport.
review: The Airport Rail Link is the best way to go from the airport to the BTS and on to the Sukhumvit Road area avoiding traffic

title: So easy to use
review: I was going to take a cab to the airport until my Thai friend told me not to since there are so many issues with drivers ripping off tourist not to mention the awful Bangkok traffic   I was worried that I would get hot and sweaty on the way or get lost But using the airport rail link was so easy

title: Best way to travel into Bangkok
review: This train is undoubtedly the best way to travel from the airport into Bangkok It terminates at Phaya Thai which connects to the Bangkok BTS (sky train) from which most of Bangkok is accessible It's also just B6090 (depending on the traffic) to get to Khao San area If this is your first time in Bangkok and you do continue your journey by taxi make sure the driver uses the meter Some (though not many) unscrupulous drivers will ask for a flat fee which invariably runs at B150400  At the time of writing a oneway journey on the train from Suvarnabhumi to Paya Thai cost B45 and took around a half hour

title: Awesome !!!!!!!!!
review: I Traveled recently Airport to Pratunm round trip very comfortable and good price i paid 40 Thai Baht for each way and you have to pay more than 500 THB if you travel by Taxi and takes minimum 30 minuets

title: Cheap airport travel
review: If your hotel is near a BTS or MTR station this is a good cheap alternative to taking a taxi from the airport about an hours trip to sukhimvit with transfer

title: from hotel to main airport
review: This new airport rail link connect the Phaya thai station with the subarnabhumi airport of Bnagkok price is 45 bhats from 600 am

title: cheap way of going to your hotel directly from the airport!
review: cheap efficient and comfortable This takes you to your destination in bangkok easypeasy lemon squeazy

title: The quickest way to the Airport
review: Really cheap and easy We should have used this from the beginning but when we arrived to Bangkok after 65 hours delay we just took a taxi to Silom without doing any research Airport Rail Link is faster cheaper and more cozy way to Phaya thai and from there to Sukumvit and Tadaa you're in Silom Heavily recommended

title: Great
review: Great way to get from the airport to your place of stay We had to change stop once to connect onto another line all done without to much difficulty Every where well sign posted

title: Easy to use, convenient and cheap
review: It's very easy to use even with foreigner firsttime in Thailand like me Thanks to rail link I saved money for taxi or tuktuk

title: Great journey to Suvannabhum airport
review: Travelling to Bangkok from Suvannabhum International airport try Airport Rail Link to save your time on the road

title: Easy if you travel light
review: With the growing traffic in Bangkok the ARL is a convenient way to get to the Airport Not recommended if you come with your holiday luggage

title: Clean , Eficient , Cheap
review: Easy to use  Get a card at the kiosk to miss the lines at the ticket machine  Can be very crowded at morning and evening rush hour  Very well run and safe

title: Airport Rail Link - Convenient, save hefty cab fares and best transport
review: The airport rail link in Bangkok helps tourists to save on hefty taxi fares very convenient to the city centre hotels i travel to bangkok twice a month i would use the airport rail link to the nearest mrt station closest to my hotel or a station to interchange to BTS or MRT to my nearest train station closest to my hotel

title: High up in the sky
review: Fast and straight way in to the city centre clean trains airconditioned crowded on rush hours Annoying that you have to buy a new ticket (queue) to change to Sky Train Signs and spoken info in stations and on trains in Thai and English

title: How to get to the City centre easily
review: Ac quick and easy to use mode of transport into the City centre and above all helps avoid the Traffic congestion if using a Taxi or the Bus Very cheap when you consider the distance to the Airport from the City centre

title: Escape the Bangkok jam with this train
review: The notorious Bangkok traffic jam can be very annoying if you are on a tight schedule and need to get to the airport fast I take the train to the airport during my business trips to circumvent the jam in the city

title: The best choice for Airport!
review: The cheapest way to travel from Airport If you don't want to deal with taxi or traffic this is your best choice for sure The only thing that I don't like is if you missed the last train you have to wait about 15 mins for the next train

title: quick access  from city to airport, cheap.
review: This service is great if you not have to much luggage with you It is not starting from the city centre Hence you will need to use the normal city BTS and connect to the airport rail link If you wish to avoid taxies and not have much luggage you can use this facility

title: Excellent means of transportation
review: All routes are clear sign in English and help is provided clean and fast way to get to the city If you have a lot of luggage and 5 person you may consider a van to the hotel

title: This is a great service but slow
review: Love the airport link I took it for the first time this week Waited a bit for the train but it came eventually Took me right to Makkasan then a walk to MRT then that train to Lumphini about 1 hour from airport to hotel in Sathorn What a great service inexpensive way to get to the city center Better than dealing the ripoff thieving taxi's and BKK's irritating traffic   There is quite a bit of walking to get to the rail express from arrivals and the walk from Makkasan to the MRT is a bit of jaunt but not too bad overall I only had carryon luggage so if I had full luggage it may be more arduous but still doable  it's the savings that make the journey worthwhile

title: Very efficient
review: Reasonably priced and very good service This is one of the reasons Bangkok is easily reachable from the airport

title: Get to Bangkok Airport quickly & comfortably via the ARL!
review: The ARL is an affordable way to get from Bangkok city to the airport It is airconditioned A smooth ride that takes you to the airport quickly definitely avoiding traffic jams and crowds There is ample room for luggage on the train Very comfortable ride

title: Most convenient and cheap way to go to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: I live close to Makassan Airport Link and it is so convenient very cheap way to go to Suvarnabhumi Airport in just 40 minutes Best way to avoid Bangkok traffic and for only few baht compared to catching a taxi which at times you might need to go to express way where you need to pay toll making your trip to the airport costly Timing is very convenient usually every half an hour interval

title: Do not hesitate, reach Bangkok with this instead of using a taxi.
review: One of the best and cleanest means of transport I've ever been in all my life Fast and safe easy to reach the center of Bangkok in less than half an hour

title: Anything that keeps you out of Bangkok traffic is a good-thing:)
review: If you are not encumbered with too many suitcases this is a good way to travel tofrom Suvarnabhumi International Airport as it interlinks with the BTS & MRT I live on Sukhumvit Road Bangkok and it takes me less than one hour to travel to the airport via BTS & Airport Rail Link The total cost is about $250 one way versus a Taxi that can go between $610

title: read all visitors
review: hey during my trip to bangkok my one regret is that it took me 2 days before i used the public transport the public transport is very good around BK and based on the traffic i would say its the best way to get around Bangkok It took me 2 hours to get from the airport to Silom and I wish i had got the rail link as i would of got to Silom in 3040 min So this is a must

title: Fast seemless
review: A great and cheap way to get to the airport Links with the bst and mrt Easy walking distance and is a fast way without the traffic of Bangkok to slow you down

title: cool
review: so from suvarnabhum airport use this al to go to phaya thai then go to bangkok its very cheap than using taxi

title: No need to use taxi
review: In my opinion you do not need to use airport taxi when your destination is to the downtown Step in one of them and then plan your route with a conjunction skytrain or metro

title: Faster and cheap
review: If you have small luggage with you then this is the best option to move on Bangkok city It’s very cheap and you never need to wait for traffic jam Service is very good And you will have so many shops around the station never feel bored

title: Good price and easy to use
review: I live in London where I have a lot of experience with the tube there The ARL is just as easy to use with clear sign posts everywhere but at a fraction of the cost and with the trains being in far better condition

title: The fastest way into the city from the airport
review: The city express is very easy and much cheaper than any taxi or hotel transfer I paid 45 Bhat to get from the international airport to the city Good air conditioning so you won't even get sweaty

title: Cheap and fast at the right time
review: Cheap fast and you get to see some of the outskirts of Bangkok Avoid rush hourit's a bit too cramped with big bags and cases

title: Cheap and fast transportation
review: Cheap and easy way to get from the airport into the city There was nothing to complain about Service is every 15 minutes

title: Fast connectivity to Central Bangkok
review: Want to escape traffic from airport to central bangkok hop into Airport rail link a fast comfortable affordable means of transportation Took Airport rail link from Suvarnabhoomi airport to Phaya Thai station trains run every 15 minutes Coaches are well maintained and comfortable

title: Quick, easy trip from the airport
review: Very quick easy trip from or to the airport Clean and well airconditioned Can get very crowded though

title: nice airport rail link
review: good rail link to suvarnabhumi airport clean and nice train but from starting station to suvarnabhumi station need more than 25 minutes

title: Got mass transit
review: Very easy to use gets you round the main areas of interest Fast and cheap can be crowded Worth buying a travel card so you don't have to always que up for single tickets Gives you a real sense of freedom to explore

title: Only way to go at Peak hours in Bangkok
review: 45 baht from airport ground floor just follow the signs 30 minutes to CBD Very clean and efficient Lots of room for baggage Once arrive at Thai Paya can access the BTS  or Taxi to your hotel

title: Use it if you come from BKK airport!
review: Seldom I've seen such an efficient means of transportation to go from an airport to a major city in a country This recently built ARL is perfect to get to your destination quickly in Bangkok

title: airport to pratunam in 40 minutes at 40 bahts!!
review: the best way to travel from airport to major places like pratunam most economical and no traffic woes truly comfortable and convenient in all respects

title: Loved it!
review: This is by far the best and cleanest train system I have ever taken Fast and efficient people at the stations are helpful when you are trying to figure out how to pay

title: Best way back and forth to Bangkok City.
review: Best fastest and economic way to go back and forth from Bangkok International Suvarnabhumi Airport specially at rush hour when you can be stuck in traffic for almost 2 hours

title: Do not hesitate to use it! Cheap, easy, clean!
review: First time in Thailand and we used this to get to the city and transfer to the BTS  #1  not a real concern but don't lose your chip  It is clean quiet fast easy to use (machines and instructions have English translations) and cheap It is much faster than a cab and WAY WAY WAY cheaper Definitely the way to go And no sitting in traffic

title: Easy access from Airport to city
review: Direct from airport to the city connecting major public transport like BTS and the MTR Very convenient even with luggage  Spacious and clean  Almost a seat guarantee right at the basement of the arrival hall  However you must know your destination to connect to the rest of the public transport

title: Best option
review: Best option to travel from airport to the city of Bangkok Good and prompt service  Easiest way to reach the city and back to the airport

title: Very convenient
review: Very easy to find in airport also very cheap and very convenient Don't be afraid to use Find the nearest station to you hotel on the maps and go ahead

title: Easy travel between City and Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Such an improvement over taxis or hotel pickups between the city centre and the main airport Only 45 Baht each way at time of writing

title: Clean, Efficient and Recommended
review: Available only from the Suvarnabhumi airport Located at basement B City as well as Express line  based on time taken and number of stops If  you are not travelling with lots if luggage then recommended Take a cab from the stop closest to your hotel

title: Excellent, Inexpensive, Fast
review: Unless you're in a large group this is the most sensible way to get to the airport  And it's fast  I suggest avoiding the more expensive express option and taking the local (90 vs 35 baht)  The local only takes a few minutes longer

title: Easy way to get into the centre of Bangkok.
review: Very easy to use and only 45 baht to get into the city whereas a taxi might cost at least 10 times that amount

title: Fast
review: Fast direct easy cheap direct connections to Skytrain and subway and large suitcasefriendly What more do you need after a long flight Remember the Link does not run from midnight to 600 am

title: Fast, speedy, economical and reliable
review: Fast speedy economical and reliable This service is surely good for a back packer but my family of four found it equally convenient Our children enjoyed the fast train ride too

title: Save money and time
review: This is a lifemoney saver when you arrive at BKK airport for the first time I had no idea how to reach my hotel which was around 30km from the airport and this train helped me reach my hotel in very less amount of money Later I realised that it saved my time as well since roads have heavy traffic near Sukhumvit and other places which were part of the route

title: good service
review: very good quick service into the centre of Bangkokabout 5 stops on the city lineeasy to find on reaching the airport just follow the signscheap under 50 baht per person to phaya Thai (end of line) station

title: Easy, quick, and clean
review: Easy quick and cheap (about 35 baht one way) option to access common areas from the airport It is easy to understand as long as you know what stop you need to get off of

title: Clean, fast and scenic!
review: This is definitely your best bet to get to and from t he airport We took a taxi the first time and would not recommend that Do keep in mind that there's no bathroom on this thing

title: Easy access
review: access from airport easy to find cheap and direct to main city transport links Ideal if staying in city No drama with luggage as most other passengers same issue

title: Very good with quirks.
review: Can be hard to get to in town this a quick and chewp way to get to the airport No direct connecition to the skytrain you have to go up and down stairs

title: BKK airport transport
review: This train starts from underground floor of airport Ticket price ranges from 15 to 45 bhat depending on length of journey It is super fast way to reach city center from airport

title: As easy as!!!
review: Sorry but late in the day I used the ARL into Bangkok yesterday and back out again today I bought the token downstairs in the airport building I lined up with my bags I got on ok but at the next stop half of Bangkok got on as well I got yo Makkasan and followed the crowd to the transit link with the MTR No worries Today was easier less crowds and I prebought my tokan at ASOK A breeze to use and air conditioned Note MIND THE GAP

title: my visit was mainly a rest and shopping.
review: I traveled by airport city link to Ratchaprapop railway station last year  Things were very well organised Every station was announced in English too I found it very easy to find my way to my hotel in Pratunam

title: Value of your Money.
review: Great service great value for money Good connection allover the city Fabulous and very impressive fair chart

title: nice
review: very nice and better and faster than taxi and also cheaper  i think only 65 THB you can go to Phaya Thai station

title: Convenient mode
review: Was very convenient to avoid the notorious bangkok traffic and had many entry points in the city

title: Efficient
review: This was a cheap easy and fast transition to the airport  If you don't mind being stuck in the crowd for a little while it's the way to go

title: Easy and Cheap
review: Good and Cheap way to get to the city from the airportThe time is accurate according to schedule  Just make sure to follow the security details instructionsThey will make a 1 security minute checkup prior departure and we are not allowed in the train before they finish

title: highly recommend
review: cheap and accessible for those staying connected to hotel as we are staying in asia hotel we find it is very  convenient

title: Great and inexpensive way to get to the airport
review: The airport link is usually not to busy sometimes you have to stand but it's a great way to get to and from the airport and can be good way to avoid traffic jams

title: Great way of travelling from the airport
review: Great way of travelling from the airport  Comfortable clean and very fast  Trains were quiet too  )

title: the only way to travel
review: so easy to find your way around and the staff are very friendly and helpful I highly recommend using this service  you wont be disappointed

title: cheap transport
review: great way to travel into the city avoiding taxi queues I think it is way underused for a great system

title: Can't fault it
review: Not much to say other than its easy to get to from arrivals easy to use cheap and take you to the centre of Bangkok

title: Very good for those who travel alone
review: very easy and fast to travel from the airport to the center of bangkok but if you have heavy or lots of bag its better to use taxi  also if you more than 2 people its cheaper to take taxi

title: Bankgkok Airport rail link
review: This is by far the more convenient way to get into town without getting caught in Bangkok's famous traffic jams  The rail network is fast and clean and connects to the other rail lines such that one can get to any location with ease

title: Please take it !!
review: Very usefulsave the time and money and feel comfortableThe best thing to take ARL is can avoid the traffic jam but not comfortable for the passengers with heavy baggages

title: Efficient and affordable
review: We traveled from our hotel in the city to the airport using this and were very happy with the cost and service Its by far the easiest and cheapest (and often fastest) way to get to the airport The maps in the stations are clear to use If you can navigate the London underground you'll be fine hereif not you'll probably be fine too

title: The best way to travel into Bangkok !
review: The Airport Rail link is cheap very clean  modern and quick And  you are sure to avoid the traffic

title: Saves time!
review: If you go by yourself or 12 persons then its not only faster but cheaper then a Taxi It stops at the Skytrain station in Bangkok so if you are staying near the BTS this is the best way to go

title: Airport Rail Link
review: connecting right through the airport very easy and convenient  You need to know the area you want to go  Route Map  Suvarnabhumi airport  Lat Krabang  Ban Thap Chang  Hua Mak  Ramkhamhaeng  Makkasan  Ratchaprarop  Phaya Thai  You need to know which is the closest place to your destination get down there and take a metered taxi make sure you don't go on fixed rate but meter  beat the traffic if you think your city has more traffic than bangkok even if it does not have more traffic than your city it would definitely match your city standards atleast in traffic  Airport Rail Link Go ahead and try it

title: Forget the taxis.
review: Read the title No more needs to be said This is by far the quickest way to get to central Bangkok

title: Easy
review: This is one easy way to zip from Suvarnabhumi to parts of central Bangkok  Although it ends at Phayathai you can easily transit to a BTS sky train from there or the underground MRT Fare is cheaper than taxi and you can get a view of bangkok Train may get crowded with no place to sit so this is recommended for those travelling light

title: Move into Bangkok
review: The best way to get to the BTS Station to travel forward and rech your final destination cheap and fast better than every other way from the airport

title: Convenient way to Airport
review: Forget about the taxi service they will only rip you off This is the best choice to get to the airport  to get to the city from the airport

title: Use it!
review: Go by train when you arrive at the airport It is cheap easy to understand and not busy It is located in the basement of the airport At every stop there is a connection towards to the centre

title: Fastest way into the city.
review: I take this into the city if my flight comes in during the daytime I jump on a cab to my hotel from Phaya Thai station I wish they had more escalators at Phaya Thai as I had a larger suitcase I think service ends at midnight

title: Great MRT services.
review: Travel by airport link train is by far the easiest and cheapest way to go if you are staying in Bangkok city and near to the train station it is fastest as there will be no traffic jam and they cost only 45 baht if you start from Phaya Thai and 35 bath from Makassan Makkasan station provides a taxi service counter free of charge at the ground floor of the building Trip takes around 30 minutes more or least from Phaya Thai

title: great
review: it's quicker than the taxi and a little cheaper also u get to see other places on the way in  I have used the train from airport with children and suitcases

title: fast, clean and affordable
review: fast clean and affordable this is the probably the best way from airport to central bangkok its about 40 minutes ride airconditioned

title: Cheap was to get to the airport
review: About the cheapest way to get to the airport It can get a little crowed during rush hours though You can get to it very easy from the Metro line

title: Great
review: Go by train when you arrive at the airport Approximately 1 euro easy to understand and not busy It is located in the basement of the airport At every stop there is an connection towards the center There are always taxi's

title: Quick and cheap way to get to the Centre
review: The 28km journey to the city centre takes 30 minutes It costs 40 baht for the 8 stop journey Cheaper and quicker than a taxi The train was not crowded when we used it early in the evening Trains are clean IMHO the best way to get to the centre It also links up with the Metro and Skytrain as you would expect

title: Trip with the group of 10 folks
review: Airport link is best way to reach airport As Bangkok traffic is paining best way is to use this transport for reaching to Bangkok airport and avoid paid of being roads in taxis or autos

title: Best and the fastest way to get to/from the airport
review: Excellent service not expensive at all to travel back and forth from the airport and enough room for luggage The airlink connects to the BTS line at Phia Thai

title: Much better than sitting in a cab in rush hour
review: Much safer than getting a taxi from the airport Only takes an hour including taking the Skytrain from Phaya Thai to get from the airport to Sukhumvit all for about BHT 100

title: Fast and Reliable
review: Just like airport express train in Hong Kong Convenient mode of transpo to and from Suvarnabhumi BKK airport Interchange station is also available at Airport Rail

title: Unique Expereince
review: Great unique experience in Bangkok since it really make more convenience for myself and all travelers in making the journey through out the Bangkok town

title: BKk Airport
review: huge international airpot with lovely and cheap magic food court Love the noodle soup in there and it only costs 45 baht

title: Only way to travel
review: From the airport it is 7 stops to Phaya Thai station where you can get of and catch the BTS to your next destination   Very easy to get around as a lot of the stations have lifts or elevators to make it easy to transport your luggage

title: Rapid transport
review: Fast comfortable journey Trains are quite frequent Does what its supposed to do Most stations are connected directly to a BTS or MRT line

title: Takes you straight to the heart of the City but....
review: Like their SkyTrain is an excellent system that takes you right into Bangkok City  Clean and efficient  Be warned the major drawback is their lack of ramps (in fact almost nonexistent) so be prepared to lug your luggage down the stairs and along broken and narrow pavements potholds etc  Having checked out the taxi prices in our wisdom decided to take the train to our regrets  And the rush hour trafficcommuters does not help  My advise if you do not wish to lug around your heavy luggage(s) take the taxi

title: Quick and quiet transfer to/from downtown
review: Arriving at Bkk international airport suvarnaburmi and need to go to the city  Use this quick (20') safe and cheap transportation Access at level 1 in the airport and cross connection very easy to the Mrt subway or Bts subway All information boards are written in Thaï and English languages

title: Airport rail link
review: Excellent means of getting to  from the city from the airport You have the choice of an express service (more expensive) or a stopping all stations service shared with the general public It is only 7 stations to the city and does not take long A short 50 metre or so walk to then link up with the BTS Skytrain The Airport Rail link is a "private" service for which you purchase a token for the trip The BTS Skytrain is totally separate and require you to either purchase a reloadable travel card  refundable 50 baht deposit plus an initial 150 baht load  or pay for each trip as it occurs Choose depending on the circumstances of your stay

title: Clean and fast
review: Practical train if you need something fast and cheap to go directly to the city Clean and fast I recommand it

title: Best way to go from airport to city
review: Best way to go from Airport to city and back Due to the heavy traffic in BKK this is the only way to come to the hotel fast

title: easy and cheap option for the commute
review: I have only taken the link a few times but it is easy reliable and a fast option for travelers The link can become crowded and at times I have heard it has been hard to board the train with the amount of people and the trains to have large intervals for arrival and departure times so leave extra time to allow for this in peak hours Easy way to beat out the heavy traffic and taxi fare

title: Great deal with the price and time
review: The fastest way to get to Bangkok city from Sovanmaphumi Airport is to use this train quite cheap and take maybe less than 45min to get to the city

title: Pleasant ride
review: Fast and punctual Pleasant and smooth ride Spacious and adequate space for luggage Much preferred to taxis because of the frequent jams

title: One of the best forms of transportation in BKK
review: This is the best way to get tofrom the airport avoiding traffic and unscrupulous taxi drivers  My suggestion is to arrive at Phaya Thani and take it all the way to the airport  The ride is about 30

title: Great cheap way to get around
review: Efficientfast and cheap Easy to use Take lift to bottom floor of airport Staff are there to make it easier for foreigners Soooo cheap

title: Hightly recomment
review: Airport link is fast and convient… I recommend for everyone to take airport link  Becasue it is cheaper and faster Highly Recommend

title: Use the airport rail link instead of a taxi!
review: We used this train twice In one hour you go from Bangkok city to the airport No traffic jams Clean and air conditioned train Good value for your money

title: Best option for traveling to Sukhumvit
review: Ysed this link a lot of times Always take de blue city line Lower costs than taxi or the red expressline Still within 25 minutes in Makasan There you can easily take the MRT (1 stop) to Sukhumvit where a lot of hotels are situated

title: The only way to leave or return to the airport
review: the fastest way into town by far  This is my favourite way to get into BKK and it's crazy traffic  quite and efficient

title: easy way to/from airport
review: not much to say apart from its a great alternative to a taxi I(though these are relatively cheap in Bangkok) and good links to the traintube network in Bangkok

title: Fastest way to go to the city center from Airport
review: Airport rail link is connected to the BTS on phaya thai station Fast and convenient way to go to the city center directly from the airport

title: If you want to avoid Bangkok traffic and you are traveling light ,this is the way to go
review: I booked my stay in Bkk near the MRT so that I could avoid traffic and use this line From Asoke it was one station to makasan and a 5 minute walk to the connecting Airport linkwith clear signs to show you the way From Asoke to the airport including the change of lines took me 35 minutes I only had one bag with me making things a lot easier but I did see some people with more luggage although I would imagine that might make the trip less apealing It also costs a fraction of what a taxi would charge I paid a total of 50 baht

title: The fastest and most easy to city center from Airport
review: i have used this line 6 time since i must come back and pick up my friend to hotel cannot imagine what then if Bangkok dont have this line or my friend's landing in Don Muong Airport

title: almost crowded at all time..
review: Too crowded at daytime but just 45bath straight to the city center very affordable and standard service hours from early morning to midnight

title: Life Saver !!!
review: Got stuck in the jam while going to airport in the cabone of the locals helped and suggested us to take the airport link  Just got in time to catch our flights

title: Fast method to get into city
review: Easy to locate at the airport (Basement)  Fastest way to get into Bangkok city avoiding crazy hour traffic jams and cheap too

title: Perfect. Don't take taxi, this is so much cheaper.
review: Cost per person if I remember correctly is 45BHT We were 2 so it cost us 90 BAHT + 150 BHT Tuktuk to get to our hotel A taxi for same destination is 600BHT What a rip off  Take the sky rail it's a much nicer view Remember that if you're a tourist most thai people will try to rip you off

title: Convenient.
review: Very Convenient and easy to use to and from The Intl Airport Clean and cool About 30 minutes ride to city center Budget

title: excellent, clean and efficuent
review: great affordable system to connect you into Bangkok's train system  no need for a taxi or limo  trains are modern and stations are well equipped with knowledgeable staff

title: Quickest way into central Bangkok
review: A quick easy and cheap way to get into central Bangkok Conveniently links up with BTS at Phaya Thai Avoids the inevitable traffic jams encountered when travelling by bus or car

title: Best mode of transport
review: Faster way to reach airport from far away area instead of getting stuck in a traffic to catch a flight

title: Easy to use
review: All you need is to have your trip well planned carry the map and ask the front desk operator for your token to your desired destination it is really easy

title: The fastest way to get into town
review: Easy fast save and cheap transport into town access to the bts skytrain for further connections into town

title: Cheap reliable and fast service to the airport
review: I rode the train today from the airport to Phaya Thai I was able to get a seat on the train but it got crowded after the second stop and had people standing The fare from the airport to Phaya Thai was 45 Baht My BTS ride from Playa Thai to Saphan Taksin was 41 Baht The whole trip from the airport cost only 86 THB $240 I know of no other city in the world that has a fast rail link to the airport that operates at suck a low cost For my BTS ride I bought a rabbit card for fast entry and exit from the system

title: Easy to use, convenient, unearthly cheap!!
review: Only 45 Baht from Phraya Thai BTS Station (last station in the city centre) to SVB Airport Unbelievable but true Phraya Thai is just 2 stops from Siam Paragon and the numerous other shopping areas of central Bangkok The travelling time is about 45 mins with about 6 stops in between This should be the preferred transportation from airport to city and viseversa Beats the traffic jam and costly taxi fare

title: Fast, Cheap, Easy
review: I timed it and it took almost exactly 23 minutes to get from the airport to the Makkasan Station  That's fast  It comes frequently but it still gets crowded  Even so highly recommended

title: Cool, efficient, good value
review: Air cone was a relief and it's easy to use Only up to 45BHT for a trip so good value Vending machines have an 'English' option if the ticket queue is too long

title: So easy to find and great value
review: Airport rail link is so easy to find and great value Rail link drops you off at the intersection with the Skytrain and is far more quicker than getting a taxi with the state of the traffic in Bangkok most of the time

title: I always take this service upon arrival
review: Airport Rail Link was established on June 2010 It has been a great help to avoid the traffic jam and the quickest way to reach to your hotel after a long flight There are 2 services  the Express Line and the City Line The Express line is a direct service which would drop you at BTS (Sky train station) while the City Line stops at every station on its rout and BTS ( Phaya Thai station) is the last stop of  the City Line Some people who have too much luggage might not find if comfortable as its not easy to drag your luggage around  If you are going to airport then there is a check in facility at the first stop At Makkasan station for   Express Line  and at  Phaya Thai station for City Line so you can drop your luggage there and reach at the counter at the airport to get your boarding card its very easy

title: Fastest & Cheapest way to the airport
review: A ride from Makkasan station (next to Petchburi MRT station) to Suvarnabhumi Airport only costs 35 baht   Takes about 30 minutes with a few stops in between to get to the airport   Beware of rush hours though as it can get VERY crowded and you may have to miss the first 2 rounds of the train due to long queue and crowd   Train is clean and has got good air conditioning

title: Easy and Very Convenient
review: I have taken Airport link couple of times and wish we could have something similar in other Asian countries

title: Quick and easy
review: This link is cheap and takes you right to the train station beneath the airport  Trains run on schedule and are clean and fast  Several stations to board from the inner city and outer suburbs  Nice view of the city and surrounds along the way  Most locals will understand English is you need to ask a questions

title: Brilliant for us... do your research first
review: I thought the Airport link was easy and great value It was relliable and made our journey to and from the airport almost effortless It was busyer in the morning but by no means uncomfortable if you have luiggage you should be in the standing section anyway and you can always sit on your bags Get a trolley at the airport and take the lift to the station there is only a small amount of steps to the platform and most other stations have escalators out  You can't expect the line to go every where you want it to so do some reasearch before you book a place to stay For us it was easy we took the airport link then shared a taxi with another couple near to our hotel which was not expensive When we went back to bangkok we chose a hotel within walking distance to the airport link station but also close to other attractions we wanted  If you choose any old hotelhostel before you check where the airport link stations and what other transport is around no wonder people find it hard  Besides traffic this is a really easy city to get around with or without luggage  You really don't need to take much with you especially if your only going for a couple of weeks just pack light and take a large rucksack rather than a suitcase laundry services will wash your things in less than 24hrs  Although I reccomend buying a cheap suitcase out there if you want to go home with tons of shopping it's never as bad lugging things around when you leave and you'd be supprised what you can fit on a tuktuk

title: quick and easy to use
review: Be prepared to be squashed and stand at peak times also if you have a seat make sure you offer it up to appropriate people  handicapped pregnant aged monks etc

title: no problems
review: a great fast way to get from bkk to Bangkok city centre  clean fast  efficient and very regular

title: Good & Fast!
review: Good cheap & fast way of travelling from airport to the city area There is no problem even I'm travelling with my 70 years old mum & 5 years old niece The staffs are very helpful

title: easy travel back to BKK airport
review: so cheap and comfortable dont be scared to use this transport to find other parts of the city if you get lost  ask someone who looks official

title: A standard Airport connection.
review: Straight to City Centre One train change One flight of stairs to be walked in entire journey Total time 75 mins

title: Excellent way to travel from Airport to city.
review: Stayed at KC Place at Rathaprarop and found this mode of transportation to be most appropriate took 20 mins to travel to nearest station and 5 mins walk to hotel Ratchaprarop station also has Indra Square and Baiyoke Sky Hotel in very close vicinity It is excellent way to avoid rush hour traffic and save some taxi money It took 40 bhat per person to travel from airport to Ratchaprarop

title: Airport rail link
review: Great to be able to go downtown directly from airport by public transport Cheap and efficient Connects to metro at Makassan

title: Fastest access to city
review: This airport link is very easy convenient and fastest way to access the city Only takes half hour to reach the city and cheaper than a taxi Last stop at Phaya Thai station which you can interchange with BTS or taxi

title: Very convenient
review: This is a great service between 6am and Midnight Less than 50b per person and takes you from the airport straight to the city Much cheaper and easier than a taxi

title: Quick way to reach city
review: Quick and cheap way to reach city if you travel in small group of not more than 3 persons For group of 4 persons cheaper to get a taxi unless you want to avoid the traffic jam hours

title: Awesome Transportation
review: This is a great way to get around parts of Bangkok that are not along the BTS route And if you are new in Bangkok it is great to stay along the airport link until you get situated We used the link every day when we first moved to Bangkok The schedule does change but they post the schedule for weekdays and weekends

title: Very convenient
review: If you have planned nicely or know your way this is a very reasonable mode of transport I dont remember name of a hotel which is just right next to a station can be Ok for a short visit

title: cheap yet will carry you conveniently
review: very cheap i cant believe it well maybe because everything in singapore where im from is expensive spacious sitting arrangement and got big spaces for your luggages too and mostly can bring you to you r destination fast and away from bangkok's super heavy traffic

title: Economical...
review: Just experience the Bangkok traffic oncethen you will realize the importance of this rail link I am sure the first timers will become mad after experiencing the Bangkok's traffic there are places where the traffic will move 2km per hour No exaggerationit's my experience Once your immigration is done collect the baggage and come out You will find clear suggestions and directions to access the rail link in the airport It costs around 45 bahts to travel to central areas of Bangkok and it is deadly fast Of course it is AC train so that you can enjoy the train in the Bangkok's hot weather

title: Cheap & efficient
review: Jamfree fussfree and extremely comfortable This is the best mode of transit if you want to get into the city center or vise versa It is especially good if you are catching a flight because it allows you to plan your time more efficiently without having to worry about traffic Very clean with super cooling air conditioning

title: The Most Excellent, airport rail link ever.
review: It very easy to find this from Suvabarnhumi airport  Go to basement and buy a token to get on the rail link Very clean and cooler with AC very easy to follow and twenty minutes to get to the other end Very Simple Lots of people use this and having suitcases Also very safe with Rail Warden watching at every station Cost 45 Bahts Less than one pound

title: Brillant - wish we had one in Belfast
review: Very cheap  45 THB one way Takes about 40 minutes to the airport and connects to the skyrail Plenty of seats and space for luggage Very easy to nagivate

title: Tourist pass $10 all day ticket
review: Great value for you money you can go everywhere only problem you pay $20 then you return you ticket at the end of your journey and get ten $10 back

title: Economical
review: If you want to save time and money and is eco lover  The link is for you and the best part is at each station there is Taxi pick up point

title: Forget the traffic
review: You can seriously spend well over 90 minutes getting into Bangkok so if you are staying anywhere near a BTS station get the Airport Link and then jump on the BTS It is clean safe and always on time

title: Easy - just do it
review: Trains are an awesome cheap and easy way to get around My advice is to make sure you have plenty of time to get to and from each place before your flight Even though this train goes in one straight linethere were still people struggling  It's a good way to get a grasp on the "day to say" living of the locals and to also feel like you have "beaten the tourist route" of easier traveling

title: fast and efficient!
review: easy and fast Easy to find from airport and by far the cheapest option Easy to find accomodation close to one of the links

title: Only Way
review: I love this Airport link I used Taxis for a long time until I got sick of either them driving too fast or the traffic was too slow Super easy to get all over Bangkok by rail

title: 45 bhat from swampy to downtown
review: And people still complain Wow FYI the train is in the bottom floor of the airport and goes as far as Phaya Thai Bts This review was rejected because it has less than one hundred characters Hold on lemme hit submit again

title: efficient
review: a very easy way to get to the city centre  very cheap about 300 baht and quick  well maintained and safe to go on

title: good way to travel
review: cleanfastcheapbeats a taxi cabgreat way to get roundget you to down Bangkokeasy to usesee you in bangkok

title: train ride
review: awesome train to be in nice clean and spacious walkway well ventilated There's always an interesting place in every stop

title: Great, easy to reach, cheap train service
review: Plus it's a scenic route on an elevated train thru 'slice of life' Bangkok neighborhoods Take the train to the airport and can even change to a bus to Pattaya from there

title: fast and easy
review: Quick and effortless only if your not carrying too much luggage  Clean and is a direct link to bbks sky link train

title: Makes life easy
review: Don't remember anything negative it was all good Easiest thing to do is buy a ticket from the staff at the booth rather than try to battle the machines Info on the trains is in Thai and English the service is great

title: Cheap easy fast
review: We use the airport link often  Even when we have to stay in bangkok ok for several hours we jump on the train and head to the city to eat  Very cheap

title: good solution for  reaching a center
review: It not work after midnight up to 6 o'clock in the morning Because of intercontinental flights it will be good if staff of Airport Rail Link open few nights rides

title: Smooth journey
review: Quite easy to hop onto the train from our hotel Pathuwan Princess Surprisingly it is clean and the airconditioning is effective

title: Great Way To Arrive in The City
review: We took the Rail link as it stopped close to our Hotel Its a great service clean & AC'ed As soon as the doors opened & we got out we were hit by the Bangkok heat & the smell of spicy chicken grilling A pretty perfect start to our visit Down some stairs grab some chicken & jump into a TukTuk Great stuff

title: very efficient, cheap and fast
review: Like the rest of the MRT very efficient cheap and fast way to get to the city center from the airport and viceversa Has connection to the train and to the Skytrain The bus would be cheapper but this is a quicker transport and a lot more comfortable

title: Superfast journey
review: Saved a lot of time during our return journey towards Suvarbhumi Int'l Airport Fast Less crowd & no worries of traffic Despite heavy baggage didn't have trouble due Escalator

title: Connectivity and fastness at its core
review: Sky train is almost everywhere in Bangkok and the best ways to commute if your hotel is near to the station  It takes enormous time getting down the stairs carrying your luggage Please dont mistake and climb up or down on a manual steps each station has an escalator So find one for you  * Connectivity timings is amazing and you will not wait for a long time to get a train  * Train is superfast and dont have the issue of getting stuck in traffic as via road is pretty tiresome as traffic is heavy   The other best way of transport is Bell Services  httpwwwbelltravelservicecompagesPageHomeaspx which offers intra city and inter city transfers  Also refer to the FAQ How to get from the AIRPORT to your HOTEL on tripadvisor httpwwwtripadvisorcomTravelg293915c116554ThailandFromBangkokAirportToHotelhtml  This would make your travel happy and planful   Happy Journey folks )

title: Awesome metro, fast and clean!
review: I took the metro from Suvarnabhumi to Ramkhamhaeng and return Its spacious less crowded and very fast I had no problems getting on and off with 2 luggages

title: Express Line 15-20 minutes to Airport
review: Express Line  Good for express service  shorten the time   avoid the traffic   price is ok  City Line   too much people after office hours most of office worker use for their transportation back home To avoid lots of people don't go after 6 PM  8 PM  Staff can advice about the time exactly

title: Great quick way out to the airport.
review: I would suggest taking the Airport Rail Link if you are a solo traveler or traveling during rush hour in Bangkok The train system is very efficient and drops you right off at the airports lower level You can wave to all the people sitting in traffic on the highway out to the airport too

title: 10th wonder of the world.
review: Okay  Not really  But this is the best addition to Bangkok since the traditional Thai massage  No traffic  Relaxing  Good stuff

title: Airport - to Bkk city
review: Clean fast not really expensive is the right solution if you don't want to stak on the terrible bangkok traffic

title: speed without trouble matters
review: it is convenient to reach the airport and no pollution or rush hour and real quick less risk than a cape clean incognito means no questioning why and where from

title: impressive
review: Very very convenience and comfortable transportation system in Bangkok It is very good for the travellers

title: Very convenience
review: Nice trip for traveling into the city Very convenience and economy It is linked with the others BTS line

title: Fastest and Cheapest way to Bangkok City Center
review: Economical and convenient option to go between BKK airport and Bangkok city center  The train departs every 15 mins and 10mins during peak hours  It took only around 30 mins to get to our hotel which is right next to the last stop of Airport Rail Link  Super convenient and quick  Highly recommend if you want to get the city center quickly  There are about 6 stops in between the airport to City Center

title: Great service
review: It is very convenience and comfortable to go to Suvarnabhumi airport and go back into the city The price is not much high comparing with the service

title: Give I a try
review: Seems a little daunting at first going from the city to the airport but Lo of helpful people along the way I will be using this again

title: Great city transit system!!
review: One of the best ways to get around Bangkok So efficient and just so easy to navigate Also lots of friendly helpful people in case you need a question answered

title: Transfer Airport - BKK-City
review: Faster and cheaper than any Grap or Taxi Several stops so you can change to MRT or BTS Perfect connection

title: Super easy even for a novice traveler
review: Ticket coins bought right before the entrance  Super easy to use even for a novice  Ticket machines offer instructions in English

title: Fast , Efficient and Clean.
review: I wish every city had this mode of transportation Singapore Denver and San Francisco have similar systems too  I really enjoy this service and use it whenever possible

title: Easiest and cheapest way into town
review: Easiest and cheapest way to get tofrom BKK Taxis are expensive and often try to rip off tourists (eg won’t use the meter and overcharge) If you have lots of big luggage the BTS may not be the best as it can get crowded with Thais going to and from work When I return to Thailand this is my preferred choice to get into town

title: Fast and cheap
review: Excellent service Have used this few times to commute between BKK and the city Fast and cheaper way ot reach Suvarnabhumi

title: Great Transportation to Bangkok airports
review: On our last day in Bangkok we took the Airport Rail Link back to the Suvarnabhumi Airport for our fight home  The train provided excellent transportation and speedy service at a low cost  Quiet train with comfortable passenger cars

title: Welcome to Bangkok
review: I had to use this service quite a few times in the last week as I was working at the airport So thought I should just give a big kick Excellent service As a local I’m very proud of this link

title: Hassle Free
review: Cheap fare ticket going to the airport cool trains and efficient Hassle free that's why I recommend this to tourists

title: Efficient and cheap!
review: Unless you have mountains of luggage the airport rail link is by far the easiest way of traveling to Bangkok as from the various stations on the link you can change to other lines although when changing to different rail networks you have to buy a new ticket The airport rail link trains run frequently and tickets or discs can be bought at machines so it's worth having plenty of coins although notes will be accepted The trains run from the airport at Suvarnabhumi to Phaiya Thai and a one way journey costs 45  baht The trains are also used by commuters so they can become very busy at  certain times of the day but in all probability your journey will be relatively quiet as most passengers are concentrating on their mobile phones  Trains are clean and are regularly security checked Although tourists do make use of the rail link if you have an excessive amount of luggage you may need to risk using a taxi

title: Airport Link Rail to Suvannabhumi Airport
review: I had the occasion to use the airport link service again during my recent visit to Bangkok  I boarded at the Rajthewi BTS station to Praya Thai BTS station for a transfer to the airport link rail  The elevator at the Rajthewi BTS station is now functioning properly and appeared quite clean compared to my previous visit when it did not work and I had to lug my bags upstairs in the downpour    Once at the Praya Thai station the guard was very courteous and pointed me to the right direction to connect to the airport link rail  The cost remains nominal at 45 Baht or approximately USD 150  The link rail was clean air conditioned and ran on time getting me to the airport within approximately 20 mins from Praya Thai BTS station  The only thing that they might consider improving is the gap between the train and the platform which is approximately 2  3 inches wide  If there were a small ramp or the gap could somehow be closed or narrowed the ride would have been far safer and requires less efforts in transporting the luggage in and out of the train  Other than that I would still prefer riding on the the airport link to the hotel taxi  Check it out the next time you are in Bangkok

title: best way to get from airport
review: skips all the traffic jam of roads reliablegood schedule ontime fare is cheap good Connection to skytrains

title: Fast and easy
review: Very easy and cheap way to get to Pratunam area for abundance of hotels and great shopping Stop at Ratchaprarop station

title: Link from airport to main bangkok
review: There is rail link which links the airport the various main places in Bangkok from where one could the skytrain and get into any place in BangkokThis is very convenient link only draw back is it does not have round ticket which includes to and fro and skytrain one day journey ticket which will be of great help to transit passengers who would want to take a day trip into Bangkok in between flights

title: Excellent and cheap public transport
review: ARL is the best option for those whose staying downtown Bangkok We reached BKK at 845am and after custom and immigration by 930am we're already on our way to Phaya Thai (7th and last stop on ARL) And another half an hour off to take BTS to our hotel (Asia Hotel)  The ARL is two floors below arrival hall at the airport Ticket machines are at the gate of ARL Decent queues should be expected during peak hours (We bought online through Klook) Should cost you 45 baht per single trip

title: Easy and Cost Efficient
review: If you are looking for an easy cost effective way to get to and from the airport this is a great option Prior to using I watched a few online videos that explain how to use and it is exactly as easy as described Simply go down to Level B where signage is plentiful throughout the airport Once you get down there you will see a few machines and the first screen offers the user to select English Next simply input how many tickets which stop you are exiting and enter your currency (I paid 40 Baht) Once the admission is paid take your token and any change and head over to the entrance where you will scan the token (be sure to keep the token because when you exit you will need to deposit it) While riding stop names are broadcasters in English so it is that easy

title: brings is fast to the center
review: easy to use not expensive Cuts the traffic jams Air conditioned Not connected with other transportation options like the metro lines

title: Clean, efficient and simple to use
review: A lot of countries can learn from the Airport Rail Link in Thailand Including my own (United Kingdom) Each ticket machine is in Thai and can be changed to English you simply pick which station you want to go to pay the fee (about 120th the cost of travelling on the train in the UK) grab your token and away you go Your token is scanned at your first station to allow you through the barriers and it is collected at your destination station ensuring no wastage Genius You are also not allowed to eat or drink on the rail link which is another great thing about this service Each train was so clean A great service all round

title: First visit to Bangkok
review: Great service from the Airport Busy in rush hour but we still got a seat Very reasonably priced at 45THB each Staff very helpful opening barriers for us making it easier for us to get through with our cases Great way to avoid the Bangkok traffic

title: Fast and efficient
review: This is an excellent way to get to the city At 45 baht cash only  it's a lot cheaper than a taxi and much quicker You catch it at Suvarnabhumi airport and at the last stop Phaya Thai you can connect with the skytrain The trains are clean and air conditioned

title: Very effective
review: An easy way to get from the airport to Bangkok We paid 90 bht instead of about 600 bht with a taxi Clean conditioned and on time  Experience the real thing

title: Excellent Airport Rail link
review: First visit to Bangkok in October 2019 and the Airport Rail link was excellent Easy to buy tickets as you select your stop and screen available in English Local Thais are nearby and are so so helpful  so definitely use this to get to and from Airport to other rail stops around Bangkok Very fast and on time trains

title: 30 minutes airport to centre
review: Fantastic service for getting from airport to centre and back switch to underground at Rakasan similar speed to taxi

title: Airport Rail link
review: Excellent way to leave the Airport Quick and easy The price to my stop has remained B40 forever Clean and neat

title: Excellent
review: Not used this before and was really impressed so fast and cheap Need to go down stairs when you get to airport to board it

title: Fast, clean and cheap
