review: Buy a token for 45 baht and travel to the end of the line  Be careful oh ticket machine which only takes cash and when I used it only gave 50 baht change not 55  Quick and then simple to transfer to other transport

title: Great Service
review: The Sky Train from the airport to the centre of Bangkok is a great service I always take it if I don't have too much luggage The stations on the line are all near the popular Hotels

title: Functional but the coin tokens take some getting used to
review: It's well designed for an airport train there's enough room to sit down with your luggage Now if only the rest of the transport system was as well linked up Give it time though

title: Best transportation from Airport to The City
review: We had ARL to connect between Suvarnabhumi and downtown of Bangkok You can stop at Makkasan Station or Phaya Thai Station as the last stop of ARL depend of your nearest hotel location in BangkokIt's cost around THB 40 per person for oneway trip to Makkasan It's very cheap and efficient transportation

title: Easy, Efficient
review: The title says it all really the Airport Rail Link provides a connection from Suvarnabhumi Airport via Makkasan Station to Phaya Thai station in central Bangkok  We were staying in the Sukhumvit area so changed onto the MRT (blue line) to Sukhumvit (which also links to the BTS Asok station)   Just buy a token at the machines or the helpful ticket counter and you’re off

title: Airport rail link
review: This is not only the cheapest (45 baht) way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport it's also the fastest Connects directly to the BTS at Phaya Thai station so you can get anywhere in the city without getting ripped off by a taxi driver at the airport

title: A quuck way to airport
review: This airport rail link is really helpful in avoiding the traffic Only thing is that it is always full If your travelling with kids and luggage i recommend you to have atleast 2hours extra time and take the express train to airport

title: fastest way to get to the airport
review: The BTS connects directly to the airport link and is actually faster in rush traffic From the BTS it only cost 44 bht to ride so very affordable as well as clean and with AC

title: perfect people mover
review: pickup inside airport at ground level connects to all other transport options good ac and good seating

title: Easy
review: Place like bangkok this good  Easy to get airport not traffice  Very good system  Use airport Rail Link easy and first

title: Excellent Service
review: This Rail Link is much better than being stuck in traffic its has a lot of stops but it takes you directly to the airport Excellent Service

title: Airport Transfer
review: I find this a great way to get into Bangkok central if I' not carrying too much luggage The Airport line links into the BTS and also the MRT

title: Best way to get around. Tips from a pro!
review: It’s the quickest and best way to get around The trains are new and air conditioned with tv screens  Firstly do your homework and study the train map If you’re not within walking distant to a train stop then you may want to take a taxi to the station especially during week days during rush hours Taxis are cheap Bangkok traffic jams can be your biggest nightmare and ruin your precious limited vacation time If you can’t find a taxi in your area then download the Grab app to get one If you’re not far from where you are going and traffic is not bad then stay in your taxi to your destination  When getting to the station make sure you have coins handy to buy tickets at the machines otherwise you will experience a lengthy wait time at the customer service counter  Also there’s 2 different companies that run the mass transit train systems If you have ever been to Tokyo it’s the same way In Bangkok the above ground and underground lines are independent from each other but do connect at various stations So study your map and good luck

title: Excellent fast service from and to airport
review: This is a great service that we recommend for 35 Bhat per person in our case to and from Makhasan Station (20 minutes)  Great security service  My wife left behind in the taxi her bag with computer and personal belongings and we managed to meet a motorcycle security who chased the taxi and retrieve the bag the biker declined a tip  This was amazing experience

title: A quick way to travel from the airport
review: The best way to avoid the heavily congested Bangkok traffic  It was comfortable and convenient  Cheap as well  The line up to get a token was long when we used the train

title: Airport Rail Link
review: An excellent service punctual clean and good VFM If you plan to use it regularly then buy a prepaid card but note the cards are not interchangeable with MRT or BTS The alternative is to have some small change and use the ticket machines which have an English language option and are easy to navigate

title: Super reliable transport system!
review: i love the ARL in bangkok generally love their public transport in comparison with taking cabs or tuk tuk The ARL is also translated out in english so tourist should not have a problem using the ARL to get into downtown It cost a maximum of 45baht which is very affordable in comparison with a cab

title: Fastest and best way to the airport
review: This route is the best and fastest way to the airport  If you can get near a Green BTS line you can connect to this Red Line

title: Easy and intuitive
review: Landed in Bangkok and had already decided to try the mass transit out to our hotel Possibly the easiest and cleanest public transport I have EVER had the pleasure of using  Very easy and cheap system to use would recommend those landing in BKK try it

title: Convenient
review: Very convenient to use I used it once and it was very reliable Looking forward to coming back in the future

title: Best deal in town
review: The airport link train is the best deal in the city For a maximum of 45b you can ride from the airport into downtown Bangkok There are multiple station stops where you can transfer to subway skytrain or city line trains The trip from the airport to the end of the line at Phaya Thai station takes a maximum of about 45 minutes Cars are clean and well air conditioned Not much room for luggage so if you come to town really loaded down with bags you might want to take a taxi instead

title: Fast, Convenient & Cheap - 快、方便又便宜
review: It is fast & easy to drive you to the downtown & easy access to city subway system to go everywhere Its price is very cheap It has a lot trains & make it convenient for all purpose It is clean & passengers are polite  這個系統很快的就載妳到市區，馬上連結到市區地鐵系統，讓你到哪裡都很方便；價錢很便宜，班次很多所以做什麼事都很方便，很乾淨、乘客都很有禮貌。

title: good servie
review: you go by sky train to airport stop they will announce this on train  you then have a small walk to the next train which takes you to the airport it is very well sign posted

title: Easy and cost effective transport
review: Take the train into the city and a taxi from there good quick way to get into town and avoid all the traffic

title: Easy and cheaper transportation
review: Very convenient to travel from swrnaboomi airport to payathai and cheap when you travel alone It is always better to know where your hotel is before getting into the train

title: fast and affordable
review: fast affordable and convenient   connects to both mtr and bts so really makes it simple to get anywhere in the city from the airport

title: Brilliant if your hotel is by a station
review: Our hotel happened to be right next to a Airport Rail Link station (Akara Hotel) and this was such an easy way to get to and from the airport The charge was only 40 bahts each way and it took only 25 mins in total A really good service and one I would highly recommend using if you are staying close to a station

title: Great
review: To get around this is the best way to travel  especially at busy times when the traffic is bad it is clean and efficient

title: Avoid traffic!
review: If you want to escape bangkok´s traffic this is your best option better if you travel only with small suitcases

title: Best Way to Get to downtown Bangkok
review: Quick efficient only 8 stops to Sukhumvit and inexpensive  Why spend so much for a cab  Take the train  Very comfortable as well

title: Quick and cheap
review: It has taken Bangkok a long time to build and run a Skytrain link to the airport  But all the connections are now made and you can very easily get to it by Metro at Petchaburi  There’s a proper bridge over the road to Macassar station  I went from Silom to the airport for ThB 70 which is less than £2 and it’s so easy and quick  But it is so popular you might have to stand

title: Fast, easy and cheap
review: Best mode of transportation from airport to city (and back) especially if you are staying close to any of the ARL stations It is fast easy to access and cheap

title: Quick and cheap
review: Again the traffic can make you Bangkok to airport trip anywhere from 35 mins to 2 hours depending on the time of day So the Airport Rail Link is the obvious option Clean airconditioned and cheap

title: From BKK airport to Bkk city centre
review: That is absolutely a very great experience for travelling to bkk city by ARL(if you have light luggage) as it is very cheap and convenient  The ARL is pretty clean and new with well maintain condition as well  Strongly recommend for this have only one luggage or light one if you have more than that kindly consider the stair case up and down to BTS station

title: very easy to navigate
review: we used it on our return to Australia we were staying near Asok walked to the tube station accessible at street level went one station to Petchburi where the connection to the airport station is located a separate line above like a sky train Leave the tube station take exit 1 at street level at the  top of the escalators is a red sign directing you to the airport train on your left buy a ticket from the vending machine when you get into the airport station It was very easy to navigate and our first time doing so

title: Fast and Convenient
review: It's a very convenient to and from the airport which is very economical as well From start to the last station will only cost you 49 Baht per trip which you can avoid the costly taxi fare and traffic jam

title: Easy access
review: Depending your hotel location this airport  rail link is the most economical way to get you to your hotel destination

title: The best public service from town to Suvarnabhumi airport
review: With a ridiculous tkt you will arrive inside the airport avoiding the harassment of the taxi surcharging just because you are not Thai  Consider it does not run 24 hours per day check the updated schedule on their website to plan your trip

title: Fast and easy transfer from airport to town
review: Easily the best mode of transfer from airport to town without the notorious traffic in bkk Cheap too only THB45 from airport to last station (Phaya Thai) Direct connectivity to BTS and MRT at certain stations My preferred choice

title: cheap easy system
review: good way to get back and for to airport cheap and saves all the nightmare of the traffic clean trains and safe are also very kind and helpful point you in right direction

title: Airport Rail Link- So Convenient and Efficient!
review: The traffic in Bangkok is one of the busiest in the world When I arrived in Bangkok I used the Airport Rail Link to get to the station near the end of the line From that station I walk 5 minutes to arrive at the home I was staying for the next 30 days The whole trip took 20 minutes but if I had taken a taxi from the airport it would have taken over 15 hours to get to my destination Along with the BTS SkyTrain and the MRT Subway I used it extensively to get around town and avoid the horrible traffic by car taxi motorcycle taxi TukTuk or local bus Bangkok has a fantastic and highly efficient transportation system

title: Great!
review: Fantastic way to get to the airport it's cheap and fast  Beats the crazy traffic in Bangkok which is quite a big bummer when you have a plane to catch

title: The best way of getting into Bangkok
review: Must take the airport rail link to central Bangkok Do not stay stuck in traffic for hours when you take a taxi not worth it This train connects you to several other lines of metro and skytrain so very easy to get around From B floor at BKK airport you get the token for the train and in 25 minutes you are in central Bangkok

title: Good train
review: We took this train from Bangkok Airport to Ratchsprop Station for reaching Pratunam It was fascinating jouney throuhout the time after watching huge tall builings on the way It is also cheapest one and less time consuming

title: Straight to the Suvarnabhuni Airport
review: Cost me 35 bath to get to airport and took less than 30 minutes for over 7 stations  Could put more compartments to store your luggage in

title: Simple clean cheap
review: Easy to use clean a simple hassle free way to get to your hotel Many hotels are walking distance from the stops Safe to use at night This is the most affordable way to get out of the airport and probably the fastest

title: Use it every time
review: So easy when you stay on the MRT or BTS line Cheap Clean and on time Really the best way to and from the airport Can be very full at peak times so maybe plan your departure and arrival to avoid morning and evening work peaks  Weekends no problem

title: Fast
review: Very good service Convenient saves time and affordable Takes away all the probable  harassment with taxis for travelers

title: Best way to airport
review: We have used this train a few times now  It is such an easy no stress way to get to the airport  Trains run frequently and keeps you out of the traffic

title: Comfortable, cheap and fast
review: This is the best way to reach the bangkok international airport  You skip the traffic it's cheap and it's fast  But yes you would be comfortable only with a single stroller as more than one is going to be difficult But the coach is clean and reduces your commute cost down by 50% compared to cabs

title: Fast and comfortable!
review: My friend and I were able to ride the Airport Rail Link last September 28 2018 It was easy to follow the directions to the Airport Rail Link Sadly the Express link was sold out We were still able to reach Phaya Thai station comfortably There was a lift at Phaya Thai station and a taxi counter at the ground floor Will surely use the Airport Rail Link again on our next visit

title: So easy to use
review: We were staying at the Bayioke hotel and had to get to the airport for seven AM  The station is five minutes walk away and starts at 530so we got t o airport in plenty of time  The trains are clean bright and easy to use and announcements are given in English   Our stop was seven from the airport and took 35 minutes and delivered us into the heart of the airport

title: Clean and efficient!
review: We did not use the airport rail link to go to and from the airport but rather to get around town Used it for the weekend market It was easy to use convenient  clean and quick Take the escalators down two levels to purchase tickets They have both a ticket booth and a automated machine People are very helpful when you ask for directions or assistance in determining where to get on and off Definitely the best mode of transportation Quick unlike taxis safe unlike the motor scooters and goes great distances unlike the tut tuts

title: 1st class,  no hassle
review: If your flying into Bangkok and staying in a hotel on Sukhumvit or Silom area and not to far from a BTS then this is a no brainier fast quick clean very efficient and costs pennies

title: Fast and efficient transport to and from airport
review: The train is affordable and efficient mode of transport to and from the airport Airconditioning is good and keeps me cool Great way to beat the Bangkok Jam

title: Very fast and efficient
review: Best train ride I’ve had in Bangkok and super clean too 78 minutes between arrival of trains  Wish they Could speed up the waiting period though taking the train really cuts getting through the traffic jams 👍🏻

title: Quick and simple
review: We decided to take the airport link to catch our 940 am flight to Singapore As we stayed near Asok BTS station we took an MRT ride to reach the Makassan Station It took us about 45 minutes from our hotel to the airport with the ARL Pretty convenient especially when you need to beat the Bangkok rush hour traffic

title: fast and convenient but crowded during rush hours
review: I highly recommend taking the airport rail link if you are staying somewhere that is near a train station Using the airport rail helps you avoid the Bangkok traffic The airport rail trip plus the transfer trip can be a lot shorter than sitting through traffic However the airport rail gets very busy as well so I don't recommend taking it when you have big luggage(s)

title: good way to travel
review: if you are travelling to the center of the city this is the best deal in BKK  cheap clean  goes on time  leaves on time  if you have got a lot of luggage or family I think it will be  a a bit of a pain  but I love it

title: Airport to Hotel transfer
review: Best experience we tried ARL instead of taxi and best part was escaped city traffic and were there at the Hotel without strain

title: Save on Transportation
review: Whether you are a newbie in Bangkok or an old timer like myself the Airport Rail Link is the best means of transportation towards the city You do not want to spend so much already on your first day so this train is the best suggestion I can give you to go to your hotel Check where your hotel is located and  use google directions from Suvarnabhumi Airport to your hotel It will give you directions on how to reach your hotel via this train Do not worry about not having a data package since the airport has free wifi After you get your luggage you can also avail of a sim card so you can plan your itinerary during your stay and use GPS to go around the city Make sure that you also exchange your money at the airport since they do not charge any extra fee

title: Great way to get into City
review: Our business partner was impressed with the ease of getting into the City using Airport link Definitely the way to go Easy access and great connections in any direction

title: Quickest and most reasonable way to the city
review: Check before you decide to take the Link where your hotel is located Otherwise you may have to switch trains many times and pay each time you switch for another mode of transport since all of them charge separate Therefore if you are 2 or 3 people you can just equally take a taxi for a few hundred Baht  Brings you near AsokSukhumvit at Phetchaburi Station for less than 1 US$Person and its easy

title: Very convenient and easy transport route from Airport to city
review: This is such an easy and cheap way of getting from the airport to the centre of Bangkok It's so user friendly station clearly marked in the airport route maps everywhere simple ticket purchasing system (ticket machine or ticket office) and air conditioned trains We got the train to Makkasan and connected with the underground system from there to get to Sukhumvit The walk between the two stations at Makkasan is short and a covered walkway so not onerous at all Can't remember exact price but the ticket from airport to Makkasan was approx 40 baht

title: Perfect and convenient way to get to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Perfect and convenient way to get to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport permitting you’re in central Bangkok and close to BTS (change at Phaya Thai) or MRT (Makkasan) The ARL will be extended to Don Mueang Airport in the near or distant future I hope that will come with a massive rolling stock update as there is a shortage which can cause overcrowding

title: Easy train service
review: Simple effective Not too dissimilar from the London tube Simply buy a token from the ticket machine touch it to the pad at the turn style and head for the train We’ll sign posted and easy to read maps with attendants at each station From the airport to Hua Lampong in around an our costing 30 baht per person

title: Sharp time service
review: Good way to go to the airport it’s take only 20 minutes from paya Thai to airport very good travel partner very confertable

title: This is a Rail Link that has a direction connection from the Suvarnabhumi Airport to Central Bangkok
review: When landing in Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport always remember that in the bottom level of the airport is the Airport Rail Link This is a very inexpensive choice to get into central Bangkok and even connects with the BTS SkyTrain If you do not want to pay the cost of a Taxi or are worried about getting stuck in traffic the Airport Rail Link is  your best choice

title: Amazing
review: I want to travel from Mo chit bust station to Airport Took taxi but the driver left me at airport rail link I was grateful to him for that other wise would cost more Took the ticket which costs 60bht and that Metro straightly goes to airport departure terminal Metro coaches are excellent

title: One time and i'm impressive
review: Once i have to go to airport and everything pretty rush for me so i go take airport link and it's totally fast silent and not much people  a price for ticket is cheap and you won't miss a flight i recommend this

title: Easy
review: Really easy to use and much quicker than a taxiPlenty of room for luggage  Can get busy but if you get on at the airport you will get a seat

title: Best Priced Airport - City Express
review: The link between the airport and last city stop (Thai Phraya) makes 4 or 5 quick stops  it is the fastest way into the Bangkok city center area From the Thai Phraya stop you can get a taxi or catch the SkyTrain  there are elevators and moving stairs if you have luggage  all convenient The taxi stop is located on the Airport Express side of the station  if you walk to the Skylink Phraya Thai side of the station you there is no taxi stand and you are at the mercy of the 1st taxi to spot you with your luggage and for 300 ($1000) baht can take you nearly any place  This is probably double the normal fare  SOME WISDOM  have your hotel location address and phone number handy for the drive  most taxi's use a GPS navigator app and your Thai language skills if not fluent are not much help

title: Good transportation link out of the way of traffic
review: Great way to get around the City of Bangkok Easy to use Linking all major areas Gets you out of the smog and general traffic Very clean and reasonable prices Ticket offices will always tell you the best ticket to get for your needs Everyone polite  no pushing or shoving

title: Very convenient
review: Very fast efficient reliable and inexpensive way to reach the centre of Bangkok from the airport avoiding traffic jams

title: Easy - Convenient & Fast
review: On our way back from Chiang Mai we took flight to Bangkok and choose Suvarnabhumi Airport  As we need to reach City we thought of trying Airport Rail Link(ARL)  After you picked up your baggages follow the instructions towards Airport Station  From Suvarnabhumi Airport till Phaya Thai Station there are 8 elevated station & distance almost 286KM takes nearly 30 minutes  Ticket cost 45TBH till Phaya Thai You can also get down at Makkasan Station if you you want to connect with MRT to reach Sukhumvit Area  From Phaya Thai take BTS to reach Siam  Sukhumvit Area  The best way to avoid city traffic as well as economical  Airport to City if you are Ving from expressway meter taxi will charge you around 400 to 500 TBH  Grab Cab also same but you need to pay toll separately

title: Suvannabhumi - Phaya Thai
review: Not sure what advantage there is in taking the Airport rail link unless you stay a short walk from the station If you need a taxi anyway it makes more sense to just get one from the Airport especially if you have to haul luggage

title: Easy & Cheap way to Airport
review: I got on ARL at Phayathai easy to get a seat cheap fast and safe way to travel to the airport  Highly recommend for solo traveller or small group

title: Great
review: This is such an ideal way of getting from the Airport into Bangkok We used it 4 times and it was brilliant So simple to understand even as 1st time visitors to Bangkok

title: Convenient link into inner city
review: Airport rail link is really a convenient and quick option for travellers to get into inner part of Bangkok by rail from Suvarnabhumi airport

title: Smooth as silk
review: Great cheap fast and traffic free Service is almost all day long  Keeps the Taxi meter away  Stops at every important junctions

title: Efficient
review: The Airport Rail Link is very efficient It is an easy way and access from the airport to and from the city

title: the fastest way to the city/airport
review: Aitrport Rail Link is the fastest way to the cityairport regular service at reasonable costs can be crowded when office hours end

title: Convenient Travelling
review: If you wanna roam around bangkok on your own this is the most convenient mode of travelling to opt for

title: Convenient transport
review: My travel from Suva airport to downtown Bangkok was a breeze because of this link Very convenient vending machines helpful staff comfortable and clean trains and strategic locations of stations

title: Very easy to get around
review: The rail link doesn't cost too much for a day visit and is very easy to use You have you pass ticket for the day hop on hop off and you can read the rail map to decide on where to go

title: Brilliant!
review: The airport rail link in Bangkok should be the blueprint for all airport transfers the world over It is a reliable fast safe clean easy and cheap means of transport from Suvarnabhumi to central Bangkokthe only way to go

title: Very convenient service
review: I use the Airport Rail Link at every opportunity due to it's rapid and convenient access to Bangkok's BTS and MRT lines  I have used multiple times from Suvarnabhumi airport as well as from the Lat Krabang station (near my sister in law's house)    I wish that this was an all night service from the airport as I frequently arrive on flights from Japan close to midnight  The service stops at midnight so I am forced to take a taxi when the Airport Link isn't running

title: Very quick and efficient
review: Excellent way to get from the airport to downtown Bangkok without the hassle of traffic  it is well airconditioned too

title: Easy to use and convenient
review: Taking the Rail Link is much better than a taxi stuck in the jam if you dont have heavy and bulky luggage to lug

title: Great link into City
review: Journey cost around £1 each and service very good Great to then catch the metro or local services  If a family might be easier to get a taxi at an agreed rate

title: Simple to use, Once you get there
review: With a transfer from the MRT station it is a little bit of an effort to get to the airport link but not nearly as troubling as I had expected   Tons of signage throughout the terminals and well staffed to help you out if you're in need Much cheaper than paying for a taxi or private shuttle (35 Baht)

title: Smooth Airport Connection to BTS stations
review: It was really easy to navigate the ARL (level B  take the travellators down) from the Suvarnabhumi airport arrival hall It was a cheap straightforward reliable and smooth connection to Phaya Thai at the heart of the BTS stations via the city line  Buying a train token is easy with the option for English at the ticketing machines Do have Thai baht ready to make your purchase Google maps was accurate too in estimating the total travel time to our hotel Our little 8 month old was making friends with everyone on the train and enjoying the view of Bangkok It was crowded with both tourists their luggage and locals Seeing us with a baby in a carrier a train station official was friendly and kind to gesture us to the lift lobby while the crowd was directed to the escalators  Taking the ARL was a great start to ease into getting a real sense of exploring Bangkok

title: Great Option from Airport
review: I prefer taking a train from airport to the city It is under arrival area starts at 6 am and there is a train every 20 min to the city There are transfer from whichever line you prefer to travel onwards  I always prefer this over cab You probably won't save a lot of money but it is an experience

title: great service
review: I wish I knew about this service when I landed in Bangkok I used it on the way back to the airport and was surprised to find a modern and efficient service like you find in any European capital only in this case you do not get ripped off The price is very good 40 baht The stations and train spotless and the service very frequent

title: Great Rail Serice
review: The Sky train is safe clean inexpensive and incredibly efficient It is the best way to get around Bangkok and its airconditioned

title: Quick and clean
review: We booked 2 nights at Baiyoke Tower Hotel and we traveled by metro from the airport to the hotel It was really clean and it was quick 90% of the time it was outground and you can admire the city see the areas You can take the metro from the underground level of the airport So in this city metro is a good choice no matter where you want to go

title: Easy and Great
review: Best way to travel to and from the airport to metro manila It is very clean and safe Also it is a lot cheaper than having to take a taxi If your able to take the airport rail link to or from I suggest you use it

title: Cheap and quick way to get to and from the hotel!
review: Super cheap and easy way to travel to and from the International Airport Clean air conditioned and convenient

title: Clean and fast
review: this airport rail link super helpand easy to take and also its not too expensive from Hotel to airport cost 45 Baht

title: Excellent Mode to Reach Airport
review: What an excellent way to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport from Bangkok City An approx 30min ride end to end It saves a lot time and you can avoid the traffic in the Bangkok Roads Plus it connects important zones in Bangkok from the Airport End to end fare is only 50Baht

title: Rail link best way to get to city
review: Inexpensive option to get from the International airport to Bangkok as long as you don't have massive amount of luggage

title: Just east
review: It's easy and quick and cheap  and the air conditioning is great  Best way to get close to your hotel before grabbing a tut tut or taxi

title: Convinient
review: when you have a long tiring flight and need some really quick mode of commuting then this rail link is sure for this purpose fully air conditioned and fast starts at 6 am
country: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India

title: Best way to get to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport.
review: This train goes right into the airport and runs toward central Bangkok and terminates at Phaya Thai BTS train  It also intersects with the MRT train at Makkasan  You can get almost anywhere in BKK  The train runs frequently is inexpensive clean quiet great air conditioning The full length of this line is about a half hour At each end security (soldiers I think) carefully inspect the entire train with dogs It only takes a few minutes but adds a level of safety

title: So easy to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport into Bangkok
review: Bangkok has one of the best airport rail links in the world While getting though passport control can take time (depending on how many simultaneous arrivals) the luggage seems to appear remarkably fast and then it is about 7 or 8 minutes to get to the sky train Depending on which part of the city you want to get to the journey will take 3045 minutes If you were doing the same trip by taxi in peak hour it could take 25 hours

title: Cheap and Fast ARL 👍
review: The Airport Rail Link is an express train direct to Suvarnabhumi Airport It is cheapconvenient fastest to reach airport You may board the train at Ratchraprop station or via Makkassan station It's only cost 40 baht by ARL train and can reach airport less than 30 mins

title: Best way to get to Downtown Bangkok
review: Take the Airport rail link from Suvarnabhumi Airport and you'll get to the city real fast It's cheap fast and gives a good view of Bangkok

title: Fast, inexpensive and convenience
review: Travel by Airport Rail Link is very convenience from and to Suvaพnabhumi Airport cheaper than take a taxi or airport shuttle bus and save a lot of time fro travel Every station has an elevator and escalator

title: Excellent way to beat the bangkok snarlup
review: 45 baht per person to downtown and no traffic jams Then a taxi from end of the line to khaosan costs less than 70 Comfortable clean quick

title: Very easy to navigate..
review: On arriving in Bangkok airport this train is very easy to navigate the staff were friendly & helpful and the ticket machines are in English It was 45baht to get off at the last stop it takes about 30mins & they run every 15mins its a great cheap way to get into central Bangkok

title: Travelling around city.
review: We found the train excellent for travel Cheap and very tidy Easy travel Places we went too were very easy to find from station MBK markets

title: Excellent Train and so convient
review: I took the train from the air port to down town of Bangkok Very fast and low price  it cost around 35 Pat where the taxi will charge minuminm 300 I advise every one to use it

title: Great Efficient Way to get into Bangkok
review: Best way to get into town is use the Airport Link located down several escalators to level B (assume Basement)  Cost you a few dollars to get to Phaya Thai (last station) which connects to BTS system to get to places like Nana Station (downtown Sukhumvit)  party central

title: Very efficient
review: Well organized fast efficient and inexpensive Highly recommended and certainly against an expensive alternative  a taxi

title: Quickest Service to/form Airport
review: The airport railway link is the fastest and easiest way to get tofrom the main international airport in Bangkok it saves not only time but money   Traffic is Bangkok is terrible taking the train is in my opinion the easiest and smartest option  Recommendation Fully recommended for a stressfree journey

title: Airport Rail
review: My husband and I live in Pattaya and often go to Bangkok for weekends we park at the airport and catch the rail link into the city Driving in Bangkok is a nightmare so this option is fantastic Having this system running between the airport and the city is fabulous for travellers and cheap

title: Fast Service
review: I travelled from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi airport on the last day of my trip (8th September 2017)  Reached in just 30 mins Great service

title: Cheap and convenient
review: Took the train from the Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai where our hotel is and it was around 70 baht Pretty cheap and clean not to mention its fast (around 40 minutes to reach the city area)   The whole line has only 8 stops I think so it brings you to your destination pretty fast as well

title: Comfortable trip
review: The railway is comfortable and air con is enough  Hope there could be more trains so passengers do not need to wait so long

title: The Easiest & Convenient Way.
review: We find the City Line as the most convenient way to commute between Suvarnabhumi Airport and the city center We were staying close to National Stadium BTS station so we get down at Payathai Station They charge you 45 THB per person which is cheap When you exit from the airport after picking up your luggage turn right and at the end you will find the elevator to go down to train link station One more thing to all travelers there is one money exchange right next to train ticketing counter exchange your money here they have the best rate on the airport DO NOT exchange anywhere at the airport Also there is small counter next to money exchange where you can get very cheap mobile sim (with datavoice) package I got one sim with voicedata package unlimited for 7days for only 150 THB We were in Bangkok & Phuket and trust me we didn't face any problem anywhere

title: Fast and comfortable way to get into Bangkok
review: The price of the ticket was reasonable We found good signs right from the time we picked up our luggage to find the train stop Trains are frequent We then had to get a taxi which was a lot slower then the train

title: Really convenient if you travel light
review: I've used the Airport Rail Link on every occasion when I've not been towing lots of bags It is so easy to you inexpensive clean and convenient   Don't be afraid to give it a try

title: Convenience
review: We used the airport link just to try if it's convenient or not  Thank's God it was indeed so convenient and fast  We arrived on time and we have more time to stroll

title: Cheap, fast and convenient
review: It only costs you 40 baht to go from airport to pratunum area or baiyoke sky hotel where I stayed Very easy to go and always too crowded  with passengers on cabin in time Still vote for it

title: Cheap quick travel to city
review: Buy a token at the airport ticket machine or city terminus for 45baht Six or seven stops and 45 minutes from airport to city terminus and link to skytrain Plenty of room for travellers cases

title: Fast and easy.
review: Very fast and convenient way to get to the city My business schedules are always hectic so this is my way of avoiding the traffic jam

title: Great option--just need more connections and elevators
review: Great way to get into town Inexpensively Just be sure you can manage your suitcases using escalators as elevators are not readily available

title: Fast reliable way to get to and from the airport.
review: Just went on a joyride to try the train as I thought it was a little slow as there is no express (limited stop) train  Took it from Ratchapaprop station and it took 27 12 minutes and THB 40 to get to the airport  Best and most reliable way to get to the airport if you don't want to be caught in traffic  Seats are side benches and rather narrow and uncomfortable (must narrower than BTS seats)  However fir the price beats sitting in traffic

title: Fastest easiest cheapest
review: If u wanted to skip jam n not queueing up for taxis this is the perfect transport for u to get to city centre and then u can take a cab from there or the local bts or mrt It’s accessible anywhere n almost everywhere in bangkok

title: very easy
review: Easy to navigatehelpful staff at all pointsfasteasy way to get to the city or a hotel along the stopsWay better than a taxiCheap 40 baht per person

title: The best way to go downtown/airport
review: I take the plane every month and use the Airport Link The stations are well situated and very well maintain They have many trains every hour Just avoid as much as possible rush hours

title: Always
review: I always take train to go airport  First and easy  When you go airport take from BTS sky train station from Paya thai

title: Quick and safe
review: I took a trip on the airport link from the airport to downtown Bangkok You have to go to lower level of the airport terminal easy to find and very convenient The train itself is very clean and safe and you can get away from bad traffic You can also connect to BTS station and one BTS station is connected to the river boat deck Once you arrive in downtown you need to prepare small local currency from the airport and name of the hotel you want to go written in Thai on a piece of paper since most Taxi drivers do not know English Crazy enough You can even stay at the airport hotel for a few night and enjoy Bangkok by train

title: So easy!
review: I would say it´s the best way to go from Suvarnabhumi to the city It only takes you about 20 minutes to go to Phaya thai station which is located close to the city center of Bangkok From there you can grab a taxi or just change to the BTS (Skytrain) Very easy just buy your ticket in the ticket machine and then jump on the train )

title: Save time
review: I had traveled to Bangkok many time also I almost Airport Rail Link it very easy to go to city of Bangkok and MRT Train and BTS Sky Train But if you have Big luggage or to many belongings I will recommend to take a taxi a bit more expensive but more comfortable for you

title: excellent.
review: Quick clean air con rapid transfer from airport to the city center Then a direct connection to the BTS skytrain network Taxi rank under Phaya Thai station for the final link to your hotel

title: Time table
review: At least you know when you get there the traffic jams in BKK are horific Try to not get into them if you can Took a taxi once there and to do 50meters 20mn Sad

title: The most fast, convenient , safe way between Airport and city
review: This the best way travel between Airport and city without worry about the super heavy traffic in Bangkok and the dishonorable taxi driver

title: Highly efficient, only insufficient seats.
review: Enjoy the bliss travel on the Rail Link  Love the fusion announcement on the rail  Will return again

title: Quick way to get into City
review: Nice clean and reliable train service to Bangkok center  rather than getting struck in Bangkok traffic its better to take it to Phaya Thai station and then make your way to your destination  Ticket costs 45 Baht from end to end (PhayaThai to Airport)

title: Perfect transport from airport to Bangkok centre.
review: A perfect way to travel from the airport to Bangkok centre  Cheap (THB 35  45 pp) clean  fast and with good connections with the Metro and skytrain Easy acces also with suitcases on wheels or backpacks More crowded after a few stations

title: Quick and cheap way into town
review: When you're booking a hotel booking near this line will make your life easier  It start at the airport and is easy to use  It's a bit of a shock to the system to see Bangkok for the first time outside the station in the city but we had a short walk straight to the hotel

title: Very easy
review: Handy clean and very easy it takes you about 40 minutes to reach the airport without the transfer

title: Super efficient, very cheap
review: Travelled from the airport to Phaya Thai (the last stop in the financial district) in less than 30 mins Was super quick and clean Also easy to buy tickets at both the airport and Phaya Thai Can switch to the skytrain at Phaya Thai to go on elsewhere if you need to do so According to timetables I saw online it runs every 15 mins but honestly the 3 times I took it it didn't feel like I had to wait ages for it although still worth checking out the timetable if you need to ensure you get your flight on time It's a massive shame it just isn't longer and goes near the tourist hotspots in Bangkok  A one way ticket cost us 45 baht each  unbelievably cheap

title: excellent rail link
review: This is an excellent link to Downtown Bangkok from the airport  We stayed in Pratunam and we were there in no time at all  It was the same on our return  Well done Bangkok  I have previously spent hours in Taxis sitting in endless traffic

title: Easiest & fastet way from / to the airport BKK
review: Just walk down from the arriving hall it's that simple Pay 45 Baht for the slower or 90 Baht for the faster train with less stops Usually the train first leaving will arrive first If you go to the center of Bangkok just take this train to the last station & take a taxi from there It will be much faster & cheaper Insist that the taxi uses the meter Never take a taxi driver who is hunting tourists

title: The easiest way into BKK by far
review: Having never used the Rail Link in all my travels I was convinced by my colleague to try He was right Descend into the bowels of Swampy and buy a token (with friendly staff to assist) The trains are every few minutes clean but can be busy  Once in town it is easy to jump in a cab to your final destination and much better than messing around in terrible BKK traffic into town  Worth doing and will save hours in time and effort

title: Good connection to downtown Bangkok!
review: The best way to reach down town Bangkok quick and cheap single ticket is less than 2€$  The train is new clean and with AC

title: Fast, reliable, cheap
review: This is a very good way to travel between downtown Bangkok and Suvarnabhumi Airport I recommend not to use the airport link if you have heavy or big luggage as some carrying may be necessary at the stations

title: fastest way to central Bangkok
review: Airport rail link is good way to get to city it 's on the basement of the airport buy ticket from ticket machines or at the counter less than 40 baht depend on the station It clean cool fast and less expensive than taxi

title: Better than a Taxi!
review: Airport Rail link is on the basement level of the airport  Ticket machines are automated and trains leave about every 1520 minutes  Trains are clean and quick  way better than the traffic of Bangkok  Crosses two interchange stations

title: Great to go to the Koh Sam road
review: When arriving at the airport just follow the signs to the train Go to the terminal station ( if you have a bit of cash around 100 bath it is enough over wise change at the airport) when you arrive take the pedestrian bridge to exit A then at the bottom cross the traffic light turn left direction to bus stop 800 yards take the 79 or 511 30 baths then stop at the columns after the temple on your left inside  or ask the driver they know  then cross the road and walk forward to a tragic light  take the busy little street on your right and first on the left then you're arrived good luck

title: Fantastic public transport system.
review: Sky train direct from the international airport into central Bangkok fantastic system Half hour trip into the city centre all for less than a pound Clean cool fast and efficient public transport puts the Heathrow and Victoria Express systems (and London underground) to shame in almost every respect It connects with the underground system that will take you further afield in Bangkok Not been to Bangkok for over 20 years but the expanding public transport network has made a huge difference is first class and exceptionally cheap to use

title: Fast and Easy
review: This is absolutely the cheapest safest and simplest way to leave the airport and to return to the airport

title: Cheapest way of getting to town from the airport
review: A taxi will charge you about 600 Baht The airport rail link costs about 150 baht to get to the heart of Bangkok You would have to change trains at junction(s) but it is really easy and convenient even with large suitcases And safe Runs from 6 am to 11 pm

title: Easy and Convenient
review: Easy access transportation from airport to city vise versa and it is clean cheap fare and nice friendly staff

title: Perfect rail link
review: Trains are modern very clean and frequent They are easy to access and the stations are well sign posted When you are on the train they are very imformative There are 2 lines and trains The 1st stops at all the stations from Bangkok city to the airport    and the 2nd is non stop from the airport to Bangkok city

title: Quick way to centre city: air-conditioned, clean and fast!
review: It is a very fast means of transportation to centre city airconditioned clean and fast  If your hotel if far from a train or BTS station and you have heavy suitcases it is still better to take a taxi from the hotel as a long walk with heavy luggage in the Thai heat might negate the benefit of getting into the city centre rapidly

title: Quick and convenient
review: Quick clean and easy to use  About 40THB from the airport to the city centre  Air con and signs and announcements in Thai and English

title: Very much convenient than other transport.
review: We used this airport rail link to go to our hotel It requires to interchange to go to Sukhumvit but it's very cost effective cheap And also we enjoyed the journey with carrying the luggage through the stairs Because that was very tough job

title: Cheap fast alternative to airport
review: To get to the central area of Bangkok travel from airport to station Phaya Thai for 45 baht  change to the BTS line to station Siam (you need to buy a separate ticket ) from Siam you travel to other BTS stations or get a taxi

title: Easy ride to the city
review: Because my son arrived a day ahead he had researched the train to downtown It was no trouble to find our way late night to downtown the train is clean and quick Good directions as long as you know your stop comfortable and safe and inexpensive

title: Easy and Cheap
review: I think it's the best way to reach BKK city center Good trains with air condicionated When I went the express line was closed but no worries the red line is very fast too

title: My preferred way to travel to town
review: Safe clean and cheap travel 40baht and 20minutes to get me to pratunam area No more traffic jams

title: most cost effective way to arrive in Central BKK
review: The rail system in BKK is excellent Starting from your arrival to BKK No need for a Taxi You sit in traffic just like you would Tokyo New York London or Paris The AIRPORT LINK is clearly marked located at the bottom floor Easy to access Local's are very helpful and speak English and several other languages as well Once your off the Airport link you can catch the BTS (skytrain) or the MRT (subway) Get you within walking distance to your hotel Quick and Cheap Best way to travel in BKK

title: Fuss free transport
review: By far the easiest way to get to the city from Bangkok airport The trains start from the lower floors of the airport and you are in the heart of the city in approximately 40 minutes It's cheaper to take a cab though if you are a group of 4 people

title: Way cooooool
review: You need to be "on the ball" to work out which train to take the language barrier sometimes is frustrating but ASK and you will be helped by very friendly locals Cool train ride  did this a few times and worth travelling each time

title: Easy to use
review: I flew in from Koh Samui and used the airport rail link to get into downtown Bangkok and then connected to the BTS Sky train It stops 6 times before it arrives downtown and costs just 45 baht It takes about 40 mins It tends to be busy and no storage space for luggage I would use again in a heartbeat when returning to Bangkok

title: Bts to airport
review: Oh its a very nice public tranaport service we can avoide traffic jam and can reached airport in time without any tention

title: mrt
review: the mrt underground airport rail linjk meets with bts skytrain and is rapid clean comfortable and has adeqate seating

title: Easy and cheap way to get to centre of Bangkok
review: Easy cheap and very straightforward way how to get from BKK airport to city centre without being ripped off by taxi drivers Train runs every 15 minutes and takes about 30 minutes to get to city centre

title: Fast and cheap
review: We once again picked the rail link to take us in to the city and having discovered a stop closer to our hotel it made even more sense than a limo or taxi  The station is easy to locate on the lower level at the airport Fee is nominal and last train leaves station at midnight  We got off at Mattawan Station found a cab stand at ground level  and were at the hotel in less than an hour from the time we left the airport  Very smooth and successful  If you wanted you could also have connected  connectted with the Metro or Sky Train  Very fast safe and efficient way to get to the city

title: Convenient
review: 1st time taking Airport Rail Line to Westin Grande Sukgumvit It's much convenient than what we expected We usually take taxi to hotel But there was long queue for taxi So we thought we tried rail line to Makkasan and transferred to MRT Costs are much cheaper than taxi and no worry for traffic jam or being over charged We'll take Airport Rail Line from now on

title: Fast and Comfortable
review: Great way to get into the city from the airport  Cheap fast and comfortable  Strongly recommended  Much easier than some cities' rail links

title: Train every 15 minutes
review: Takes approximately 30 minutes on the city line from airport to phaya thai station Very clean fast and efficient

title: perfect
review: This is the fastest cheapest and cleanest so as safest way to move from town to airport I can not understand why people take expensive taxi including rip off guarantee instead of taking the much faster way with airport rail link This is easy to hop on and off and always right in time with no delay

title: Airport trsnsport
review: Best alternative to taxi from airport 6am till midnight all indoors so no worry about rain No tipping And it connected to BTS and MRT

title: Good
review: Easy to access many locations from airport The price is cheaper for transportation Suggest to take map from metro or in the airport before you travel So you can plan your trip easy

title: Fastest cheapest best way to get to and from the airport
review: If you are not being picked up and you have only one bagsuitcase then this is the fastest way into the city From there you will have only a short taxi ride to your hotel Only use metered taxis and never use tuktuks as they are all part of a criminal scam to prey on tourists Tuktuks are also expensive with a minimum fare of about 200 baht to cross the road

title: Best option to take
review: It's cheapest fastest  most convenient avoid traffic jam of the city However please be advised that you should consider taxi rather than Airport Rail Link if you have heavy luggage and traveling alone

title: So easy to use!
review: After visiting Bangkok for so many years this was the first time using the Airport Rail Link  It is very easy to navigate clean and inexpensive  Typically we pay up to 400 bht to get to a hotel the link cost 90 bth

title: Airport to centre of BK
review: Clean efficient easy to work out and fast   What can I say it's a train but its a good one I guess

title: So easy peasy
review: I decided to forgo a taxi and try my first time on the train from the airport to Nana where my Hotel was Its so ready to navigate and cheap as chips $150 You get tokens to feed the barrier and you're away  Fast and regular  All the train systems right to the river work this easily

title: Fast, easy and cheap
review: Really a fast and cheap way to travel from or to the airport I have been several times in Bangkok and used the rail many times it never disappointed me

title: Easy way to get in city
review: This the most fastest and easiest way to get in cityonly drawback is it doesn't operate during night timeSo if ur reaching bangkok after midnight u have to take a taxior else this is the cheapest way to get in city as compared to taxi fares in bangkok

title: get a day ticket
review: however few journeys you make a day ticket is much more convenient as the queues are less and you do not need coins The elevators are at the end of the platforms

title: Like Bullet train
review: Amazing experience from airport very fast just few minuted to city center And very cheap If u have 1 luggage can go try right from inside the airport

title: Save time and money from Airport to Downtown.
review: Airport Rail Link is a modern over ground railway to take you closer to your destination if it is a hotel in the downtown area It only costs a $12 and is very fast albeit it has a few stops (46) before arriving at a junction so you can change trains to get closer to your hotel Makasaan is the name of the station where I always changed train for the final mile to my hotel (Red Planet)

title: Busy
review: By using this service you are saving money and with unpredictable traffic also time But it can get very busy and standing for 50 mins after a long journey wasn't my idea of fun You then need to change to a bts train so if your caring luggage of any weight I'd opt for the taxi Otherwise it's clean efficient and easy to use

title: Ease of use
review: Only started using the Airport Rail LInk very very recently so am unaware of how it has performed in the past but it is simply FAB Und eminently affordable A ticket from one end of the line to the other is 45 baht

title: Smooth, Easy To Use, Convenient
review: Staff were friendly and helpful   Ticketing system is easy to use Just need to know where you're heading to   Ride was smooth   Just not enough space for the luggages

title: very fast way to tairport
review: we took it took airport railway link from ratchapraprop station it only 25 minutes to reach the airport really fast

title: Fast and Convenient
review: This by far the best value for money mode of transportation from and to Suvarnabhumi Airport it is hassle and free and most importantly you won't stuck in a very bad traffic congestion which is a norm in Bangkok street But study your route before taking the Link Cheers

title: So easy!
review: So easy to use Not crowded at all and way cheaper than a taxi or uber Our cart wasn't over crowded and it announced all the stops clearly so even if you can't speak Thai it is easy to navigate We road it through till the Phaya Thai station and it was a cool experience  Would definitely recommend using it

title: Fast and easy
review: I was pleasantly surprised by the number of trains It was a snap getting into Bangkok Just make sure your luggage has wheels

title: Better alternative to taking taxis
review: Very convenient but rush hours could mean being sandwiched inside Try avoiding the rail link during rush hours if you have luggage

title: easy fast comfortable and enjoyable
review: Fly to suvarnabhumi airport from anywhereclear customs and immigrationgo downstairs on the escalator go to the vending machine buy a token and you are on the skytrain and on your way to anywhere in bankok

title: Great service
review: This truly is the way to move around in Bangkok The trains are clean and the frequent number of trains make it easy to travel quickly

title: Clean, fast , reliable
review: Very nice convenient clean and fast way to get from airport to central Bangkok and other way around   Price is fair Very good ac and there is free wifi available too Better option than taxi or bus  Have fun  be safe and enjoy your travel

title: Best way to travel
review: This is by far the easiest and cheapest way to get to and from the city This service connects directly with the BTS for easy connections

title: So easy to use
review: So easy and quick to go centrum in Bangkok And very cheap i use this always when arrive to Bangkok

title: So conveneint
review: No need to waste time and money with taxi when you can use this great facility to connect with city center  better to not have a lot of luggage with you depending of the time in the day it can be faster than using a cab and much cheaper  very convenient clean and safe

title: Easy way to get to BTS
review: Easy to find it's on the bottom floor of BKK Easy to get a ticket Faster than going by car Sometimes it's a little crowded during peak hours

title: Cheap and Good
review: a 20 mins ride from Phaya Thai BTS station covered walkway for all weather Cost is only 45 Baht so much more affordable than a taxi ride and it is fast safe and no traffic jam

title: Easy way to connect city line BTS
review: From Airport station to downtown is very easy route MRT is connected at Makkasan station and BTS is connected at Phayathai station

title: Quick and Convenience!
review: This is very convenience transportation to go around Bangkok and avoid its terrible traffic Open from 500 AM to 1130PM

title: Airport to Piya Thai rail connection - excellent option to taxi
review: You can take train to to its last station which cost 45 Bhat per head then you can take taxi to the hotel You can avoid traffic jam and at the station their is a desk to help you in finding taxi without any additional charge

title: Wonderful
review: This is really cheap way to get into town and it avoids Bangkok's notorious traffic jams It cost 40 Bahtto Makasan and a taxi is 500 If you have mountains of luggage you might struggle

title: Very fast and efficient travel from Airport although lacking connections to Skytrain
review: I managed to coax my very big suitcase through the airport and buy a ticket at The Airport rail Link I was told that the closest connection to Sukhumvit Road was to get off at Makkasan which I did It proved however impossible to get a taxi on a friday night at 8 PM A very kind security guard pushed my giant suitcase to the street corner and stopped the traffic so we could cross in safety He also stopped a TucTuc and I started to negotiate with the driver I managed to reduce the asking price from 500 Thai Baht to 250 I gave the kind security officer 30 Baht which made him happy After some coaxing I managed to sneek on board the TucTuc and we sat off in the heavy traffic I was very happy when we finally arrived at the excellent Hotell Hope Land I would strongly advice the Bangkok Transport System to Improve the interconnections beetween Airport Rail Link Skytrain and the Metro  Now it is simply not good enough

title: a very good 1.5 dollar option to city center instead of 20 dollars taxi even with a luggage
review: after passing passport controla and receiving your luggage you will find yourself in front of the exits to the streetjust do not exit and use the electrical stairs to go one level down buy a token to the city center the price will depend on the destined stationthe maximum price is 45 baht about 15 dollars for the last station very quick and clean and efficient mean of transport to city center even when you are coming with a heavy luggage

title: Very convenient
review: Loved how fast and clean the trains are The regular schedule means I don't worry if I miss a train just take the next one

title: so helpful to have the airport link
review: I love when airports have organised transportation to the closest metro or other means of public transportation The airport link is very easy to use clean and inexpensive

title: Cheap and efficient.
review: This is the by far the cheapest safest and fastest way to get to the center of Bangkok and the connection with the Sky Train and other transport systems makes it ideal for further transfer to other places in Bangkok

title: Good service
review: As far as possible use ARL in Bangkok The last option must be travel by road To go to many places you can also use boat service Very cheap and fast

title: THE CHEAPEST AND BEST WAY TO GET TO BANGKOK
review: We have used the train on a number of occasions and find it the cheapest and best way to get to Bangkok  We go to the end of the line and a cab from there takes us to the Vie Hotel for the cost of 100 baht

title: Great link from BKK to downtown
review: They have a city line that has a few stops and an express line that goes from airport to downtown where most of the tourist hotels are then take a taxi to hotel The traffic is very bad here and can cost a lot in a taxi as you are in jams all the time except during the early hours 1am5am

title: Fast, cheap and efficient !
review: Great way to come and go to main international airport Easy connection with MRT subway and BTS Sky train

title: Fast and cheap
review: This is the cheapest and by far fastest way to get to and from the airport when taking into account how congested the city is The views from the train are also interesting and give you an interesting view of the city

title: so easy to reach city center
review: great service and all the stuffs are very kind they help me so many times with my crazy luggage lovely people

title: Excellent transportation
review: The traffic in Bangkok is terrible so that it can take 1 12 hours to 2 hours to get from the airport to the Hilton  This is an reasonable alternative  Clean quick and on time

title: So convene to use
review: Just so easy to use And if station is close to your hotel it makes it even simpler And I always find someone friendly on the train and willing to assist

title: Convinient way to reach Bangkok City
review: It starts from B2 level of Suvarnabhumi Airport A oneside journey to Phaya Thai costs 45 Baht only From there you get connectivity to rest of the city via BTS In comparative terms taxi to Phaya Thai would cost you 350400 Baht

title: very good ranch cheap
review: this train is very cheap and very fast is better to take this because usually in bangkok there is a lot of traffic

title: exellent ad fast
review: fast and clean every 15 minutes take off and they have a service 24 hours from a well known location

title: Good choice
review: Not too many people in rush hout compare with BTSMRT which is good The train not coming late always be on time

title: Excellent fast service !!!
review: We (Me & My wife ) used this Train during our visit of Thailand on October 2013 The service was so fast comfortable great I recommended everybody for this It save time & money

title: Fast way to travel in Bangkok
review: One can get the Airport Rail Link right from Suvarnbhumi airport It also connects to BTS skytrain which can then be boarded to travel further in Bangkok

title: Easy, fast, fixed fare price!!
review: I definitely agree that Airport rail link is the most convenient transportation you can use to get in and out of Suvarnabhumi Airport which is like 20 plus kilometers from Bangkok center Airport rail link Suvarnabhumi station located just inside the terminal super easy to find     Instead of hours traveling in crazy Bangkok traffic Airport rail link allow you to travel back and forth in  less than half an hour Also the fare is fixed depending on the distance travelled          Although Airport rail link doesn't open 247 The operating hour is from early morning 6 am to midnight

title: good to connect you
review: IF you wish to go directly to the main city of bangkok this a must choice very simple and easy to use once ur on itTo those who wish to save more an use better its a must to bound to be on board can get it from level one of airport basement come out of Cexit move downstairs grab some breakfast or meal at the food court below and set on the link covers distance to main places in half an hr frequency is good and very cheap to use

title: Fast Easy and Very Convenient.
review: Had to rush some documents out to the airport last Friday so took the Airport Rail Link from Ratchaparop Station Delivered us directly into the Terminal and took the lift to Level 4 Checkin to meet the passenger Reverse to Makkasan Station back in to city Forty Baht each way waited no longer than 11 minutes for the train

title: The only way to get from/to the airport
review: We took the train from the city to the airport one morning around 9am We embarked at the first station Phaya Thai and managed to secure a seat for the duration of the trip Interesting view from the train and it was clean quick and efficient Definitely recommended as a hassle free cheap way to get to the airport (and in time for your flight)

title: quick transport
review: nice cheap and quick public transport from airport to  the city center ) you have nice view from ))

title: Smart & faster way to get to the city or back
review: This is the most convenient and cheapest way to get into Bangkok city from the airport or vice versa We used the Airport Rail Link for the first time last week while in Bangkok   We found the service fast cheap and efficient Better than annoying and expensive taxi any day Makkasan is the junction where you can go from the airport to connect with other rail lines Inside the airport it’s easy to manage just follow the signs It's well marked Doesn’t take more than 30 minutes to reach   The train stops at 34 stops in between and you can see locals traveling in it as well

title: I like the airport rail link
review: Very very convenient to goto from airport to Pratunam  fast  nice and clean environment and half of the price of the taxi  must go with airport rail link

title: Quick Easy Cheap
review: We commuted from Airport to other Shopping destinations through Airport link and BTS Gives you a upper view of Bangkok and is much cheaper and faster Saves you from the Road Traffic All you need is a map which you will get in plenty at hotels and you can commute at nominal costAlthough it was crowded at night return trip to airport locals were kind enough to give us seats considering our infant in hand So our total experience of Rail Metro was excellent Also you don't feel cheated because the Cabs charge high unless you know what to pay Ticket vending machines are very easy to use

title: Easy
review: Most convenient and cheapest way to get into Bangkok from the airport Avoid the annoying taxi drivers and get on the railway

title: Cheap way to get to the airport ( or reverse)
review: Very good alternative to a taxi I used a taxi to get from the airport to my hotel because it was my first time in Bangkok but when I left Bangkok I choose the train to save some money and it was the right decision Cheaper cool no traffic jam

title: First-Time Rail Link User - Very Impressed!
review: I used the Airport Rail Link for the first time last week while in Bangkok I found the service fast cheap and efficient   Picking up the Rail Link at the airport is easy  just follow the signs down to the bottom floor It's well marked I believe it was about 45 baht to take it from Suvarnibhumi to Makkasan Station in the middle of the city  The ride itself was smooth and relaxing  more relaxing than dodging Bangkok traffic in a taxi A stop in we picked up a load of school kids who were heading in to the city which caused the train to fill right up but even then it was an easy ride  The only small hassle is if you have a lot of luggage and need to carry it from whatever station you get off at For me it wasn't a big deal and I will use this cheap and efficient option on my next trip to Bangkok for sure

title: Quick and cheap
review: Costs 45 baht from the basement level of the airport to Phaya Thai Bts station connecting you to most of the city Just check your hotel is near a bts station and in the likely event it is you have fast inexpensive transport to and from the airport

title: Easy and comfortable Airport access
review: Built by siemens this is a great and fast airport transfers facility in the busy city of Bangkok Plus its not just a normal metro line its Sky Train you will love the view

title: Clean and super easy to use
review: I was pleasantly surprised with how easy it was to buy tickets for this Airport Rail link Station is located in the basement of the Airport  Buy ticketsdisc from booth and hold disc over yellow spot to enter station One way ticket cost 45 baht Ensure to walk along the platform rather than stopping at the bottom of the escalator as guards will blow the whistle at you Hop on the train at platform 1 or 2 both head into the city I missed the first train as I was waitinb on the wrong side Trains come every 15 minutes or so Luggage carriers in train I couldnt find an escalator so I had to  lug my case down the stairs this is thd the only pitfall

title: Fast cheap way to get downtown
review: The airport rail link is the best way to get downtown From the airport to Bts station right downtown costs 90 baht or roughly 3 dollars It takes about 25 minutes and you can go wherever you want from there Don't take the taxi out of airport as it costs 1500 baht to go downtown and is a scam The train is downstairs in the airport and is easy to use

title: Very Good Service
review: Airport Rail link is a very useful service provided by the government to easily avoid the heavy traffic from Airport to the Central Bangkok very punctual

title: WOW... Efficient, Fast & much cheaper..
review: Used the Rail Link for AIrport transfers & was amazed to see the cleanliness on the train Its a very efficient medium to reach the city from Airport & offers a great first look of the city from the elevated trackstakes about 50 bahts to reach Makkasan where a normal taxi would take about 300 bahts easily

title: fast and cheap
review: Skip the taxi and take this train from the airport is safe especially if you are traveling alone Its fast comparing to taxi

title: Best way to downtown.
review: From arrivals at Suwarnabhumi down a couple levels and elevated train right into Bangkok Phayathai 300 metre walk and I'm at my hotel

title: excellent to use without having luggage to roll
review: I tried it last year and always look for the map and ask where are you going the bad thing is that they don't have a sliding wall for rolling the bags or a wheelchairthey don't have electric stairs

title: Fast and Cheap
review: If you are traveling solo or as a couple this is the best way to get to the city from airport Not only that this is cheapest method to travel to the Bangkok city from Swarnabumi Airport It cost me only 45 THB last time I came to Phaya Thai  If you are coming 1st time to Thailand I recommend to use this because cab drivers can rip you off  End of the Red line you can connect to the BTS trains and that will take you to most of the places in Bangkok city (check for my BTS review)

title: Fantastic way to commute to the city
review: When I travel to bkk which is 45 times a month for businessleisure This is the only way I will ever consider to the city Not even a free limousine ride can tempt me to get stuck in a 3 hours jam And BKK is notorious for their jams   For 90 baht (iirc) you can take the train from airport (basement level look out for the signage) to the city in about 2530 mins Trains are clean seats are available Ample space to have your luggage in front of you if you dont trust putting your luggage at the luggage bay areas    What I usually do take the train to Phaya Thai (last station) and change to the BTS to reach Siam station or Chit Lom station If I am too lazy to change to the BTS I will just exit at Phaya Thai and take a cab which is quite cheap   So yes this is the only way to travel for me

title: Easy and convenient
review: The airport link is easily understandable efficient and fast It is much more cheaper and convenient without the risk of traffic jam as compared to taking a cab

title: Don't tell anyone!
review: It takes a total of an hour airport to hotel door including changing to the local BTS for the last leg So it's massively better than Bangkok traffic But keep it a secret so it doesn't get too busy

title: Fantastic
review: In a different league to London Clean plenty of room frequent service Helpful staff if you need any advice but route is easy to plan and to find your way around

title: Fantastic
review: I cannot believe that more people do not use this  It's so much quicker and cheaper than any other way into Bangkok

title: Fast, clean & efficient!
review: Having visited Thailand for more than a couple of times it was my first time to use the ARL I was totally impressed Saves you a lot of time and very affordable Splendid

title: Great travel option
review: Took taxi from airport into city centre but driver unsure of how to get to my final destination so that caused a little bit of stress on my part as I had a deadline to meet Traffic congestion quite a problem too On return trip I took local taxi to railway station and then airport rail link  much better travel experience despite time it took to get to railway station due to traffic congestion  Would do airport link  taxi combo in future as cheaper faster option especially for a solo traveller

title: never use a taxi again
review: the train ticket is less than 100 Bhat  why bother using other forms of transport The last stop is Phaya Thai  so from there its easy to get to your hotel  I always use this safe and clean mode of transport

title: Best Way To Connect With the Sightseeing Places
review: This is one of the methods I always prefer to use when I travel Infact the public transportation systems were also created with this aspect in mind to provide easy access to its travelers across the traveling country   The same thing applies here too As you pass through the exit doors of the Suvarnabhumi Airport please make it a point to collect the metro connectivity map as a reference to move across in the city   Not only is it the cheapest way to connect with the various sights in the city it is also hassle free safer and cheaper I practically did not have to 'ask' anybody out along the entire way as I traveled here The metro map is well updated and the information is laid down for an easy to understand language for the travelers   Buy a metro card and you can hop in and out into any part of the city at your own pace Try also to use it to interconnect within the transportation systems such as the waterways and  buses In one simple word I can say it is your perfect 'MONEYSAVER'

title: Sooooo much cheaper than a taxi
review: The airport rail link so easy to use and its so much cheaper than a taxi into Bangkok highly recommended for cheap easy access to downtown Bangkok

title: very simple transfer...very cheap...far better than a taxi battling the bagkok traffic
review: this is definitely the way to get to and from the airportno traffic to sit in and extremely cheapand air conditioned

title: Easy, fast and cost effective!
review: Why stand in line in a taxi queue with all the frustration of haggling with a taxi driver when you can take the Airport Rail Link at a fraction of the cost and time to the heart of Bangkok The Airport Rail link is easy to get to ( one floor below the public taxis ) and not over crowded and is between 35 and 65 baht for journey There is also ample suitcase and baggage space The Rail link goes to Phraya Thai and from there you can connect to the BTS easily or get a taxi from the centre of the city Very clean and efficient

title: Link
review: I love airport rail link  that so help for new tourist who dont know where to go and afraid to get lost coz dont understand the langguage

title: Very good option
review: Much cheaper than airport taxi  service to the airport 25 minute trip with approx 6 brief local stops in between Arrives directly inside the airport terminal During peek traffic periods travel to airport is slow and the airport link train is the best was to go

title: First time with the Airport Rail Link instead of the Taxi
review: being many times to bkk I always took a taxi which as well is pretty convenient but this time we tried first the Airport Rail Link and it was very convenient and fast and of course as well much cheaper than the taxi Highly recommendable if your hotel is somewhere close to a stop of the Link

title: Very convenience way with cheap price to reach center of city
review: Airport rail link station is in ground floor of Suwanaphum airport It's very convenience ad and cheap price THB 45 or USD 13 With this train you can arrive center of city (Victory Monument) in 30 minute Moreover you can connect with BTS at Phayathai Station

title: The ONLY way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: I don't go to Bangkok much through Suvarnabhumi but when I do Airport Link is the only way to get to the city I hate traffic and I hate Taxis Airport is simple cheap quick and efficient  However I don't know how packed it gets around peak hour times

title: The quickest way to get into town.
review: The airport link is fairly new and a most welcome addition to the transport service in Bangkok The main airport is a long way out of town and with the horrific traffice situation can take over 90 mins to reach there by taxi This train service will take at least half of that time and is a clean and affordable alternative

title: Best way to get to bkk
