review: Even if you have backpacks it is super simple fast and easy to use the airport rail link to the city It only costs around 1 euro per ticket you can then get a tuktuk or taxi once you get to the center We tried to use buses but we end up walking since it took forever for any bus to stop

title: Quickest access to the BK
review: Airport Rail Link is at the basement floor of Suvarnabhumi Airport Bangkok This has two categories such as City Link and Express Link Express Link directly runs to the Makkasan Junction without stopping City Link is the normal rail link This service is very cheap if you are travelling with few people with few luggage

title: Safe, cheap, and convenient airport transfer to Bangkok
review: Only 45 Baht for a 30min ride to Phaya Thai BTS station which can be used to connect to major hotels in the city for another 28 Baht or less No traffic nor hassle to worry about vs taxi and is much cheaper than taxi (could be 400 Baht plus tolls)

title: Great way to run a train!
review: Everything you want  Fast inexpensive clean and it stays on schedule  Best way to get from the airport to downtown

title: Efficient way to travel from airport if you're a small group with few bags
review: Very efficient way to get from the airport to wherever you are going I don't recommend it if you have a lot of bags Otherwise it's a great way to get to and from the airport Trains seem to arrive every 1520 mins Less often than BTS or MRT but it does go further so it makes sense From airport exit there are clear signs  you just go to lowest ground level and find machine to put your coins in   hitting the button to where you are going It will tell you how much it costs and give you a little bingo chip thing that you use to get past the security marker Simple

title: V nice
review: The bestfastest Easy and quick way to get from the airport And its awesome if your hotel is near to any BTS line

title: Quick way into the city
review: It was a quick and easy way to get into the city it links up to their subway system and not too expensive

title: Just do it into town.
review: Just do it into town No traffic safe and clean We then transfer to BTS or Metro don't confuse the two City lines download map in advance find elevators to levels if you have luggage

title: Nice choice to get into the city center without traffic jam
review: The Airport Rail Link is a good option (esp in the rush hour) to get into the city 35 Baht (1 Euro 08 US$)each and app 30 min does it take

title: Fast, budget and confortable
review: We used The Airport Rail link on our last trip to Bangkok This is a budget fast and efficient way to get to the airport In the future I won't consider a taxi as an option for airport transfer

title: Cheap, Efficient and Quick.
review: The airport rail link is absolutely amazing It is the quickest the most efficient and cheapest way to travel Especially if you're traveling with limited time in Bangkok from the airport and wanna ignore the lousy traffic airport link is an amazing choice

title: very useful
review: available from airport to city center good value took this airport rail link then took a tuktuk to hotel

title: best way out of airport into bangkok
review: Only way to Get to and from airport if in bangkok   cheap and effective way to travel  I just cannot imagine what bangkok would be like without this

title: A really efficient mode of transport to/from Survarnabuhmi Airport
review: I've always taken taxi from airport to central Bangkok hotels since its really not King's ransom (around 300 Baht) but this time I thought I'd try out the ARL system To my surprise it is really great  its only 45 Baht to Phaya Thai Station and from there you can hook up to the BTS system The journey is a mere 30 mins with 8 stations inbetween You can at least budget your time on ARL whereas on Taxi's you know about the famous traffic jams in Bangkok If you're travelling solo take the ARL but if you travel with 2 or more the taxi might be your choice Also depends on where you stay If your hotel is near a BTS station then ARL plus BTS would be a great option Another downside is that you might have to lug your luggage around a bit whereas on a taxi it really is point to point

title: Avoid traffic!
review: If you're staying in Bangkok near a MRT or BTS station getting a connection to Makkasan airport rail link is a piece of cake 34 of a taxi price if not more and traffic independent   Look at a map for MRT BTS stations to plan ahead and be prepared

title: Best way to airport
review: I took the airport express for go to Sukumvit area from the airport Frequent service with low prices makes it the ideal mode of transportation to reach airport  It cost me just THB35 to reach makkason station

title: The only way to travel
review: A brilliant and efficient service which delivers you from the city right into the international terminal (and return) for less than $AUD2 per person

title: Good value when you compare to taxies.
review: 45 bht per person vs starting 400 for an entire taxi   I recommend it if you don't have a lot of bags and kids  otherwise it night be easier to just take a cab pecans on the price you get  On the way in we used it  but not on the way out

title: Economical & Fast to Bangkok city
review: This is the best option to reach the city from Suvarnabhumi int'l airportGo to the airport basement & take the Blue line (city link)  This is the slow train stop at all the station up to phayathai stationBut it took only 40 mins from airport to Ratchaprarop station & THB 40 to each we traveled in the morning time so not crowdedeverybody seated Makkassan express is THB 90 but nonstop between  Airport & Makkassan (Red line)  I suggest not to use Express because slow train (Blue line) is so quick

title: No need taxi
review: After five years of service I do like to take it every time  when I go to the air port save cost 'cause you don't have to take stupid taxi and there's no traffic

title: The fast and cheap way to get to the airport
review: The road between Bangkok and BKK airport can become very congested You need most of the recommended 3 hours at the airport before departure and travelling by road can add a couple of hours and be very stressful in this situation  The rail city airport rail link is very modern fast and although stops at six stations is still cheap air conditioned and the best way to make this journey (The express link is not running at the moment apparently due to a lack of carriages () but this line  does very well) We got on at the Makkasan terminal an enormous mostly empty building in town using a taxi to get there All was easy albeit you have to walk round a bit to find the actual rail link but people will guide you if you get a bit perplexed We would use it again as our first choice of travel to and from the airport in Bangkok

title: Easiest, fastest & cheapest way to town
review: Wonder why the fastest yellow line express ie Direct from Airport to Makkansan was not in service  Can only take the blue (or red) line to town and take much more time

title: Great way to get to the city.
review: Great way to get to and from the airport you will save a lot of money by using this service rather than a taxi Regular trains including an express line tonget you there supee fast sometimes you may not get a seat but its no bigdeal as there is lots of space

title: Best transportation kode
review: Best way to go get back and forth from the airport Cheaper than using the taxi services if you are travailing light

title: fast, convenient, easy, manageable even with suitcases
review: fast and convenient  the express train to phaya thai is closed though we took the slower train to phaya thai instead and it was a easy transfer to the BTS to chit lom w

title: Easiest way to get to the city center in Bangkok.
review: Very economical and the fastest way to get to the city from the airport Most of the hotels are on the route so you save money and time both

title: Easy to use
review: The Airport Rail Link is so convenient to use from the airport into the centre of Bangkok   Easy to locate within the airport  Fast to buy the tokens from the self service kiosk   We didn't wait long for a train and the train was clean Nice and cheap way to travel into Bangkok

title: Good, cheap and best way to skip traffic
review: Excellent Easily accessible However connectivity to other major stops is needed specially when major hotels are located by riverside To travel to Bang Rak I had to take train that goes to Makkasan as city line was not operation for some reason Even if city line is working it is not the best route It only takes to two more station further than Makkasan from where you need hire cab or move to another train line which can be a problem if you have lot of luggage Overall quite helpful to skip airport traffic

title: Saved Me
review: Due to Airport rail link train it was possible for me to catch my flight on time rather i would have missed my flight

title: Easy & Cheaper Access to City...
review: Convenient & cheaper way to enter into the city Follow the instructions on the walls or contact the info desk for clarifications

title: Just Wonderful!
review: An EastWest rail line located above the city that covers a lot of area  One line is an express line to the airport and the other has multiple stops along the way  Not nearly as crowded as the BST and much better way to the airport than taxi

title: Cheap way to travel between airport and Bangkok
review: I loved traveling vai Airport link as it was cheap 45 baht and it took almost 40 mins to reach phaya thai I did manage to get seat so I was happy

title: easiest way to travel
review: The Airport Rail Link provides an easy and cheap way to get to and from the BKK airport It connects to the Skytrain which I managed fine despite having a large bag during rush hour

title: Very frequent and convenient
review: We took this end to end from the airport to Phaya Thai station (45 THB) Frequent service announcements and signs maps in Thai as well as English Journey time approximately 20 mins automatic ticketing counters are plenty and there are a couple of manual ticketing counters as well It is possible to choose either English or Thai at the ticketing machines The notes that you can pay with are mentioned on the screen and you get a poker chip like token with which you can navigate through the gates Very easy Beware the machines give back change only in coins of 5 and 10 THB no currency notes Compared to being stuck in Bangkok traffic this is a breeze Highly recommended

title: Efficient
review: Airport Rail Link most probably is the easiest way to reach center of Bangkok fast and without to much sweating If you are going from the airport you can take this aircon train and be in the center in 3545 minutes

title: Fast and cheap way to travel to and from airport
review: Fast and cheap way to travel to and from airport Prepared coin to purchase the ticket from vending machine

title: EASY
review: Connected to Sky Train from airport easily   Easy to navigate   Lots of English signs and information booths

title: Fast and cheap
review: This is by far the best mode of transport from suvarnbhumi airport to city centerThe taxi charges for the same travel amounts to around 500 bahtThe express line was not operational on the day we traveled and we took the city lineIt cost us around 100 baht for two persons and around 20 minutes to reach  makkasan station from where we changed to BTS station for our travel to NANA BTS

title: Best way to get to your hotel
review: Just use the Airport Rail Link for travelling from Airport to Hotel Way cheaper than Taxis Directions for the stations are well placed So you would not be lost

title: Excellent transport service avoids traffic snarls
review: Excellent service and a viable alternative to using taxi during rush hour or holiday traffic  For single persons it will save money although not an essential consideration for most as all transportation options are relatively inexpensive  What I like is the ease of train access from city or airport end cleanliness and speed of transit  I often use taxi for the final inner city trip from Train stop to hotel by which time heavy traffic has been avoided and taxi driver has more local knowledge

title: Great Mode of Transport
review: Cheap and very convenient mode of transfer to and from the international airport at suvarnabhumi Trains are on schedule and stops at least on stations the non stop train to and from the airport has been ceased

title: Reasonable way to get there
review: Great transportation Easy to use and gets you there fast I would not hesitate to use this Rail Link on our next trip

title: Great Service!
review: Wow it is simply superb you arrive at Suvarnabhumi airport go to basement section and board the train which covers a good half city area   It is quick cheap in price great comfort and time saving   I recommend it to  everyone

title: Good and cheap.  Better than taxi.
review: Highly recommended to use instead of the costly taxi services We were between 500 to 1200 baht taxi rate to our hotel and train was for both of us 140 baht including connections

title: 1/2 the time and 1/6th the price of a taxi
review: Faster (max 40min vs around 50 to 100min by taxi) ) & cheaper (max (40THB vs 230 to 350THB by Taxitoll) to get from the airport to the city  the two last stations connect fairly easily to MRT & BTS (but they are not as accessible if you have more than 2 bags)  Always got a seat  Lots of room for luggage  You need to be able to carryroll all luggage yourself

title: Best traffic from airport to downtown
review: It's the best fastest and cheapest traffic from the new airport to downtown and you can transfer to MRT in Makkasan station

title: Cheap, convenient, and comfortable way to get from airport to BKK
review: This is a great way to get into BKK easily and quickly straight from the airport It's cheap (roughly $2 per person depending on where you get off) clean airconditioned and you get to see BKK on your way into the city

title: very helpful ........ saves time and money
review: When you book a hotel know your nearest BTS or MRT station Go to the lower basement of the Airport and take Rail link to Makasan Station and change to your MRT or take taxi to your hotel Airport Rail Link saves a lot of time energy and money

title: Best way to go to the airport
review: The bestfastest and cheaper way to go from the city center to the airport and come back cheap thicket

title: Quick way to bangkok
review: Easy and quick way to get from the airport if you have hotel close to BTS line quick switch at phaya thai over to the BTS and you're set for reaching your hotel in no time

title: its cheap!!
review: cheapest way to get into the city from the airport but quite fast wont take more than half an hour also the frequency is also quite good

title: Excellent service
review: You can save time as well as money using airport rail link very excellent service joining all important places

title: cheap and efficient
review: Direct into the city from the airport and cheap 1 hr max don't bother with expensive taxis and traffic jams

title: I enjoed it. Contemporary and inspiring.
review: Very convenient and affordable way to get to the city You can enjoy wonderful views of Bangkok from the window while getting to  the city which is really  inspiring It is clean and nice to ride in

title: So easy
review: We flew from Phuket to Bangkok  it was so easy to get the rail link then we took sky train absolutely beautifulwell worth the effort

title: Cut out the traffic
review: Could be better presented First time I tried it I had to look around so directions at that  time were poor Good value for money to get you into the city and access to the BTS for the rest of your journey without being stuck on the freeway or the airport taxi hastle

title: Cheap Airport transfer
review: Frequent schedule easy connection at Paya Thai to BTS sky train Not suitable for travelers with lots of luggage

title: mandy
review: A very efficient service   gets you to the center of bangkok quickly and cheaply  much better than taking a taxi  avoids traffic jams

title: first time
review: Very convenient & beats all the traffic jams to get you to the centre of town  Down side local taxis don't want to take you from your hotel to the Airport Rail link station

title: best transpostation transfer to Airport
review: only 45 batt person from Pyathai to International airport and take 30 min to reach better that you take taxi cost about 700batt and sometime will stuck into traffic jamI would recommend you to take taxi to any Airport link station  and transfer to airport by train to avoid traffic jam

title: Cheap
review: This rail link is the easiest and cheapest way to get from the airport into bangkok Look on the map first to work out which stop is nearest your hotel or if you have to swap onto the skytrain Its easy to understand very cheap and fast

title: Quick hassle free ride into Bangkok
review: Pros This link connects you from the airport to central Bangkok BTS rail system for 45baht Saves you time and money from riding on taxis in the traffic From the MRT you can also connect to the MRT  Cons Dragging your bags up and down stairs and escalators connecting to conyence systems Eventually you probabnly will need a taxi to your final destination Either way airconditioning is provide Enjpoy

title: Best way to travel to City centre from airport
review: This is the best way to travel to city centre from Airport  Just 4045 min by airlink if you take the taxi or bus would take you 152hrs to arrive in town Because Bangkok traffic very bad  And never be on time as the airlink or BTS Price might be just a bit expensive but a lots better for travel by bus or texi

title: This makes travelling in Bangkok so much faster
review: As Taxi and Tuk Tuks get stuck in the allways big traffic the skytrain combinations is so much quicker and easier to use And the price really reduces the travel expenses It is cheap to travel in Thailand but when you come to Bangkok it is well worth taking a look at the map and using the skytrain  you will save a lot of time From the airport to Rhamkamhaeng was faster then taxi from Rhamkamhaeng and 10 blocks down the road Price is only 30 baht

title: Easy travelling
review: Trains run frequently they are very clean run on time and very cheapand don't  get stuck in the traffic A very helpful staff at the ticket machines willhelp you through with suitcases or if you need assistance with getting your ticket they will show how

title: Fast to city
review: Best way to go into town when its trafficjam BUT they dont start before 6 or 7 in morning so if you arrive early flight take a taxi because there is no traffic then

title: Great
review: The skytrain from the airport is great It is great when you have no suitcases with you It is cheap and it is very fast But when we did it the first time with all our luggage it was a big disaster So go by skytrain when you are backpakking or when you only have a trolley

title: So easy to use
review: We arrived at the airport and just followed the signs for the rail link Staff at the station confirmed where we had to change and away we went A quick cheap effective way to get to the City

title: Quick and easy
review: Cheap easy and beats the traffic Buy a Nancy Chandler map and you won't go wrong finding your way around bangkok

title: cheap and fast
review: we caught a taxi from the airport on the first night  cost us 900baht and the driver was all over the road  Took around 40 mins to get to the hotel  On leaving bangkok we used the rail link  took about 25 mins to get to the airport and cost us 120baht  Train link wins hands down

title: Recommended
review: A fast and cheap way to travel between airport and city centre However if you are heavy on luggage take a taxi

title: Super easy!
review: Took this to the Sukhumvit area transfered to the BTS and got off 2 blocks away from my hotel cost me 80 baht

title: Cheap & punctual
review: Best way to get into central Bangkok from the airport that simple Fares are cheap and the air conditioned carriages are kept clean and tidy

title: love the raillink
review: I love the raillink It is a nice way to get to the city without having to hassle with a taxi  In my opinion the ARL is the quickest cheapest option to go to town So if you EITHER want to go fast OR cheaply the Raillink is the way to go  From Phaya Tahi you can go by BTW to other places or by bus to the old town

title: fast and cheap
review: best way to go from airport to city center it is cheap and quick and you do not need to bother with bangkok jam

title: Quick and easy
review: Recommend this air train to avoid Bangkok traffic  We stayed at airport for several nights and used it to go into the city

title: Quick and direct to airport
review: My flight was on Monday and the traffic of Bangkok is bad on FridayI've pick up my suit at Emporium Armani and Andy recommend me to take a train to airport which is five minutes drive from tailorWithin half an hour I'm in the airportsave time and safe money

title: It works and cheaper than a cab for us
review: Our first cab ride was a rip off We took the train back to the airport and it worked out great once you figure out how to get your tickets and it is a little confusing changing trains at the station but it's all part of the adventureRight

title: Great way to get around
review: Fast cheap and reliable Puts the British transport system to shame Definitely the way forward for any country that has the brains bottle and finance to take it on )

title: convenient trasportation tool
review: It is really a convenient transportation tool which you can take via switch at a BTS station we lived in the hotel near Nana station it is realy very good

title: Its cheap and clean
review: Its a brilliant way to travel from or to the Airportcheap and clean Not too much seating howeverstand and sway with the train  Carry  your own bags but there are escalators or sloping walkways so no problems And the staff at the final station Phaya Thai are very helpful

title: Fast and good
review: Went there in February 2012 We decided to try the airport rail link for the first time We usually will take taxi from airport to hotel but since our hotel is near the rail link station so we decided to try It was very good and fast There is 2 type One is stop at every stations while the other will only stop at certain station We tried the both and see when going to hotel and returing to airport Both are good just that the certain stop rail will cost more But if you have young children taking a taxi is still more convenient

title: Very convenient
review: The express was not running think they have stopped it as they were losing money The non stop airlink is crowded but convienient for 45 baht

title: Absolutely fastest way to central Bangkok
review: For B45 you get to central Bangkok at Phaya Thai Station which connects to the BTS too Yes taxis are cheap too but once you get stuck on the highways you'll want to take the link and save over half the time

title: The fastest and easiest way to go downtown
review: With the Airport Rail Link from the airport to Phaya Thai station which takes about 30 minutes you have access to all the BTS Skytrain stations It really is not only the fastest and easiest way to get into the city of Bangkok it's probably also the most inexpensive way as long as you are alone and don't have too much luggage At the interchange station Phaya Thai you'll find elevators but most of the BTS Skytrain stations don't provide this facility which means you have to carry your luggage down the stairs

title: efficient and clean
review: The express was not running on the day but the airport rail link was and to me was efficient and clean although took 40 min when I think should have taken 20 min with the express The cost was a fraction at 40 THB

title: Quick, efficient and cost effective!
review: Checked by security befor passengers allowed on then it is a a swift 30ish minutes to the town centre So easy and so so cheap Just a shame it doesn't go any closer to Khao San road but still was invaluable and clean and air conditioned

title: Does the job
review: cheap quick on time air conditionned by far the best way to reach Central Bangkok Many thai so nice way to mix with local culture

title: fast, convenient and cheap
review: nothing to dislike great service to the airport something to see because you are up high and very easy to use

title: A Cheap and Very Efficient Way to Get To The Heart of Bangkok
review: Couldn't be simpler Directly under the Airport Terminal and about 25 minutes to the Bangkok Terminal to connect to the BST There used to be a non stop service but this appears to have been discontinued even so you will get on and off at the start and finish so little mucking about once you are on Whilst you travel take a look at the roads that parallel the train consider the traffic crawling along or stationary and give yourself a pat on the back for being so clever )

title: Handy to miss city traffic
review: The airport rail link is a handy form of transport to miss out on traffic jams even if you aren't staying in the city centre you can then take the BTS to the area you need to be

title: Excellent transport from Airport
review: The airport rail link is an excellent way of getting from the airport to the city It's fast and low priced Most of the time a taxi will cost 510 times as much and take at least twice as long time to reach the destination The airport link is also connected with BTS Skytrain at the end station And BTS is connected with MRT subway So you can reach any destination in the city center  The train is clean and cool from nice aircon

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to find in airport and connects with both in town lines Don't pay extra for taxi with this option available Runs till midnight

title: Efficient BTS
review: It is so easy and hassle free and you need not worry about toll charges and the exorbitant taxi fare that is around 400Bahts some r 450Bahts The lack o communication make you worry about your ride even before you can enjoy the trip  Don't miss your hassle free ride into the city O no traffic jam

title: Takes a bit of time to figure out but worth it.
review: I took a cab from the airport and I had problems with knowing where to pick this up in Bangkok but the trip from the airport is a breeze Figure this out and take it all the time The exception being is when you have a huge pile of useless luggage that you can not get up the escalators to the train  Next time reduce your luggage (via Rick Steves books) and take the train

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Efficient cheap and avoids traffic to get to Suvarnabhumi in 30 min on train from Phaya Thai No easy with luggage but ok with a rollon

title: better than taxis
review: the minute you step out of the airport you can buy a ticket for the train which connected us to the hotel in sukhumvitit was fast and better than the road journey where there are snarls one has to change the train at one stop so better you do not have too much luggage

title: Best way to get from Airport
review: I have been to Bangkok four times and usually arrive in the evening and a taxi to Sukhumvit area was only 300B and little traffic However of late prices have gone up of late and now the going rate is 500b For about 40 baht or 90 baht express you can get the train to Phaya Thai or wherever it is you are going  Very cheap and quick to get from airport and run regularly Can be a little crowded at times if you don't mind standing  If you are budgeting and don't mind having to switch trains to BTS once you arrive for your onward journey possible standing up and then having to cart your luggage down stairs and through busy streets to your hotel (no lifts or escalators at BTS stations) then is the go  Would not recommend a taxi between the hours of 8am  7pm but if you can get it cheaply or sharing with someone it is more convenient

title: Convenient, fast and cheap way of transport
review: The Airport Rail link is a very good way of travelling to and from the airport to the city If you dont have much luggage to carry then it is the best and cheapest way to commute You can also get connecting station to Sky train and MRT and you reach any place in Bangkok

title: No need for a taxi
review: Cheaper and faster than a taxi with a good aircon Links onto many other railbus services All clearly sign posted 5*

title: Fast, convenient, cheap
review: The rail link to the airport is sensational as long as you don't have an excess of luggage I was only travelling with cabin luggage and a computer and found this the best way of getting to my hotel No traffic jams less than 12 the price of a taxi and a comfotable seat all the way You do have to make a train change to get to your hotel on Sukhumvit but again this is quick and easy I would only say that I would only use the train if my Sukhumvit hotel was close to a sky train station

title: Hassle Free
review: This is a life saver of stress for many years landing into Bangkok was a hassle dealing with queues of people waiting for taxies and then pay for all the toll fees on top of the taxi fare and they would still want to rip you off and if you didn't want to wait you could get a taxi that was not on the taxi rank would refuse to turn on his meter and might try to rob you as well the rail link from the Airport to city center is a god send you just use the interchange at Phaya Thai Station to where ever you want to go in the city totally stress free and very cheap about 50 Bhat to city center if you can always you this transport system to the city

title: Avoid the Traffic and Taxis
review: If you are arriving at Suvarṇabhumī airport and need to transit into central Bangkok then the airport rail link is the ONLY way to go With a travel time of 30  35 minutes this can beat the taxi travel time by a significant amount outside peak hour and even more so during peak In addition the cost is considerably less (50 Baht) and the train is air conditioned and comfortable You can also transfer on the BTS rail system (skytrain) at Phaya Thai station for other destinations throughout Bangkok

title: Easiest and cheapest way
review: It is the best way to go to the city from or to the BKK airport  Comfortable and clean in about 30 minutes you can reach skytrain station in the center of Bangkok

title: Quick and convenient
review: It was very easy to go to Bangkok  We took the express train from Airport station straight to Phaya Thai station which we transfer to BTS straight to Phloen Chit Station  It is quick and convenient  So when we returned we took the same route (to save on cab fare)  We took the normal service which we need to stop for 6 stops before reaching the Airport station still it was OK  I will take this service again for my next trip to Bangkok

title: Great
review: The Airport Rail link was excellent for us as we picked a hotel right at a station  During the day the rail link comes every few minutes in both directions and at night you maybe have to wait 5 minutes  It is very quick and easy to the airport although our starting station had a million stairs and the escalator was only going up  The link takes you in to Phaya Thai skytrain station which then takes you on to other destinations  The link is very cheap clean and spacious

title: Fun to ride
review: Easy access to airport  However some station don't have elevator  Beware  Express train takes every 20 minutes from one place to BKK airport Check map first

title: Fantastic
review: Great way to reach Bangkok city from the airport Probably the fastest I have every reached the Bangkok city from the airport Cheap and 100% on time

title: express rail
review: easy fast brilliant very clean  what ever did we do before if the route is what you need then wouldnt ever get a taxi again

title: Super fast and Reliable
review: This is absolutely the very best choice to get in and out of Bangkok if using "swampy" also known as Suvarnabhumi Airport Reliable cheap and comfortable It takes about 15 minutes to complete the journey if using the express service and about 25 minutes if using the normal service

title: Needs later hours, but otherwise VERY convenient
review: BKK's airport is pretty far from center city + traffic is horrendous at all hours of the day + if you've never been here before and don't speak Thai chances are that your taxi ride will be much more expensive than it should be It's ILLEGAL for taxi drivers to quote you a price ask for the meter if you don't want to take the rail link but if you do take the rail link it brings you right to the city's public transportation systems for much cheaper than a cab Note that if you are staying on Khao San Road the BTS does not go there and you will still need to take a cab or tuk tuk so you're probably better off taking a cab from the airport and skipping the rail link altogether

title: Quick fast and convenient
review: The title says it all quick fast and convenient from or two the airport Inexpensive also There are two trains one that does make a few stops along the way and costs slightly less and the express train which stops only once and cost a little more The express train generally is not as crosed as the more local train the express is your best bet

title: Very easy, cheap, clean and safe
review: I remember from a long time ago that the rail link out to the airport was in development or still on the cards and the date of completion always seemed to be far in the future By all accounts the Airport Rail Link has been operating for a few years now and it is excellent    Despite being half asleep after a dreadful redeye flight I was able to a find the train station at Suvarnabhumi Airport and b work out the ticket machines and get myself a little tickettoken I had done a little research beforehand so I knew what I was doing but the ticket machines are easy to understand There is a ticket counter and staff were lingering near the machines if you need help but it was a pretty standard system – select your destination number of passengers then feed the money into the machine    The trip was comfortable and the trains were noticeably clean and free of clutter Coming from Melbourne it was nice to see a train that was not covered in graffiti and rubbish – you cannot eat or drink on the Airport Rail Link and that makes a difference to the state of the train It took about 25 minutes from the airport to Phaya Thai station The transfer from the Rail Link to the BTS was very smooth and well marked at that station   The Airport Rail Link is cheap (25THB) and a quick and efficient way to get into town The system is easy to use well staffed and clean and comfortable A highly recommended way to get to and from the airport

title: The ONLY way to get downtown!
review: 45 baht and 30 minutes later you're on Sukhumvit and in the center of all the action Zero hassle full comfort in aircon and the ride is smooth There's no better way to get downtown than the ARL you'd be a fool not to use it

title: Modern, efficient
review: Stop at the machine push the english button and select your stop (likely Makkasan for changes to subways) you get a little RFID coin to tag in and the insert into a slot to get out  Bring a mask it's not required but ALL of the locals wear them  Most rides cost under 50BHT and it runs fairly often

title: Save you cash - get the train
review: It's too easy to just get a taxi into town Then sit in the traffic pay road tolls etc Getting the train is cheap 45 baht to the terminus then change onto the Sky Train eastern Line MTR However  it's not luggage friendly as some walking is involved For those who travel light  train is fine More that one case  get a cab and enjoy Bangkok's traffic jams

title: airport to city
review: Quick easy and cheapthe best way into town if you do not have too much luggage Clean trains regular service staff to assist first time users fast  and economic travel to nearest station and then get taxi

title: Super convenient, fast and cheap means of transport
review: From the airport you are very quickly and very cheaply in the center of Bangkok You don't lose time because of the traffic jams in a city like Bangkok Take the skytrain to near your hotel or the place you want to visit and then continue with a taxi or tuktuk

title: Great ride
review: Staff always very helpful Told us how to get to our destination and where to change lines etc Even guided us to the ticketing machine which we didn't see D

title: Very efficient
review: With less bags this can be the idea way to get into the city Then you can get to all MRT & BTS stations Amazing

title: Often  the best way to get to hotel
review: I feel safer on public transportation and Airport Link is fast cheap and connects to MRT and BTS My usual strategy is to use a 26" or so 4wheeled spinner style bag with a second bag (stowed overhead during my flight)  mounted on the trolley handle (so the weight is off my back) This is very manageable on the Airport Rail Link and subsequent transition to BTS MRT and finally sidewalks Although most up & down transits are via escalator and your spinner will fit on the narrow steps occasionally (eg Asoke) its all stairs  unless you are adroit enough to spot the often hidden elevator and get an attendant to unlock it for you The other option is to go beast mode and grabe the handle and walk up (or down) the steps DO NOT Airport Link if you cannot haul your bags in a pinch The handicap friendly amenities we take for granted in the USA  which also benefit luggageburdened travelers  are hard to find overseas  Of course this is Covid so arrival is SHA+ taxi certified required Also I overpacked this time so I guess it's back to a 20 year old or so Corolla taxi to get back to the airport for the trip home

title: The best available transportation ot and from the Airport
review: Too bad that it connects only to BKK Suvarnabhumi international Airport and not Don Mueang local airport  We usually select our hotel according to the proximity to BTS SkyTrain stations and therefore to the Airport Rail Link  Why  No risk involved with traffic or waiting in line for a cab or worrying for a scam with the taxi driver asking for 5 or 10 times the real cost (yes read the reviews)  Never hesitate to take the airport link unless of course if you are 67 people with plenty of luggage and then a van would be the better choice

title: First time on the rail link
review: The airport rail link is the way to go for travellers on a budget This cheap and easy to use rail link is the way to go I was going to Sukhumvit in Bangkok The rail link is down the escalators to the bottom Get the simple and cheap tickets from the machine and through you go Down again and then on to the train This took me to the BTS for my onward travel on the Sukhumvit line The whole trip cost less than 200 baby I will use this again

title: fast and efficient
review: We caught the train from the airport terminal to the last stop then a taxi to our hotel Quick and cheap

title: Fast and smooth way to Suvarnabhumi airport
review: Took us 30 mins from Pratunum area  Phaya Thai station Before deciding on ARL  we tried grab transport but all cancelled due to heavy transport  ARL was recommended by hotel reception and truly it was the fastest fuss free transport to the airport

title: Excellent
review: This train makes getting into the city SO easy It was great It is very well maintained and is very clean

title: Very Easy to Use
review: Very easy to use to start your trip into the city  When you get to the Airport Rail Link you will need to buy circle pass (looks and feels like a coin)  [3 Rail systems in Bangkok  each rail system is different so your pass on one does not work on the other 2] Very modern and clean system  A delight to use

title: Very convenient
review: Extremely convenient and cheap mode of transport if your hotel is centrally located Easily accessible quick and clean I highly recommend

title: Very quick
review: In less than 30min from phaya Thai station to the airport  only 45 bats Nice train If you worry about the traffic of Bangkok I think is the best choice to the airport

title: Cheap way to get to Central Bangkok & taxi to your destination.
review: Regular service to Central Bangkok so you can taxi or tuk tuk to your destination depending on where you are staying We stayed near khosan Rd so we jumped off at last stop and then got a taxi there for 200 bhts

title: Amazing!
review: Best to take if you only have 2 bags coz it might get a little packed especially during peaked hours I love how the train station is just at the basement of the airport which is so convenient for travellers  Security guards are very approachable and always willing to help passengers especially those who are not familiar with the tickettoken system

title: Best way to get to airport at cheap price
review: Cheap and fast good AC Arrival in the terminal cant be better Clean sometimes quite crowded but still ok

title: Cheap and fast
review: Avoid the horrible traffic jam of Bangkok  Only $45 baht  Not to be missed  Try yourself to experience it

title: Best way to get into BKK Central and beat the traffic!

title: Very Convenient

title: Busy but efficient
review: Travelled from downtown to the airport on a Friday night Was very busy but cheap and efficient In less than an hour with much less stress than a taxi I travelled from my meeting in the centre of Bangkok and was at the checkin counter at the airport Yes I did stand most of the way but the AC was working well and there was enough space for my suitcase Will be using it again next time I visit

title: Take the train
review: It is very inexpensive and convenient to take the train in Bangkok It was clean quiet and people did not bother us We found it very convenient to use the Airport Rail Link from the airport to the part of the city our hotel was in from there we took a free shuttle boat right to the entrance of our hotel I recommend you look into both sources and if they are going towards your hotel or other places in your plans It will save you a lot of money on transportation

title: Satisfied
review: Used it 3 times so far and it is very cheap and convenient  In the peak hours it gets really packed but I still feel it offers great value for time and money   I’d use AIL over a taxi any day because traffic in Bangkok is just horrible

title: Very Easy Trip and Comfortable
review: Caught the train to the airport and It was very easy to buy tickets catch the train and miss all the Bangkok Traffic

title: Fantastic
review: So affordable and convenient I just wish it ran 247 but it doesn’t Very clean and quick I believe it starts at 6am and ends around midnight If you arrive at airport between 1 & 5 am you’ll have to take a taxi

title: Excellent and inexpensive way to get from airport to downtown
review: Signage is pretty clear ticket machines are easy to understand but you need cash Trains are clean but get crowded during rush hour with nonairport travelers Trains avoid traffic jams and are faster and cheaper than taxi

title: Cheapest way from/to BKK airport
review: For only 35 baths and 20 minutes to Makkasan station it is the cheapest and the fastest airport transfer fromto BKK and very easy to use

title: Best way to get to airport
review: Airport Rail link is the number 1 way to get to the airport  Fast cheap and easy Traffic jams can be terrible in Bangkok taxis costs up to ten times more And you save lots of time and stress when you take the airport rail link to the airport

title: Very convenient
review: This was the first time I used the service and find it very useful and cheap The link with the skytrain make it super convenient Won't use taxi anymore to and from the airport

title: well organised and easy to access from anywhere.
review: I found the Airport Rail Link to be the best and fastest way to get you into the main city center and cheaper compared to the Taxis where you have to pay toll

title: Easy to take to get to airport in time
review: Purchase ticket at counter If you take Metro before you have to purchase a ticket at Metro and later at Airport Rail Link

title: Beat the Traffic
review: Its fast easy very inexpensive mode of transport to get from the airport to the city Normally it would take you a minimum of an hour or maybe more depending in what time of the day you travel Gets into the city (Phaya Thai is the last station and you can get the BTS from there) in 30 mins has 6 stops along the way

title: Airport Rail Link Great Wat to Get to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: If you don't have many luggage and can travel when airport link is availabe Airport Rail Link is fast and Cheap

title: Great way to get to airport
review: Forget taxis or grab take the rail  Cheap easy and fast  Rush hour can be crazy if you take the sky train and commuters will hate you for bringing lots of luggage but other times go for it

title: Easy, Fastest and Economical
review: The Airport Rail Link connectivity is easy to reach Silom  The return trip also was without any hassles

title: Love the airlink
review: I wish my country had such a great transportation system When i go back home to the US I feel like im in a 3rd world country

title: Fast service
review: I came into town on a Friday night and decided to take the train into town I was in downtown within 30 min Great way to travel into town from the airport Cheap to

title: Cheap, convenient and efficient
review: The airport rail is a efficient travel method to avoid the bad jam in bkk during peak hour It is cheap and very convenient if you are traveling by from the main airport Highly recommended

title: Fastest and cheap
review: If you are heading to airport and city you can easily get by train It was the fastest cheapest and comfortable way minus the traffic

title: Accessible and efficient
review: The train is easy to locate in the airport and connects with the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok which is great Very affordable at just 45 baht to ride airport to the last stop

title: Quick and cheap
review: Second review on second return use When arriving go all the way down the escalators to the bottom floor for ARL (all signposted) Use the ticket machines  I think the maximum note they take is 100 Baht  and buy ticket to destination I was travelling to Si Lom so went to Makkasan then used the overpass walkway to Phetchaburi for the MRT link to Silom ARL fare was 35 Baht and similar on MRT I travelled with medium sized case and a carry on case and didn't find the occasional stairs much of a hindrance Travel time for the ARL was around 25 minutes  total time to Si Lom around 45 minutes Excellent service for the solo traveller

title: Convenient.. time-saving...
review: The airport rail link is located at the lowest level of Suvarnabhumi Airport Just follow the signs  Buy your token from the machines or at the counter  There is ample space for luggage and passengers If your hotel is in the shopping belt area then take to Phaya Thai station and transfer to the BTS line It takes about 40 minutes from airport to Phaya Thai It sure saves money and most definitely time as you may get stuck in Bangkok’s snarling jams

title: Excellent
review: Great service linking the airport to central Bangkok  am certain is cheaper and quicker then other transportation  Can get busy during rush hour

title: Clean and organized train system
review: Clean Stations Very Organized professional staff Train stop information was very easy to understand

title: Efficient
review: A good way of travelling to & fro airport into the city of Bangkok From airport to Phaya Thai only 45 Baht No traffic jam cheap convenient Only set back is have to stand from the airport to the destination as many tourists with luggage pack the train unless you are first few in queue Easy to buy tickets too The ticket comes in a coin form

title: I like it
review: It is soooo convenient if you stay in the hotels in center of Bangkok Or taking the Rail link to Phayathai ( last station) then take taxi or BTS from there Taxi costs about 60100 Baths to Khaosan area

title: Quick, easy, convenient
review: If you stay closeby the BTS network in the central area of Bangkok the Airport Rail is the easiest quickest and most convenient way to reach the airport Plus it's clean comfortable and safe It takes you straight fromto the international airport No hassle no traffic jams Small fare ticket Highly recommended

title: Speedy, fast & clean
review: Bit of a culture shock using the Bangkok rapid transit where pushing & shoving to board is frowned upon The ARL provides a great alternative to negotiating the hell of Bangkok highways & is so much cheaper than taking a cab

title: Excellent service
review: It is simple to use from buying the tickets to finding the stations and exiting Very clean too Why bother with a cab when this is available

title: Fast and convenient
review: If you travel light and are easily mobile this is the way to go the Airport Rail Link takes you to and from the airport to major hub Praya Thai  BTS Skytrain station where you can connect to various other destinations  The fee is very nominal at 45 Baht (about USD 140)  It only takes a few minutes to get to and from the airport to town  The train is clean comfortable and air conditioned  On my departure date it was pouring rain and the elevator at one of the BTS stations did not work  So that was quite an ordeal  Other than that I would take this mode of transportation again next time I am in Bangkok

title: So convenient and cheap
review: Instead of taking a taxi I normally take the Airlink to get to Bangkok central place It is a mere 50 baht compared to a taxi ride that could easily cost you about 500 baht It is fast and hassle free You can take your luggage with you too  as long as it does not bother other passengers

title: Great!
review: The best and most effective way to get from aiport to Bangkok ans vica versa It is also quite cheap with a ticket from aiport to last station being 45 bath Great

title: Convenient and fast!!
review: If you need to go to  bangkok centre from airport use airport rail link to reach the connection with BTS sky train It is convenient cheap and help to save your time (if go somewhere by taxi you will stuck somewhere due to traffic jam)

title: What is that little black plastic token all about??
review: Rail link is safe fast and convenient way to get downtown Read other reviews about all that  Let's talk about how to actually pay and get the magical black plastic token  1  Once you pick up your bags at BKK follow the train signs (2 signs  one red and one blueboth go to same underground entrance)  2  Signs take you down 23 floors vi multiple moving sidewalks 3 Follow the clearly labelled signs to entrance of trains 4  Look for electronic kiosks to purchase your black plastic token Kiosks look like ATMs will generally have people lined up and they do have English speaking attendants helping  5  At the kiosk you select your station number of people pay and out comes a black plastic token for each person  (Check YouTube for videos on how to use kiosks) 6 Follow signs to turnstile and place the black plastic token against the turnstile sensor The gate will open  7  KEEP TOKEN DO NOT THROW AWAY  8  When you get to your destination and exit the train you will encounter another turnstileyou have to deposit the black plastic token into the slot to open the turnstile's gate  SUMMARY at turnstile 1 (airport)  black plastic token uses RFID sensor to open gate KEEP TOKEN at turnstile 2 (your destination) deposit black plastic token into slot to open turnstile gate  Easy peazy lemon squeezy

title: Easy transport link to thr city

title: Fast mode

title: Airport
review: Very convenient to transport to airport and the fare is reasonable Very clean inside cabin and comfortable seat

title: Very efficient and very cheap transport to and from the airport

title: Efficient and fast way to the city
review: Boarded the Airport Rail Link from BKK airport and got into the city within an hour Easy and jamfree way to get to the city

title: Efficient and cool
review: Cheap efficient clean and airconditioned Very easy to use with no fear of being harassed Great way to start your stay in Bangkok

title: Easy to and no worry getting into BKK cities
review: Once you arrive at  Suvarnabhumi airport Do go down to the basement  If you not sure do look out on the sign board which will guide you to the airport link (ARL)  Queue up to buy the token (ticket) which cost 45baht to get into Praya Thai station which is interchange with BTS For those accommodation is nearby

title: Better than a taxi
review: On previous visits to Bangkok we've always used the airport limousines to travel from the airport to central Bangkok However these are slow due to the traffic and also very expensive This time we decided to try the airport rail link and it was great The station is in the basement of the airport and it was only 45B each to travel to Phaya Thai station at the end of the line From there it was one stop on the skytrain to our accommodation It was a short walk from the rail link to the BTS and there were lifts so we didn't have to carry our suitcases up and down stairs I wouldn't recommend it if you have mobility issues or small children but we will definitely use this rail link again next time we're in Bangkok

title: Convenient Transportation to Central Bangkok
review: Tried boarding the airport rail link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Makkasan Station during my arrival in Bangkok I can say that it is the best option if you are avoiding the rigorous Bangkok traffic jams It is cheap too When you ride the airport rail link just be prepared to have someone bringing large suitcases onboard the journey It is also the fastest mode of transportation to or from Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Used this from the airport arriving from Krabi to Sukhumvit.
review: Quick way to get from airport if not early in morning Ensure there is a lift at the station your going to We were at Asoke and had to get our cases down the stairs as lift was broke hard going

review: Best and easiest way to get to and from the airport Saves tons of time because traffic in Bangkok can be as bad as traffic in Los Angeles if not more The journey is about 35 mins depending on which area you are staying in Bangkokand most likely you will have to change trains but it is super convenient and easy to get around I really enjoyed Bangkoks public transportation Nice to use other methods besides a Tuk Tuk Enjoy the ride

review: Easy to access from airport once cleared customs just take escalator down stairs to station buy token and go to train any problem the staff will help you I found this a very easy way to get to sukhumvit road Askoe station

review: I have my first experience with the air port rail link few months back the station is at the downtown in the heart of city whereby you easily connect to shopping plaza entertainment center grand palace street food premium restaurant The connection to BTS(Sky train) MRT(Sub train) Bus Taxi is connected at the station The cleanliness of the train itself is good even though it been use for many years I personally impress and do not expect more than that

title: 35Baht from Makassan MRT to Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Fast and Cheap
review: We found this was the best way to travel from and to the airport  Fast and efficient and much cheaper than taxi You get a token from the ticket machine and scan it to get through barriers to get on train  Highly recommend

title: Convenient and reliable
review: The ARL train runs fr the airport to Phay Thai in Bangkok It takes 30 mins and cost 45b Fr 1 nov 2018 all tickets must be purchased fr the auto ticket machine From Phay Thai the terminal station you can change to BTS train to get around Bangkok Pl note that the ARL ticket is different fr the BTS ticket It is a reliable way to get to the airport if you are worried about getting stuck in the famous Bangkok traffic jams

title: good transport

title: Efficient
review: A quicker and cheaper way to arrive downtown than a taxi Efficient clean inexpensive Exactly what would be needed in each large airport

title: Convenient transportation
review: The airport link is a convenient way to travel to & from airport We took a ride when heading home Just take BTS to Phaya Thai station Pay a separate fee to take the railway link It’s fast cheap and avoids Bangkok traffic

title: The best public transportation means between the airport and city
review: Whenever we travel to Bangkok we would use ARL fromto the city and Suvarnabhumi airport since it was opened more than 8 years ago which is the most convenient and low cost way to reach both destinations and at Phaya Thai station where can be semi interchanged with BTS skytrain system literally bring you to down town area and many parts of the city Can't imagine without it even though sometimes it could be overcrowding in the train carriage during the weekends and holidays

title: Good

title: Quick, clean, cheap.
review: The old Airport bus shuttle has stopped now but this is an excellent replacement Not much point in getting the 'express' version so just get on the City rail link line which takes you into town and work out before hand which is the best line to transfer to once in town (Skytrain  MRT)

title: Fastest and cheapest way from airport to the city.
review: Airport Rail Link is the fastest and cheapest way from Suvarnabuhmi airport to the city (it costs only 45 Thai Baht and around 30 minutes) Then you could take BTS skytrain to most of the popular tourist areas However if you have too much luggage to carry it's better to call a taxi from the airport to go directly to your hotel as it might be too difficult for carry luggages to walk down stairs

title: Used this twice
review: Used this train service twice and it puts Britain to shame with its downright efficiency Very inexpensive fast  comfortable and clear maps  Made our first visit to Asia easier

title: Life Saver  😂
review: This is the easiest and the best way to get to and out from Bangkok to Suvarnabhumi airport Takes more than 30 mins to reach airport Located in the Ground floor of the airport ( to go to Bangkok )  Departs from Payathai Bts station ( to go to  Suvarnabhumi airport )  Costs 45 Baht per person Enjoy Bangkok 👍👍

title: The Best, Cheapest and Quickest Transfer to the City
review: The Airport Rail Link is a Commuter rail line between Suvarnabhumi Int'l Airport and Bangkok City (Phaya Thai is the endstation) From the End Station (Phaya Thai)  you can take the BTS Skytrain (Sukhumvit Line) or from Makkasan train Station you can take the Metro (MRT PhetchaburiBlue Line) and it is the cheapest quickest and best way to go from the airport to the city (and then with MRTmetro or BTSSkytrain you can go everywhere in the city)  The Airport Rail Link operates from 0600 until 2400 (midnight) every 10 minutes in the rush hours(06000900 & 16002000) and every 15 minutes off peak hours and weekends I found the Airport Rail Link the best and quickest connection between airport and the city and vice versa and I will use it again if I will visit Bangkok again

title: Airport Rail Link
review: The Link is an excellent public transportation traveling to and from BKK avoiding the usual traffic jams of Bangkok The fare is very reasonable 45 Baht one way and would be fantastic if the fare can be combined with BTS in a prepaid card system like in many other cities

title: Super easy to use
review: We opted for the Airport Rail Link after we returned to Bangkok (the first time we used a taxi)  The total cost for two people from the airport to the last stop (Phaya Thai) was 90 baht total  It took about 25 minutes to go from the airport to Phaya Thai where we used the BTS to get near our hotel  It was a pretty stress free experience and ended up being cheaper than a taxi from the airport for us   We did take a taxi from the airport when we first initially got to Bangkok For perspective a taxi from the airport is 50 baht airport fee + 75 in tolls + whatever the metered fare is as of November 2017 Our metered fare to Sukhumvit Soi 2 (JW Marriott) was ~140 baht so the total for the cab trip we took when we initially got to Bangkok was ~265 baht for the taxi vs ~170 baht (90 for airport rail link and 80 for BTW) to our hotel upon returning to Bangkok (this is for 2 people)    The Rail Link also means you don't have to deal with the taxi cab drivers For the most part we didn't have a problem with them refusing to use the meter but it did happen to us twice (took about 8 cabs in Bangkok total)

title: Best way to get into city

title: Easy and cheap
review: Super easy to use convenient and clean I recommend it as the best way to get into town if you don't have too much luggage

title: super easy and cheap way to/from airport

title: Easy to use

title: Very convenient, save time

title: Cheap and convenient

title: Airport Rail Link Ride

title: easy way

title: Easiest and cheapest way into the city

review: This is the best way to get into central Bangkok by far Cheap trip from airport around 40 baht Bargain

title: easy transfers from airport to the city
review: Tried this rail link earlier in the year and found it a very convenient way to travel from airport to the city and very cheap compared to a taxi plus no traffic to slow your journey as it is the terminal stop you should get a seat all the way to the BTS station in the city then either go to the road to catch bus or taxi to your hotel or see if your destination is near BTS station

title: Fast, easy and cheap way to get to the airport
review: A fast ecological and economical way to get to the airport (BKK) from the centre of Bangkok35 Bathperson

title: Fast And Efficient
review: The Airport Rail Link connects  Suvarnabhumi Airport  with downtown Bangkok terminating at Payathai station where it connects with the BTS skytrain Previous station connects with the Bangkok Metro  Trains run in each direction about every 20 minutes and the journey takes less than one hour Trains are spacious and fares are extremely low

title: The best, cheapest and fasted way to and from the airport to the city.
review: For THB45 this service links the BTS and MRT systems with Subanaphurmi airport It takes only 30' from Phaya Thai BTS station with the airport with no traffic jams Beware it doesn't run 24 hrs Only from 0600 until midnight

title: BTS Bound
review: This is the train that I used to get to the BTS line  I have posted video of a portion of my ride on You Tube channel "I Went There"

title: Improved and easy to use from the airport
review: Before it was changed to a single line it used to be two types of lines (yellow and red the more direct one quite expensive and not worth the expense if you were more than 2) It has now become easy and inexpensive (50 THB for the longest commute) It is designed for both travelers and commuters working outside BKK so yes it can be busy at times and seemingly crowded if you are carrying pieces of luggage but it is quicker than any other ground transportation Easy access airconditioned helping staff all around it is highly recommended for a troublefree ride from the airport I tend to take a taxi when I go from city to airport but it mostly depends on the time of the day the state of the traffic and your location within the city in relation to the train stations andor the highways) I guess that accessing the carriages at peak hour with luggage when you are not starting from the first station (when the train is empty) can be very challenging and frustrating both for yourself and the locals My recommendation when you arrive by plane in BKK train then taxi

title: Fast clean and efficient
review: Fastest way to commute from Bangkok airport to anywhere in the city Frequency to suit busiest schedule would recommend

title: Quick cheap and convenient
review: This is the quickest and the cheapest way to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport to central Bangkok You can transfer to MRT at Makkasan and BTS at Phaya Thai

title: Good option to get into town
review: Easily access from Suvarnabhumi airport Going downstairs and follow the signs you will soon see ARL counter It's the best option for me when going into town

title: Convenient link to Bangkok!
review: One of the most convenient form of transportation going to Bangkok No traffic and inexpensive Best for budget travelers

title: very fast and low price for expat
review: You come very fast from airport in the city and can cange to BTS or MRT Service Better than taxi they stay every time in traffic jam

title: Do it!
review: Fast and very much cheaper than a taxi  Comfortable and air conditioned with good links to other subway and trains  Absolutely use this

title: Good ride!
review: Took this when I went to Or Tor Kor Market for my durian fix coming back from Krabi  Just like BTS it was clean and a hasslefree ride  Unlike BTS this will require a token which you can get from the token counter Just say your destination and the counter staff will give you the equivalent token of your ride’s cost  Hop on hop off Easypeasy 😉

title: Convenient for tourist
review: 2nd time using train to bangkok its only cost you 40 baht if you go to pratunam area look for ratchaprarop station where pratunam is nearby Its really convenient

title: Fastest way to get to the center
review: Cheap fast and easy  for me it was the best way to get from airport to center of bangkok  Every 15 min you get a train to the center and also from center back to airport

title: Nothing Better
review: Since it’s introduction this has proven to be by far the best way if reaching the city from the airport Gone are the da6s of sitting in a taxi in the Bangkok traffic while trying to reach your hotel The Airport Link whisks you into the city in 30 min The notsogood news on the horizon is that train maintenance appears to be falling by the wayside and the express link has now been stopped Hopefully the government will correct this

title: Great and fast way to get to the Airport
review: Great and fast way to get to the Airport Great services always on time runs regularly and air conditioned

title: Better than a taxi in every way
review: If you're going to our from the airport this should be your only option It's faster than a taxi into or from anywhere in BKK and really cheap   No more half hour traffic jams You can thank me later

title: PERFECT WAY IN AND OUT OF THE AIRPORT.
review: I used this four times  It is easy cheap clean on time and very very convenient You just need to know which station you will need to get off to connect to the BTS

title: Easy and convenient
review: Great system 45 baht straight into the city Trains are frequent and took around 30 minutes   Location is easy to find when exiting from the airport Take the lift down to the lowest level and purchase a token from the booth

title: Fastest and cheapest way in from BKK airport
review: 45 baht to end of line (Phaya Thai) Comfortable (except rush hour if you get on at station not endofline) and pretty quick Outdoorselevated so you can look out during journey

title: good one
review: easy way to reach airport  economical and cool way  don't go in car there are 75% chances of struck in the traffic

title: easy and cheap and fast
review: I was surprised how easy it was to take that train Large spaces to put suit cases public toilets in the train  very good way to get down townBangkok

title: Quick way to reach Airport
review: Fantastic service goes absolutely inside the airport and runs on time Saves so much of time in the traffic and is very affordable means of travel

title: Best trip from the airport to down town
review: Any time I can take the airport link I will It's much faster than taxi Not have to worry about delays from tragic jams Easy to use to connect with MRT BTS If you travel with one check bag its perfect

title: excellent connection downtown Bangkok
review: The easiest way to start your trip in Thailand After arrival customs and luggage you follow the signs Airport Rail Link You may use the moving ways al the way down to the basement of the airport or with loads of luggage you take the elevator down

title: Simple and fast
review: So simple so cheap book railway from airport to bring us to phaya thai to go to know San road just got a quick taxi from there

title: Cheap and fast way to get to the city centre
review: You can be in the city centre in 30 min from Suvarnabhumi airport Trains are clean fast and cheap This is probably best way to get from the airport

title: Cheap transfer to city center
review: Last time to Bangkok we took a taxi  it took us 1h and cost about 800 Baht  This time we used the ARL Tickets were much cheaper (about 60 Baht each) and the transfer to the City center took us 30 min  It is easy to reach on the first floor of the airport and handling is selfexplanatory  So clear recommendation of the ARL

title: Ultra Convenient
review: The rail is key if you want to move from the Airport after customs into Bangkok city or downtown just keep in mind once you get there the traffic is hectic so have a plan

title: Awesome and free when I rode
review: I had to go to the airport on Oct 25 2017 so I rode the Airport Rail Link   It happened to be the day before the king's cremation and it was free to ride that day as a result The train was also not very full in the middle of the day when I was riding   The system is clean efficient and easy to use but when you're standing on the platform it's not overly clear which direction the train is travelling Luckily I asked a local who let me know I was headed in the right direction   I then rode the same train back into the city and had a similarly great experience This is a great way to avoid Bangkok's eternal gridlock and stop and go traffic

title: Fast and Efficient
review: The airport rail link is a great transport that connects directly from the airport to several stations along the track till Phaya Thai It is fast efficient and economical to travel especially for lone tourist who wants to make it to the Airport avoiding the jams

title: Best way into the city
review: This is the easiest and best way into the city costing about 2 English pounds it’s so much cheaper than the taxis which i took the first time round in Bangkok it’s direct quick and no traffic and stoped right outside are hotel would recommend taking the time to follow the signs to the rail link

title: Stress and traffic free way of travelling to and from the airport
review: Highly recommended if you are travelling alone or as a couple preferably with small luggage Tickets can be bought from ticket machines or the ticket office before entering the barrier  If you have heavy luggage you would have to look for a lift I have used it to travel to and from Phayathai Station and change to BTS There are 6 stops on the way and total journey time is about 30 minutes Cost is 45 Baht The carriage can get quite crowded midway because of the stops in between Getting on at the airport or Phayathai means that you are most likely going to get a seat For transfer to BTS you have to go one level down from rail to BTS and it is well signposted it is about a 5 minute walk with luggage from platform to platform

title: Same as the BTS
review: I used this to transfer to BTS and MRT It was exciting and easy to navigate You can buy the coin tickets easily by telling he cashier your destination And the fare is really reasonable too

title: One of the best in the world
review: I cannot stop raving about the airport rail link and always recommend people taking this transportation over taxis if their hotels are located near Train or BTS stations and if they don't have too much luggage The service offers great views it's incredibly clean and well managed efficient on time and despite massive crowds at time it's always pleasant to travel in Highly recommended

title: Only way into town.
review: Bangkok traffic is a nightmare  When going into town make sure you use the rail link if you can  Traveling by road into Bangkok can take any amount of time  It is not measureable  Realiable quick and safe

title: A great way of getting from the aiport to the city centre
review: It cost 35 baht to travel from Suvarnabhumi airport to Makkasan city terminal in about 20 mins then 150 baht by taxi to get to Sukhumvit Soi 4  Taxi all the way is around 500 baht and takes just as long and sometimes much longer  I had to stand all the way as there are a limited number of seats  Although there is a city line and an express line (limited stop) only the city line was working on the day I used it  On return I hailed a taxi to take me to Makkasan but he agreed to take me all the way to the airport for 400 baht so I accepted  air conditioned comfort and a door to door service won me over

title: Cheap, efficient and fast
review: For 45thb you get into the city  disembarking at Phaya Thai and from there take a 5 minute walk to catch the BTS service  which will get you most of the places in the city for another 45thb or under Best thing  you avoid the traffic snarl Great service

title: Quick and easy way to get to centre of Bangkok
review: Used this service travelling from Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai station When my girlfriend and I arrived the express service was not available so opted for the ordinary rail line 90 Baht each way per person for a comfortable air conditioned cabin and swiftly arrived in the centre of Bangkok We then got a short taxi ride to our hotel would definitely recommend

title: Super Service
review: The Airport rail link is the best for me because the hotel lobby Nasa vegas is close to Airport rail link

title: Efficient jam free travel to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: This is a bargain 45 Baht all the air conditioned way into Bangkok and transfer to BTS at Phaya Thai This has transformed the journey from Bangkoks' new airport I see that another Airport Rail Link is being built to Don Mueang International Airport as well The Thais do not shy from creating excellent infrastructure (unlike Vancouver BC)

title: Fast, cheap, clean
review: Fast cheap clean  It's kind of quaint you get a plastic token which you put in when you get to the airport of your stop downtown

title: Bangkok Airport Train
review: It was so convenient after travelling from Melbourne via Singapore to Bangkok to be able to follow the signs to the Airpot Train Station Train arrived shortly afterwards and after security checked the train we boarded without fuss

title: Smooth transfer
review: Easy to use and Is only cost 45 Bht for the whole trip  Recommend it for rush hour or if you worry about being ripped off by taxi

title: Great Way to Get to Downtown Bangkok Quickly
review: I travel to Bangkok International Airport 2 or 3 times a year I always take the airport rail link to the BTS I enjoyed the express service but unfortunately it is no longer an option however the city line is still way better than taking a taxis and only adds 15 minutes more to the final destination And it is a cheap (45 baht) and efficient way to travel to the city of Bangkok

title: Easy to use
review: Used during a long layover Got us quickly and cheaply to connect to another rail line  It is faster and cheaper than using a taxi

title: Easy, fast and cheap
review: Not too much to say really it was easy enough to find where we needed to go and we'd never been before and was cheap and efficient

title: Very convient to use.
review: My husband and I have been in Bangkok a couple of times and always say how assessable this city is with the bts the airport rail etc It connects together so simply and makes every outing enjoyable and simple to use The shuttle is on the lowest floor of the airport You purchase your ticket and take it to the BTS  which is its last stop You then hope on the bts sky train and get to your hotel very quick and simply with no strees at all We will be taking this back to airport as well You save a ton of money and time doing it this way You don't have to battle the traffic o sit in a long cab ride
